story:
Hello Everyone!  Thanks for stopping by and checking out our IndieGoGo Crowdfunding Campaign for Season 6 of Venice!  I can’t thank you enough for your continued support!

 

This season is Special!  Why? “Gina” and “Ani” are on their honeymoon.  Ah, love is in the air! They are in New Orleans when something unexpected comes up and off they go to New York City where Ani’s career is about to take off at Monde Femme, the famous but struggling fashion magazine.   How will the newly married couple cope with the shift in roles? Ani’s new found Stardom and Gina’s role of supporting wife. Ani’s new boss, Holland Case, has her own agenda with Monde Femme and possibly Ani.

 

When circumstances take the ladies to New Jersey and a Less than Empty haunted farmhouse,  Gina finds herself not so alone and calls in some of her Venice Beach peeps to help solve whatever isn't happy!  Richard, who is there for a Guest Speakership at a local University, meets an intriguing stranger. Sarah comes with him but her agenda involves her first love, Zoe, who now works at Monde Femme.  Will cupid strike twice for these young lovers? Meanwhile, there’s a very dangerous energy seeping into everyone’s morning coffee! No one should mess with Gina’s morning coffee!

 

Guya, Jamie, Katherine and some very special guests fill out the cast and season! This season will be full of mystery, love, romance…..Ten (Twenty) minute episodes too!  Although, Gina and Ani had to travel many miles from Venice Beach, Venice Beach will always come to them and they make their way home!

 

2019 is the 10th Anniversary of the cancellation of Guiding Light.  It was the Otalia story that inspired me to create “Venice”. I want to make this season even more special by paying homage to GL and Otalia! People, Locations and maybe a wink and a nod to Guiding Light trivia.

 

I love employing women!  Its important to me to give woman opportunities that may otherwise be harder for them to get.  Being a woman, I know how challenging it can be. So, yes, some very key positions on crew will be female-centric as will much of the stories!   

 

 I hope season 6 will make folks laugh, cry and remember that ALWAYS….Love is Love!  #LGBTQAI

 

Thanks for supporting!  We have some amazing Perks this season!  We love getting together at Meet and Greets, Pillow Parties, Gutter Party Bus Ride, wine tasting,  Grab a coffee….dinners, lunches…..as well as cool shirts, hats, calendars...So much ahead!!! So, keep checking back with us!

Remember, help us spread the word about our campaign and share the campaign on social media!!

story:
Story:

Hi everyone! My name is Nikki Hudgens and I’m a graduate student in Loyola Marymount University's Writing and Producing for Television MFA. I also need your help to make the sizzle reel for my half-hour dark comedy series—So Fucking Funny- a reality.

So Fucking Funny is told through the stand-up of Jules “AfroDite” Carter,  the queen of 70s comedy porn who regains full-custody of her estranged son after her mother’s untimely death, just as she ages out of the industry.

This project is gritty, raunchy and unapologetically flawed, just like Jules and I can’t wait to share her story with you; it’s unlike anything you’ve ever seen, I assure you. My goal is to raise five thousand dollars; if you donate a hundred dollars or more you will receive a So Fucking Funny T-Shirt and donors of fifty dollars or more will receive a So Fucking Funny Poster, though all donations are much needed and very much appreciated.  

Thank you for giving a few of your hard-earned coins to my humble little comedy—it will make a massive impact. Thanks again! Peace. 

Where the Money Goes:

Your donations help fund location rentals, crew equipment, craft services, elements of production design, amazing actors and so much of the key aspects it takes to make a killer piece a reality. Thank you in advance for your kind contributions!

story:
Before we begin, if you haven't seen our Pilot episode, check it out now below, you'll love it.
 
 
 
Then check out Celestial Explorations!
 

 

 

Short Summary

Our last campaign reached 110% of our goal and helped us get our pilot episode "Celestial Misconduct" seen in film festivals all across the country, and there are still many festivals to go. It's been an incredibly exciting run so far and we can't thank those who donated to our initial campaign enough. 

But, we want to keep going. The exploits of Donovan Mulray are far from over. There is so much more story to tell, you won't be disappointed.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $5000 to make "Celestial Orientation." This modest budget will go a long way in securing locations, actors and making our post production go smoothly.

This is a more ambitious production than our pilot episode. More characters, locations, and special effects. It's a much bigger story that we are about to tell which is both very exciting and just a bit daunting. Even if we don't make our goal, we can make use of any assistance you are able to offer, be it just $5 or $10. Anything helps, and we will love you forever and always.

 

The Impact

With the success of "Celestial Misconduct" we have become emboldened as filmmakers to continue to tell our unique brand of stories. If you're a fan of our irreverent, quirky storytelling help us keep going on this journey. Things are only going to get bigger, better and much weirder from here.

We want you to get weird with us.

Risks & Challenges

Beginning any film is like going into battle. We are going to face last minute issues and road blocks that we will have to plow through, and hopefully everyone is going to make it out alive. Your financial contributions will simply be the difference between going into battle with water balloons or with swords. We would prefer swords, but we will use whatever we have at our disposal.

*There will be no literal battle and no one will be killed, this was a metaphor.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that some of you simply cannot afford to donate, and that's completely fine too. You can still help us by liking and sharing our content with your friends and family, and even people you don't much like too much. Just getting the word out about our project to anyone that will listen would be incredibly helpful to us.

If you have not done so already, please...

become a Donofan today.

story:
SYNOPSIS

 

When manipulating sociopath, Alex, checks himself into the same rehab as Haylee, his fag-hag best friend that he pinned a crime on, it’s going to take a lot of blackmailing in order for her to not only forgive him, but to also help find a way to pay off the crack-crazed drug dealer that awaits them both on the outside. The two friends will be forced to confront if their friendship can survive their personal addictions and the separate ways in which they’re attempting to deny them. 

Meanwhile, dealing with the hidden abuse of his relationship, Carter prepares himself for an audition into a creative arts school... as a drag queen. Unaware of where this world may eventually take him, Carter's naivety may come at a cost far greater than anyone else's. Meanwhile, Jake uses his authority as a police officer to take his internalised anger out on those around him without consequence. But for how long can someone keep up the act of protect and serve when he's already abusing the ones that he claims to love?
 

A LITTLE HIS-TORY

 


 

Is addiction stronger than love, or is love simply another addiction?

This is a question that has followed me around for most of my life. Was I truly in love with the ones that seemed to hurt me most, or was I just addicted to the feelings only they could seemingly provide? Why did some of my friends fall down the rabbit hole and never return? Did I ever really return?

My story is somewhat universal, but the specifics are where it gets a little dangerous.

I'm not the first to fall in love and I'm not the last to have had my heart broken...but have you ever had a police officer, going through a meth rage, demand that you come and meet him out on the street or be forced to deal with the consequences of him putting a bullet into his skull...all the while telling you how much he loved you?  An abuse of power that went down a far darker path than I could have imagined...

Have you had your head bashed in and been left for dead, your closest friends being too lost in a sea of parties, drugs and semen (gross, but fair) to be able to come and check on you?

It took me leaving the country and fleeing from all of my 'addictions' to clearly see what was right and wrong for me...and even over there I was still a deeply flawed human being, but it should make for some fascinating television.

'COMMITTED' is an extremely raw and personal story about my life, my friends, my enemies, our addictions, and all the dramas that unfolded around us.  (Yes, I was responsible for a lot of them). The story of four lives, all connected through the worst of ways, doing their best to stay alive and to stay addicted without consequence.

Please watch the video above to see a few teasers from test scenes we have already shot and to get even more of an idea of the story! Please see below to see how YOU are the true driving force behind this project.
 

WE'RE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER,

(PERKS INCLUDED)

 

 

'COMMITTED' is a project dependent on community involvement and that's why our perks reflect as such. We would love to invite you along to wrap parties, drag shows, the post production suite and even to have your make up done by one of Sydney's most fabulous drag queens.

If you're a fan of the creative process, we're also able to offer; signed copies of the script, invitations to be a background artist on set, audio commentary of the pilot episode and many other great incentives (SO CHECK THEM OUT)

 

YOU CAN BE THE DIFFERENCE

 

In the diagram below you can gain a clearer understanding of where your contribution funds will be heading. We have a substantial budget to ensure this pilot episode can be told with justice and to potentially help see Committed get picked up for further developing funding in Australia!

 

 

THE TRUE MEANING OF 'CRACK-MAS'
 

'COMMITTED', to me, is the opportunity to tell stories that have completely altered and changed the trajectory of my life and the lives around me. A lot of it was very dark, but the moments of love in there are what has allowed me to help me write and shape this into a television show that has many themes and controlling ideas that need to be explored further... hopefully with my unique take on it.

Sydney is currently going through an ice-epidemic. 18 year olds are growing up in a culture of drugs and grindr and not much else social interaction. Drag as an art form is being celebrated via 'Ru Paul's Drag Race'. But where is the conversation about the men behind the make-up? Who is showing the next generation of the gay community what it takes to survive? Do any of us even really know how to? 

Having spent the last few years developing these scripts, working on multiple short films, honing my skills as a director and throwing myself into every creative challenge that has come my way, it has brought me to this moment.

It is time to share COMMITTED with not just you wonderful donators, but hopefully to the entire gay community and to all our wonderful allies and supporters.

Thank you,

Curtis Lee

story:
Sumário

SANTY PONTO COM,  uma comédia pura, conta a história de Santiago, um jovem de 16 anos, completamente desajustado à realidade. Santiago é expulso, por equívoco, do colégio extremamente elitista onde estudou a vida inteira, após ter sido acusado de ter explodido a casa de banho.  Lara, mãe de Santiago decide que é altura de fazer o seu filho crescer e coloca-o numa escola pública, uma experiência que se revelará inédita para Santiago. É nesta escola que a realidade de Santiago e o mundo real colidem. Após uma breve pesquisa de “como ser fixe” o nosso protagonista descobre que a melhor maneira é ingressar num grupo e decide então juntar-se ao clube de futsal da escola sem nunca ter praticado qualquer tipo de desporto. Santiago acaba por ficar na equipa após o seu treinador que é uma espécie de Mister Miyagi ver nele um potencial oculto e a solução para os problemas da equipa. Santy.com é o blogue onde Santiago partilha com o mundo as suas aventuras e os seus pensamentos mais estranhos.

A Equipa:

Argumento- João Rodrigues Pereira; Pedro Souza; Pedro Mata; Andreia Pereira da Silva

Realização- João Pereira e Andreia Pereira da Silva

Guião- João Pereira, Andreia Pereira da Silva e Pedro Souza

Assistente de Realização- Caetana Serra

Anotador- Filipa Sousa

Produtor- Pedro Gomes

Directora de Produção - Diana Leite

Chefe de Produção - Vanessa Nunes

Assistente de Produção- Andreia Soares

Director de Fotografia - João Valentim Rodrigues

Operador de Câmara - Tiago Pacheco e Bruno Saraiva

Direcção de Arte- Mariana Dias

Montagem- João Valentim Rodrigues

Directora de Som- Inês Guimarães

O que precisamos

O nosso objectivo são 500€

  • 150€ Alimentação da Equipa 
  • 100€ Transportes
  • 50€ Licenças
  • 200€ Adereços para Arte da Série. 

      As filmagens decorrerão de 10 a 15 de maio.

 

O impacto da série

Esta é uma série virada para o público jovem com um cariz contemporâneo capaz de cativar também adultos. "Santy ponto com" tem uma linguagem da web para a web, 

 

Outras maneiras de ajudar

Divulgar as nossas redes sociais - Facebook https://www.facebook.com/Santy-Ponto-Com-209060... Instagram

www.instagram.com/santy_pontocom

Divulgar a nossa campanha do indiegogo

story:
My name is Terra. I have been camming for almost 3 years on various sites. Being a webcam model is something I am incredibly passionate about, as those of you who watch my shows can attest to.

I won a VIP Model Package to the XBiz Model Summit in Miami which means I get to go to TONS of great seminars to learn more about the industry and how to grow and improve my show. I am so excited about this opportunity but the prize does not include my flight to Miami. I really need YOUR help to get there! This campaign is to pay for my round trip flight to Miami, Florida and a little for some travel expenses that may come up. Your help will be rewarded!

story:
Short Summary

We are Chapstick Web Series, a comedic LGBTQ series that is trying to come back for a second season. We loved creating the first season and seeing the response we received. We can't wait to get back to work, creating Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.

Chapstick follows the lives of two best friends, Marlo and Addy, and their daily struggles of being artists, being women, liking women, and finding their place in this vast world. Fans have described the show as a "gay Broad City" and we were so blown away that someone would ever reference us to those queens!

Chapstick has been featured in publications such as: VICE, Curve Magazine, Snobby Robot, Study Breaks, LOTL, The Columbia Chronicle, and ScriptMag.

Chapstick Web Series was created by myself, Charlotte Kennett, and my co- creator, Kearney Fagan. Both Kearney and myself were Comedy Writing & Performance majors at Columbia College Chicago. We love to create comedic content, especially for the community we so strongly identify with: LGBTQ.

Kearney and myself always cast LGBTQ people in LGBTQ roles, we also try our best to crew our sets with as many LGBTQ people, females, and POC. We strive to give opportunities to the marginalized. When you invest in Chapstick you are investing in opportunities for LGBTQ people, females, and POC. 

We are launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise $1800 dollars. We need this money in order to create Season 2. Without it... we won't have a show that we feel good about.

We did the math (believe it or not) ... and IF every single one of our subscribers donates $1 we will reach our goal. 

If YOU donate $1 we will have a Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $1800 in order to create Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.
  • WHERE THE MONEY IS GOING: Equipment, Set Dec, Costumes, Food, and Locations.
  • We have some awesome perks for you to check out... A dinner with the creators, a personalized postcard, or an autographed copy of your favorite script.
  • If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still be put towards a show. We just might have less episodes in a Season due to lack of funding. So instead of a 10 or 12 episode season we might have a 6 or 8 episode season.

The Impact

Your contribution will be the difference between having a second season of Chapstick and not having a second season. Your donation of $1 (or more) goes a long way. Any way you can contribute to this campaign WILL HELP.

  • Chapstick is an important show for the world because the subject matter that we focus on needs more attention. We need to keep creating media for everyone, and that includes the LGBTQ community.
  • We have over 100,000 views on Youtube for Season 1! We think that's pretty great. It's clear that the show got a good reception and we are ready to create more content for our subscribers/ viewers.
  • Chapstick was created by two LGBTQ female filmmakers from Chicago. We love this show so much. We are so pleased to see that it has affected the community in a positive way. Any way we can strengthen the LGBTQ community is a good way. 
  • In general: more comedic content needs to be created for LGBTQ people. We need to have accurate representations in television.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks in creating comedic television, especially when it pertains to LGBTQ culture. The creators and the producers of this show take the task of creating a vulnerable and valid show very seriously. We promise that every episode is fully thought out and conscious of our viewers and the community.

We also risk not being able to create a second season if we can't reach our funding goal. Unfortunately, filming a web series takes time and money. We really want to be able to give our viewers high quality content and if we can't do it right: we don't want to do it at all.

Help us reach our goal and overcome the obstacles! If we fund hard we can make sure that season 2 happens!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because YOU can't donate DOESN'T mean you can't help us out.

EASY ways you can help Chapstick:

  • Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family! 
  • Share our video on your social media!
  • Like our video on Youtube!
  • Subscribe to our Youtube channel! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIBI32v05i3OlW...

Thank you so much!

XOXO,

Charlotte Kennett & Kearney Fagan

Creators of Chapstick Web Series
story_txt:
Short Summary
We are Chapstick Web Series, a comedic LGBTQ series that is trying to come back for a second season. We loved creating the first season and seeing the response we received. We can't wait to get back to work, creating Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.
Chapstick follows the lives of two best friends, Marlo and Addy, and their daily struggles of being artists, being women, liking women, and finding their place in this vast world. Fans have described the show as a "gay Broad City" and we were so blown away that someone would ever reference us to those queens!
Chapstick has been featured in publications such as: VICE, Curve Magazine, Snobby Robot, Study Breaks, LOTL, The Columbia Chronicle, and ScriptMag.
Chapstick Web Series was created by myself, Charlotte Kennett, and my co- creator, Kearney Fagan. Both Kearney and myself were Comedy Writing & Performance majors at Columbia College Chicago. We love to create comedic content, especially for the community we so strongly identify with: LGBTQ.
Kearney and myself always cast LGBTQ people in LGBTQ roles, we also try our best to crew our sets with as many LGBTQ people, females, and POC. We strive to give opportunities to the marginalized. When you invest in Chapstick you are investing in opportunities for LGBTQ people, females, and POC. 
We are launching this Indiegogo campaign to raise $1800 dollars. We need this money in order to create Season 2. Without it... we won't have a show that we feel good about.
We did the math (believe it or not) ... and IF every single one of our subscribers donates $1 we will reach our goal. 
If YOU donate $1 we will have a Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $1800 in order to create Season 2 of Chapstick Web Series.
WHERE THE MONEY IS GOING: Equipment, Set Dec, Costumes, Food, and Locations.

We have some awesome perks for you to check out... A dinner with the creators, a personalized postcard, or an autographed copy of your favorite script.
If we don't reach our goal, the funds will still be put towards a show. We just might have less episodes in a Season due to lack of funding. So instead of a 10 or 12 episode season we might have a 6 or 8 episode season.


The Impact
Your contribution will be the difference between having a second season of Chapstick and not having a second season. Your donation of $1 (or more) goes a long way. Any way you can contribute to this campaign WILL HELP.

Chapstick is an important show for the world because the subject matter that we focus on needs more attention. We need to keep creating media for everyone, and that includes the LGBTQ community.
We have over 100,000 views on Youtube for Season 1! We think that's pretty great. It's clear that the show got a good reception and we are ready to create more content for our subscribers/ viewers.
Chapstick was created by two LGBTQ female filmmakers from Chicago. We love this show so much. We are so pleased to see that it has affected the community in a positive way. Any way we can strengthen the LGBTQ community is a good way. 
In general: more comedic content needs to be created for LGBTQ people. We need to have accurate representations in television.


Risks & Challenges
There are always risks in creating comedic television, especially when it pertains to LGBTQ culture. The creators and the producers of this show take the task of creating a vulnerable and valid show very seriously. We promise that every episode is fully thought out and conscious of our viewers and the community.
We also risk not being able to create a second season if we can't reach our funding goal. Unfortunately, filming a web series takes time and money. We really want to be able to give our viewers high quality content and if we can't do it right: we don't want to do it at all.
Help us reach our goal and overcome the obstacles! If we fund hard we can make sure that season 2 happens!

Other Ways You Can Help
Just because YOU can't donate DOESN'T mean you can't help us out.
EASY ways you can help Chapstick:

Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family! 
Share our video on your social media!
Like our video on Youtube!
Subscribe to our Youtube channel! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIBI32v05i3OlW...


Thank you so much!
XOXO,
Charlotte Kennett & Kearney Fagan
Creators of Chapstick Web Series

story:
FrankenSITTER is an upcoming spooky, family-friendly web series being filmed July 2018 in Memphis, TN.

The story begins on Halloween night when a group of outcasts accidentally kill their babysitter. Using science and magic, they devise a plan and successfully bring her back to life…But the the plan only partially works: She is back with the living, but the kids notice something VERY different about her. She has changed into what we can only describe as something incredibly spooky.

In each 10-minute episode, the kids hope to fix their mistake only to discover that each time, Sam’s personality changes into something completely unexpected. One episode she might believe she is a zany 50s housewife, while in the next she becomes the world’s most powerful villain.

Every character the babysitter becomes throughout the series taps into a deep fear from one of the kids in the group. With teamwork, bravery and a lot of creativity, the friends overcome and stand up to each manifestation.

With a fun and spooky twist at the end, we hope to make you laugh, cry, and leave feeling like you are not alone in this world.

CREATOR / HEAD WRITER / ACTOR
MORGAN TOLL

Other than being a total comic book nerd, Morgan is a regular slayer in the world of acting and writing. She started out with writing scripts for herself and her sister, actress Olivia Holt (Disney's "Kickin' It", Marvel's "Cloak and Dagger"), to perform for their family in their living room. She went on to study at  NYFA and Columbia College. While achieving her BA in screen writing she wrote, directed, and starred in her own film “Eternally Mad”, interned and studied at The Actors Studio in Los Angeles, and worked for the Disney Channel. She won best short film in the 2009 summer film competition at Columbia, and went on to teach her love of screen writing and acting. Some of Morgan's acting students have gone on to perform in such television shows as “Once Upon a Time”, “Riverdale”, “Agent Carter”, and “Castle”. After a four year break, and dealing with a life threatening illness that caused her to have both of her vocal chords removed, Morgan is now back in the game and better than ever! She can’t wait to show you this exciting, eye opening, and spooky new Web Series that is FrankenSITTER.

 

ASSOCIATE / EXECUTIVE PRODUCER
KATELYN NICHOLS

Katelyn is a NYC based actor, voiceover artist, producer, and kids/teen acting coach. She graduated from The University of Memphis with a BFA in Theatre Performance and went on to graduate from the Maggie Flanigan Studio in NYC. Katelyn currently is the voice for several major company commercials including Apple, DKNY, and Kohl's to name a few. She is the CEO and manager of K. Nichols Studio, a theatre education and professional training program for kids and teens to train through FaceTime and Skype. She recently produced an Off-Broadway production in NYC and is thrilled to produce Frankensitter alongside fellow K. Nichols Studio coach, Morgan Toll.  For more info about the studio visit knicholsstudio.com

 

DIRECTOR / CINEMATOGRAPHER
VICTORIA VIEIRA

Victoria has worked as a director, art director, scenic painter, editor, and set photographer on various feature & short films, music videos, web series, and commercials. She was on the production team of Project SERA, a 2013 horror sci-fi Web Series and the romantic fantasy feature 2014 film 'In Your Eyes' executive produced & written by Joss Whedon. Victoria recently launched Vieira Productions based in Frederick, Maryland in May of 2017 and most recently directed commercials for various companies such as The Red Door Salon & Spa and Drive Pros.

Emily Armistead
Caleb Owens
Sarah Marrow
Kristian Wright
Mattie Taylor
Jared Rayo
Kaiya Francis
Aidan Hoy
Addie Krammer

Caister Choi
Brianna Szewezyk
Payton Gillis
Vann Gallimore
McKenzie Brewer
Olivia Alexander
Cooper Dendy
Riley Burgio
Macy Gallimore

This wonderful group of hard working writers are located all over the globe from The Netherlands to the US!

Chelse Morris
Basak Layic
Sean Munson
Kat Lighthouse
Morgan Toll
Ethan Witt
Addisyn Toll
Jason Wilkinson
Raymond Zachariasse

 

FrankenSITTER stars more than 20 insanely talented kids who are fighting, just like their characters; but this time to make their dreams a reality. Using an internationally based creative team, we are giving everyone involved in FrankenSITTER the opportunity to demonstrate their talent on a large scale, while promoting the importance of teamwork, bravery, hope, acceptance, friendship and anti-bullying.

With FrankenSITTER, K. Nichols Studio is providing a platform for young artists to not only make their debut in the industry but also giving young people everywhere the opportunity to channel their creativity in a positive way.

The film industry can be expensive and exhausting for both kids wanting to start out, and their parents. K. Nichols Studio's mission is to provide a professional-quality experience for young aspiring artists, providing them with the skills and industry connections to pursue their dreams.

By donating to FrankenSITTER you will not only be helping us tell the story which will benefit its audience with a positive message, but you will also help make the dreams of these creative individuals come true by giving them an opportunity to showcase their talents.

  • Donations to FrankenSITTER will go to all aspects of production from Pre to Post. This includes costumes, props, set design, catering, filming, editing, coloring, and of course - festival and comic con submissions. We want to provide a professional experience for actors and K. Nichols Studio students, to prepare them for future employment in the industry.
  • We have fun and spooky FrankenSITTER merchandise including stickers, T-shirts, hats, and more! Including signed posters, designed by comic book artist Ioannis Roumpoulias, and genuine screen and IMDB credits, so you can SEE and be forever credited for your impact in bringing FrankenSITTER to life. 

Without reaching our entire goal, the project will be very limited in what we can offer our aspiring artists. We do not want to compromise or limit the professionalism in their first industry experience and exposure, so every little bit helps!

Other ways you can be a part of FrankenSITTER:

  1. Share this funding page with everyone you know on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!
  2. Subscribe to our YouTube channel

story:
What is The RoomMates?

Synopsis: Two couples become roommates, shortly after their 'perfect relationships' seem to not be so perfect, when secrets, lies and betrayals come to light.

The RoomMates is a dramatic soap opera style web series  that talks about one of the main issues in relationships today, "lack of communication". The RoomMates will show what can happen when you don't communicate with your partner, that there is a wrong way to communicate and how communicating that right way can solve so many problems in relationships.

TELL ME MORE

We fully intended on funding this project out of pocket but wanted to give everyone the best we can possibly give them. Your contribution would mean the world to us but we are also so  grateful for the amount of support and love we have received this far and for that we want to say thank you so much!

SO WHERE IS MY MONEY GOING?

To make The RoomMates season 2 happen we need $3,000.  Here are the things your contribution will be going to.

  • Filming Locations:  We pay for every single location we film at and in season 2 we have to use more locations and even rent studio space.  
  • Crew: We were blessed to have people volunteer their times during season 1, but for season 2 we need money to pay for someone to film, edit, record audio and other production needs for The RoomMates.  
  • Food:  Feeding the cast and crew can become very expensive, especially with our cast growing we need help to feed the lovely people who dedicate so much time to this project.
  • Set Props: There will be a lot of set props and set designs that we need to create for season 2 of The RoomMates

Even if we do not meet your exact goal, anything is better than nothing and every penny donated will go into The RoomMates. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

We know that times are hard and everyone might not be in a position to donate money,but that doesn't mean you still can't help us. If you have any talent or skill in anything that could possibly help us out please let us know. Just email michellebabaproductions@gmail.com.  {Editors, Wardrobe, Make up/Hair Artist, Camera Person, locations  and etc.}  Anything at all will be a big blessing to us.  

Also, spread the word about The RoomMates. Tell your mom, dad, sister, brother, aunt, uncle, friend, gardener, neighbor, etc.  Just spread the word about The RoomMates series and about this campaign.  A lot of people see good ideas out there but don't do anything about it. This is your chance to do something about a great idea.  You may not have the money and you may not have a talent in anything relating to film, but we will be blessed if you spread the word about this campaign. DAILY! 

 

 

MEET THE CAST 

 

RICHARDSON PIERRE

Richardson Pierre was born in Port-Au-Prince, Haiti to Renelle Clairzie-Pierre and Jean-Richard Pierre. He migrated from the island to Massachusetts at the age of eight where he continued his education. He is a graduate of the Clark Atlanta University theater program where he was given a strong foundation from which he can build on. He is an LA based actor working tirelessly to grown in his craft.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6839507/

 

Jai Dion

Jai Dio'n is an African American actress born on the South Side of Chicago Illinois. She studied at University of Illinois and graduated with a Bachelor's degree in 2013. On her journey to make it to Los Angeles to pursue her acting career, she moved to Houston, Texas shortly after graduating. She moved to Los Angeles in 2017 and began pursuing her lifelong dream to become an actress.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9676910/?ref_=tt_ov...

Chris Louis

Chris Louis was born at Brigham & Women's Hospital in Boston, MA. His mother, Lilianne Louis is originally from Haiti, and moved to the U.S. back in the 1980s. At the young age of 5, Chris developed his skill for singing, and started participating in church events, weddings, birthdays, etc. By the time he was 8 years old, he developed the skill of dancing, being inspired by his #1 idol Michael Jackson. Throughout his middle and high school career, Chris used his talents to get more involved with musical theatre, where he then developed his skill for acting on stage. In 2010, Chris graduated from Brockton High School in Brockton, MA, and attended the University of Massachusetts Boston in Boston, MA. In 2014, he graduated with a Bachelor's Degree in Theater from the College of Liberal Arts. After two years of being out of college, Chris relocated to Los Angeles, CA to pursue his passion and dream as an actor within film & television."

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm7301836/?ref_=ttfc_...

 

Myron Emery Jr.

Myron Emery Jr. , an actor based out of the inland empire is best known for his role in a Netflix movie named Christmas on salvation street as well as a web series named just life. Where Myron plays a high school kid named Marcus who goes through the trials of life the best way he can as a college kid . Myron has studied the Meisner technique out of the baron and brown acting studio .

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5629596/?ref_=ttfc_...

 

Sidney Williams

Sidney Williams is an American Actor. He is a native of Alamo, TN. Sidney has been in several Short Films and Web Series to date throughout his 6 year career. He has trained under Hope Alexander-Willis, Greg Alan Williams, Kevin Benton, and Tasha Smith. He wants to change lives not only through his artistry, but also through philanthropy.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm9614511/?ref_=ttfc_...

 

Marche Howell

 

Marche Howell is a Texas native, actress and comedian. She began her career in commercials, and has since crossed over to television and film, with her most recent project currently in production, a television series entitled "Almost Nowhere." 
She's appeared in HBO's Insecure, and has graced the stage at the noteworthy Comedy Store, Comedy Union, Flappers, and can be found performing comedy and improv around southern California. 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8043213/?ref_=ttfc_...

 

MEET THE TEAM

 

MICHELLE ESHIET

CREATOR/WRITER/DIRECTOR

Michelle Eshiet is a writer, director and actress born and raised in Southern California. Her passion for the arts started when her uncle told her she has a gift for talking. She started acting and shortly discovered her talent for writing and directing. Michelle’s goal is to create content that brings joy to people hearts and to make people think deeper about everyday issues.

 

CHRIS MORGAN

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Chris Morgan, a down to earth guy who loves to have fun, loves to laugh and make people laugh. Straight forward but cautious of feelings. He loves his wife and kids. Chris Morgan takes pride in where he comes from and humbled by the places he has been. With all that being said those are the same characteristics that Chris brings into his business. You will have fun at your shoot, knowing that quality is the first priority. Chris Morgan takes time to produce images that will last a lifetime, images that will tell a story. Chris is well respected for his photographic style of taking you on a journey with his photos, also for his cinematic techniques. Chris is able to take your concept and bring it to life. 

 

CORAL CARRILLO

PRODUCTION MANAGER/1ST AD

MICHELLE ESHIET
CREATOR/WRITER/DIRECTOR

Michelle Eshiet is a writer, director and actress born and raised in Southern California. Her passion for the arts started when her uncle told her she has a gift for talking. She started acting and shortly discovered her talent for writing and directing. Michelle’s goal is to create content that brings joy to people hearts and to make people think deeper about everyday issues.
 
CHRIS MORGAN
DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Chris Morgan, a down to earth guy who loves to have fun, loves to laugh and make people laugh. Straight forward but cautious of feelings. He loves his wife and kids. Chris Morgan takes pride in where he comes from and humbled by the places he has been. With all that being said those are the same characteristics that Chris brings into his business. You will have fun at your shoot, knowing that quality is the first priority. Chris Morgan takes time to produce images that will last a lifetime, images that will tell a story. Chris is well respected for his photographic style of taking you on a journey with his photos, also for his cinematic techniques. Chris is able to take your concept and bring it to life. 
 
CORAL CARRILLO
PRODUCTION MANAGER/1ST AD

story:
Hibernian Transmedia is a 501c3 public charity dedicated to promoting and preserving Irish and Irish-American culture. We produce three weekly Irish American radio programs in Chicagoland as well as the Annual Irish American Movie Hooley film festival each September at the Siskel Film Center, and a variety of other productions. Read more here.

We've been working on OUR IRISH PUB since 2014 in several forms. Last year we produced a pilot show, which you can view here. It's 30 minutes. The show features  telegenic Irish fiddler Katie Grennan visiting local Irish pubs, playing traditional Irish music with other Irish musicians, and meeting the pub owner for some brief history on each pub.

WTTW has requested a slight change to the format, you can read their letter here. The new format will require shooting at three distinct Irish pubs.

Here is a letter from WTTW with more information.

What We Need & What You Get

Re-shooting the program is going to cost a bit more than the original pilot shoot because of the three locations etc. Fortunately the three pubs have offered to help financially with this, but we still need to raise a bit more for musicians, editing, sound mixing, graphics, and title sequences. That's the purpose of this campaign. Please join us in the grand endeavor! We appreciate those who have already donated and we ask them to double down as well to see this project to our ultimate goal, broadcasting in Chicago and across the country. We realize there are many worthy causes you can help. Your donations for this program are tax-deductible and will make an indelible impact on Irish and Irish American culture, spreading the message of our ancestors and for our descendants. Take a look at what we've accomplished so far, and please join us as we showcase the talents of our community.

We have chosen three of Chicago's best Irish pubs, well known not only for their cozy beauty but also because each hosts some of the world's best Irish musicians in regular sessions at the pubs. We'll start with LIzzie McNeill's Irish Pub, nestled along the Chicago river, the annual starting point

for the dying of the Chicago river green for St. Patrick's Day. Next up on our tour of three  great Chicago Irish Pubs is Chief O'Neill's Irish Pub on North Elston Avenue in Chicago,

the only pub memorialized to the legendary Chicago Police Commander and musician who "saved Irish music", Captain Francis O'Neill. And finally we'll join the usual Sunday session group at

The Galway Arms Irish Pub with Chicago's greatest Irish tenor Paddy Homan, fiddler Katie Grennan,  and other great musicians.

We have budgeted this indiegogo fundraising effort at $3,500, which will be added to the finances already committed, $4,500, and fundraising efforts outside Indiegogo to pay our production expenses of  $10,000, half of which has already been committed by the pubs in question.

Our donors are invited to join in the celebration of Irish music and be in the audience when we tape the shows, the more the merrier! We are offering unique opportunities to recognize our donors, regardless of the size of your donation.

In the unlikely event we don't raise our total ten thousand, we will cut back on the musicians and production values to make the show work with what we have already committed, over half the amount. We've produced several films and TV shows in the past and are very confident in the success of this program and concept.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a donation, please help us spread the word on social media and among your network of friends and family. This is a show designed for the whole family and the entire Irish and Irish American community of Chicagoland.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Overview

We're a couple of filmmakers and producers out of Texas, now living in LA. After college, we decided to make our own content. 

DirtyWorks presents its newest limited web series of action packed comedic drama about intelligence, betrayal, and conquering fear. Nate, a junior private investigator, must prove he can fight organized crime without knowing where his friends stand and where the enemy lies.

"The Applicant" is our latest series and if we reach our goal, we want to reward our viewers with not just the completed project, but the perks of achieving something just as we have.

This campaign centers around bringing DirtyWorks to the next level and expanding our future projects to the realm of great quality.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2500 to pay for all the expenses below. This will really help the next episodes shine.

And if we don't reach our goal (we will), we'll still be able to crank out the final episodes with whatever donations we receive!

 

Ultimately, your coin might be contributed for anything from costumes and makeup to our lighting equipment, to paying our wonderful crew or to even feeding us while we work! 

So... we set up a cool little rewards system that we think everyone will enjoy. And, we'll make sure to reach out to everyone who qualified for those perks, so make sure you give us your name so we can get your contact info later.

Otherwise, we understand if you're not interested in the perk or would just simply like to remain anonymous to forego contact and are equally as grateful for your donation!

The Impact

The Applicant series is the next step in taking DirtyWorks to the level we want to reach.

We've made full episodes (icons next to our campaign video) and even a whole season of a show without any funding before.

Here's an example:

 
That's just what we can do with no budget and a tape recorder. So if we're being honest, just imagine what we can do with some real production budget!
 

Risks & Challenges

The filming process sometimes takes weeks, so you won't be able to see the great results your donations will bring immediately.

Your donations go a lot further than you think, no matter what you're contributing. Donating is ultimately an investment, and sometimes that investment may fall short.

But we guarantee that all of our funding will be worth every penny and each backer will receive our utmost thanks and appreciation. Without you, we wouldn't be already where we want to be!

However, we plan on giving you guys content along the campaign to keep you ready and entertained (Just check out our sick rewards)!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether your donation is $5 or $500, you spreading the word is worth more than any dollar amount. 

So share, share, share!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word on all social media platforms if you can!

Here's ours: 

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dirtyworksprod/

twitter: https://twitter.com/dirtyworksprod

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/dirtyworksproductions/

youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCK6b_UcQuUwmYV...

Thanks for all your help! Let's call everyone and make it happen!

story:
Short Summary

Summer School is a six part web-series brought to you by writer/director Joel Stephen Fleming and #13thstreetfilms. 

Logline: A group of inept and inexperienced educators begrudgingly work through their summer holidays. While under the control of a ruthless and maniacal dictator, their Principal.

We are seeking funding to create a 10 minute Pilot episode along with a sizzle reel. With the plan to market the series to a number of online platforms and Television distributors. We would appreciate any donations great or small to help us create this hilarious and heartfelt comedy series.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • You would be helping fund production, including camera hire, location rental, props and costumes and more...
  • We have a series of fantastic perks to offer including a chance to be a featured extra in the show or even direct a shot with your favourite character.
  • The entire crew and cast are all volunteering their time as they believe in this project so much. Any and all donations will be put into the project and not used as a salary or wages.

story:
We are using Indiegogo to help make our FINAL SEASON a success. We have some amazing plans and we don't want to cut any corners to make it happen. We just need some additional funds to give our series the ending it deserves!

Our team has put together some awesome perks for your kind and generous donations! Help make TESTING: THE FINAL SEASON happen and you will be rewarded. We want you to join our Testing Team.

"It just really breaks my heart how in some of these production meetings they're discussing having to cut corner, cut characters, and even cut whole episodes because we are not getting the help we need financially." - Isabella Leone (Annie)

We know we have all been approached by all different films and projects for donations. But, the truth is that we are all struggling artists who need financial help to make these projects possible.

We're not asking you to give us a big amount. We just hope you will consider any amount that you can to help make the final season a success!

Supporting our project (in any capacity) gets yourself a part of this production. Any donation can get you an IMDB.com credit from either "a special thank you", "producer", and even "executive producer" title. 

We currently have a goal to raise $2,100. 

Testing: The Series is filming 85% of its scenes in an office complex in Brockton, MA. We will be filming for a total of TEN days during April - June. 

We plan to use your donations for the following production needs:

  • $500 - Food for actors/crew
    • $50/day will be budgeted to feed our hard working actors/crew. We are also honored that a volunteer has stepped forward to donate additional meals/snacks for the entire shoot.
  • $625 - Set Dressing/Prop needs*
    • A majority of our budget is to make the final season of Testing "visually pleasing". We have some awesome scenes, but we need to make several set dressing purchases.
      • We have the amazing privilege to shoot in a few locations that we are allowed to use for free. The main location, in Brockton, is an office building with several offices and conference rooms. However, the entire floor is empty. We need to bring in our own furniture to set dress the room.
      • We will be looking at places like Savers or junk shops for some furniture needs. But, we will need to purchase a few items online. We have already started looking and are confident we will find everything we need. But, we need everything from desks, chairs, book shelves, tables, couches, beds, ect.
      • On that same note, we also need props for the scenes! However, we have a majority of the props needed. We may just need to make some special purchases through amazon.com.
      • [*Note: This is our FIRST priority, if we sadly only raise this much from our IndieGoGo campaign it will ALL be going toward set dressing needs.]
  • $300 - Wardrobe needs
    • The final season takes place in 1959 - 1966. We are thrilled to have a costume designer who will be donating some wardrobe. We are also so thankful to our cast members for volunteering to purchase their own items. However, we need to purchase some additional materials and vintage items. 
  • $420 - Equipment fees
    • We have the opportunity to purchase a better lighting and audio set up for only $420 out of our budget. We have some really cool special lighting effects planned and need additional funds to make that happen.
  • $115 - Miscellaneous fees
    • We wanted to designate $115 for miscellaneous fees in case we need additional funds for any of the categories listed above.
  • $60 - First Aid
    • We want to purchase a fist aid kit that can accommodate any minor issues that could happen on our set during production. 
  • $80 - IndieGogo Fee
    • IndieGogo (4% of goal) will take out an $80 service fee for using their website. We are adding this to our budget. 

TOTAL: $2,100

NOTE: We are honored to be working with such a dedicated and passionate cast. The entire cast of Testing: The Series is volunteering their time and not accepting any payment for their performances. (This also includes the producers, creator, director, and crew.) We are only focused on raising these funds so we can increase the production value - specifically its visuals - for the final season. Every donation we receive will only go directly to the areas listed above.

How can I watch the first TWO SEASONS of Testing: The Series? You can check out the first twenty-six episodes of Testing: The Series by clicking here.

When will the FINAL SEASON be released? We are getting ready to release a 14-episode third season on May 17, 2018. We hope to premiere the final season Winter 2019.

Where does my donation go? All donations will be deposited into our small business savings account for Angelwood Pictures and used exclusively for Testing: The Series production needs. 

When will I start getting production updates? We will start sending all our "Testing Team" members updates starting in April 2018.

Who is producing the final season? The past seasons of Testing was produced by Angelwood Pictures and Beantown Statie Production Company. Right now, Angelwood Pictures will be the sole producer of our final season. Check out Angelwood Pictures' here.

How old do I have to be to donate? You must be at least 18 years of age.

How do I let you know what name to use in my "Special Thanks" credit? We will send you an email confirming your name for the "Special Thanks" credit. We will also use this name on IMDB.com. If we do not hear back from you, we will use the name used on the purchase on the perk.

Do I only get a credit if I receive an EXECUTIVE PRODUCER perk? Yes, we are only offering you IMDB.com credit and your name in the credits. You do not have any control over the creative side of our production or a financial return.

Is travel and lodging included in any of the perks? You are responsible for providing your own travel and lodging accommodations.

If I get to be a TEST PATIENT is my role guaranteed to make the final cut? We will try our hardest to make sure you make the final cut, but we can't make any promises. However, you will get access to the final edited clip to see and share with your fans!

Can I make a donation but NOT receive a credit? If you would like to make a donation, but do not want to have your name in the credits, just contact us directly.

If you have any additional questions, e-mail us at angelwoodpictures@gmail.com

  • Dana Wine as Nurse Merryweather
  • Maureen Vlaco as The Godmother
  • Acei Martin as Nurse Sugarplum
  • Frank Czarnowski as Sir
  • Isabella Leone as Annie

  • Pierre Racine as Board Member

  • Jeff Bouffard as Board Member
  • Crystal Brown as Board Member
  • Lin Hultgren as Jessica
  • Lucas McEvoy as Graham
  • Isabelle Assaf as Caroline
  • Robert Marsella as Markus

  • Mary C. Ferrara as Nurse Wildflower
  • Jon Korzeniowski as Agent McGaughney
  • Ken Neenan as Agent Beck
  • Karen Ann Martino as Grandma Pauline Tabor
See our FULL CAST LIST on IMDb.com
 
 
We will be casting several new roles for our FINAL SEASON. Casting starts April 2018.
 

Seth Chitwood (Creator)
Seth Chitwood is the creative director of the production company, Angelwood Pictures. He is the creator and director of seven award-winning web series (Family Problems, The Girl in the Attic, Lungs, and In the Bedroom). He recently produced his 200th web series episode. He is the recipient of eleven LA Web Series Festival Awards for writing, producing, and directing. He also received the 2016 'Rising Star' Award from Imagine Magazine. He is a Rhode Island College graduate with a double major in Film Studies and Theater Performance. See all of Seth's current projects here and on IMDb.com.

We are currently working hard to confirm our crew for the final season. We will update you with our crew list as we get closer.

See the original creative team that helped make TESTING happen!

We will be casting several new roles for our FINAL SEASON. Casting starts April 2018.
 
Seth Chitwood (Creator)Seth Chitwood is the creative director of the production company, Angelwood Pictures. He is the creator and director of seven award-winning web series (Family Problems, The Girl in the Attic, Lungs, and In the Bedroom). He recently produced his 200th web series episode. He is the recipient of eleven LA Web Series Festival Awards for writing, producing, and directing. He also received the 2016 'Rising Star' Award from Imagine Magazine. He is a Rhode Island College graduate with a double major in Film Studies and Theater Performance. See all of Seth's current projects here and on IMDb.com.We are currently working hard to confirm our crew for the final season. We will update you with our crew list as we get closer.See the original creative team that helped make TESTING happen!

story:
THE STORY of RETURN TO LIFE

CROSSROADS STATION is the pilot episode of a post-apocalyptic/sci-fi/fantasy web series called RETURN TO LIFE.

Think Mad Max in Middle Earth with the threat of 28 Days Later and the sensibilities of Firefly.

The BERSERKERS – vicious, human-like, nigh-invulnerable mutants – have been running wild for nearly fifty years, their only weakness being thin skin over their hearts.

THE DESTROYERS - barbaric, nihilistic, anarchistic fascists bent only on mayhem, destruction, and death.

THE RETURNERS are rising again to try and find the cure for the Berserkers, and thus, the world.

Kalem is a Returner, accompanied by Sera of the Vika Clan and J.B., a shrewd and cunning mercenary. He’s found half of the key to the cure in an ancient relic – the Dagger of Lezan. Now he searches for the one who can activate the healing properties of the relic and hope to save the world. He begins his search in the remote settlement, CROSSROADS STATION…

 

 

STUDENT FILMMAKING

So, this is my final project for the program. Should clock in around 25 minutes.

I have some folks in the local filmmaking community I've met through the Hawaii Filmmakers Collective who are volunteering to help crew the film and supply professionally made props, in addition to some of my classmates. The film is already cast and you can see them below!

While we have many volunteers on the project and folks working for deferred pay, there are some aspects which require funding. Locations being one of them, some of the key props, and then food for the shooting days, transportation costs, etc.

THE VISION

What started as a proof-of-concept 7 minute production is now getting the fuller-length treatment. With more planning days, more shooting days, and more post-production days, we will bring you deeper into this post-apocalyptic/sci-fi/fantasy world where bands of Destroyers seek only to pillage and kill, while the diminished Returners fight to restore the land. Innocent villagers are caught in the middle, all while the vicious, mutant Berserkers threaten to turn up at any time!

Crossroads Station is the title of the pilot episode for the web series Return To Life.

Many of the cast and crew are returning for this project, some to reprise their roles, and some to play in new ones.

THE CAST

 

 

FINAL VITALS

Shooting is the last week of March and we'll scramble to get it done as fast as possible afterward! Digitial perks will start coming soon after, and physical perks not long after that.

Thank you for your time and consideration!

This is only the beginning...

story:
Destination Celebration began as an original idea from the wild mind of Kyle LaMontagne. In 2016 Kyle produced, directed and hosted three episodes of Destination Celebration, a show where he journeyed to exotic countries and had cool, and sometimes hair-raising, adventures on his way to one of the country's iconic festivals.

That limited release won Destination Celebration a Southwest Regional Emmy for best Lifestyle Series.

For the next year, while working his day job in film production, Kyle honed his idea and asked his filmmaker sister Maddy to bring her creative fire to the project and the concept of a wise-ass brother and sister combo adventure road-tripping to crazy festivals while immersing themselves in the wonder of the planet's peoples and cultures fell into place.

Hey, everyone, we're Maddy and Kyle LaMontagne and our aim is to produce a network quality adventure travel series that we'll package and pitch to Cable channels, conventional networks and streaming services like Netflix, Amazon and Sony's.

This Indiegogo campaign will help fund both the first episode of Destination Celebration and a wide marketing campaign that includes select film festivals and pitching to sponsors and investors.

In the pilot episode, we'll land in magnificent Barcelona, Spain, our destination the Tomatina Festival in the mountain village of Bunol. In Barcelona, crazy Spaniard Gonzo will give us a tutorial on how to negotiate authentic Spanish tapas bars and the rollicking Catalan club scene before we all head down the rugged Mediterranean coast for more adventure.

After exploring the Valencia street art scene, secret beaches and a bull leaping competition-- the recently revived ancient, cruelty free version of bullfighting,--we turn east to the mountain village of Bunol.

A town of 9,000 people, Bunol welcomes an additional 20,000 revelers for a three day street party that culminates in a town-wide free-for-all tomato fight, La Tomatina.

While bringing a fun insight into the rich weave of the world's cultures, Destination Celebration will also be a terrific guide for travelers who shun tour groups and resorts.

In each episode we'll be joined by area natives who share secrets of their locales. And every show will feature an animated map of our route and tips on hostels, eateries and opportunities for adventure.

Our plan is to package this episode--our proof-of-concept--along with a business plan and the conceptual synopses for six to eight subsequent episodes and then go wide with it pitching to cable, network and streaming channels; hitting the festival circuit and, at the same time, self-distributing it as a web-series. So, yes, you'll be able to see the shows no matter what!

Because we love adventure and we love to travel.

We believe that celebrations and festivals are the most vibrant expression of a country's unique culture. For a few days, or even hours, each year, a festival creates a window into a country's past, showing us traditions that have been celebrated for sometimes hundreds, or even thousands of years.

In the end, what travel has shown us is that, despite our outward differences, human beings are surprisingly the same when it comes to what we value and honor. Above all, this is the  underlying theme of Destination Celebration.

Ultimately, we want to show you the outline of trip itineraries where you'll experience the richness of a country's culture, interact with people in their daily lives and end up running wild at crazy cultural Festivals.

Millennials are our biggest demographic, and the low price points we'll sometimes show on travel accommodations and amenities reflect the realities of young travelers. But adventurous travelers from Baby Boomers on down have expressed excitement for a show that explores our type of itineraries.

If you like partying with the natives, you'll love this show.

Kyle LaMontagne: Co-creator, producer, director, editor, host.

After graduating from San Diego State University with a film degree, Kyle produced, directed and hosted three episodes of Destination Celebration for San Diego's AWE TV. That limited release won Kyle a Southwest Regional Emmy in 2016. In 2015 he was a co-producer on the BAFTA nominated short "One Inch From Flying". Kyle has produced and/or directed a long list of music videos, lifestyle videos and travel shorts. He lives in L.A. where he works with a handful of collaborators helping them make riveting, visually superb travel docs.

Maddy LaMontagne: Co-creator, producer, editor, host.

A Southern Oregon University graduate in film production, Maddy has made herself indispensable to the local Indie scene as a jack of all trades, popping up anywhere from on camera to the art department to the editing room. She spent last month on location in eastern Oregon, the art director on a feature film.

Scott Granlund: Cinematographer.

Scott is an eccentric and adaptable cinematographer with a wide range of experience including narrative short film, documentary, commercial and corporate work. Scott studied film production at San Diego State University while simultaneously working as an assistant editor and camera operator at KPBS Broadcasting. As a freelancer Scott has done work for MTV, Fandango, American Eagle Outfitters, History Channel, Coca-Cola and Google. He currently works as a shooter for Intel's Agency Inside, "Ad Age's" 2017 in-house Agency of the year.

Steve LaMontagne: Producer, writer.

Steve brings to the team both practical knowledge and creative inspiration with decades of successful business management and years of industry experience pitching, story consulting and successfully tackling writing assignments. An optioned, award winning screenwriter, Steve has taught screenwriting and story craft and written educational, industrial and reality scripts. His short stories, essays and poems have appeared in national and regional publications.

Andrew Hartsock: Editor. 

Andrew Hartsock is a San Diego based Editor and Motion Graphic Artist. Andrew spent 5 years with The Enthusiast Network a leader in action sports media. He balanced his time between making original work and collaborating with other departments. For the last four years he has worked for Herring Networks as an Editor and Creative Director. Working on Emmy nominated titles such as PRIVATE ISLANDS(2016), VICARIOUS ESCAPES(2017). 
 

We're asking for $15,000 to cover the bare bones costs of producing the pilot episode. And, when we say bare bones, we mean it. For example, we're earmarking a small stipend for our cinematographer Scott who is shooting for a drastically reduced rate, while the producers are, for now, operating on karma.

But, the beauty of Indiegogo is that it's a simple way to show everyone our project and to, hopefully, get you all talking about the show to your circles. 

We've come to see Indiegogo as much more than asking for money. It's a solid way to start and build a loyal following for our show and to get feedback on how to make it better. And really, who doesn't want a cool Destination Celebration T-shirt designed by the show's co-creators?

But if funds are tight, you'll do us a solid by sharing and sharing some more.

The following pie chart gives a rough breakdown of where the money will go. The categories are general, for instance, Post-production includes editing, animation, music, color correction and more.

How we plan to spend our money:

                           

 

So check out our perks, hit a couple share icons and tell your peeps about us.

See you on the road.

story:
Short Summary

Freddy is a comedic web series about the lives of an out of work actor and his ex-actor, now therapist friend, Charlene (Charly). We have one episode in the can and are deeply onto the second episode. At this time we have 6 completed scripts on deck as we continue to develop this series. But, we’re taking one step at a time and this campaign is about Episode 2.  Your contribution will assist us in spreading joy to the world!

 

Please meet key members of our experienced and professional team:

Ron Basci, Executive Producer, Writer. Decades of experience as a writer, public affairs professional and producer have provided Ron with the expertise required to successfully complete the Freddy project. He wrote and produced the internationally acclaimed short film, The First Responder, and his An Immigrant Remembers documentary short was aired nationally. His company is Promenade Productions, LLC.

                 

Christopher Robert Thompson, Executive Producer, Writer.  Chris  grew up in western New York and is a graduate of SUNY Fredonia State with a BA in Theatre Arts. He has been doing film work in New York ever since his arrival twenty years ago. He has had major roles in: The First Responder, Agency L&F,  Lost in Russia. Dead Reckoning, Jefftown, and Please Don’t Take Me There.   Freddy  marks his producing debut.

 

Bryan McKenna, Freddy.     Bryan is a stand up comedian from New York. He can be seen touring nationally opening for Jim Breuer. In March 2020, Bryan’s first album, Jim Breuer Presents: Bryan McKenna, “The Fight is Never Over” debuted at  #1 on iTunes. When not on tour Bryan performs regularly at various NYC comedy clubs. 

                         

Carly Sadolf, Charly. Was born and raised in Charleston, West Virginia. Carly started acting and dancing in regional theatre at age five and continued to study dance through her teen years.   She studied acting for four years after her acceptance  into the Conservatory of Performing Arts at Point Park University. Moving to New York City, Carly performs in theatre, TV and film productions and has produced the films All You Can Eat (2018), and Bananas (Are Going Extinct) (2020).

 

Mauricio Soto, Director of Photography. Mauricio was born and raised in Bogota, Colombia. He studied film and television production at the University of Westminster, in London.  After graduation Mauricio moved to NY where he freelanced in the film, tv, print and web industries in various production capacities.   He has worked his way up to numerous gigs as a producer, editor and director of photography. Mauricio worked with Ron and Chris on The First Responder short film.  

                   

Damon Hankoff, Audio. Damon is a composer, musician and all around audio specialist with a keen ear for acoustics. He is known for his work on Missing (2019), and New York City Chapters (2015). A dedicated professional, Damon is that rare New York combination: both reliable and pleasant, making him a valued member of our team.

 

What We Need and What You Get

What we need is just $3,500 for episode 2 of Freddy. The crew, actors, and script are ready to go and we’re seeking the funding to complete the production (ex. day of shoot costs like location fee, transportation, etc. and post (ex. editing, color correction, music, etc.)  Your contribution makes you a participant in a venture that will not only make you feel good but put a smile on your face and on countless others.  You may also take advantage of our offered perks. Each donation entitles you to the perk at your contribution level as well as those of levels below.

$10         Listing on social media Backer's pages

$25         Shout out on social media

$50         Personalized downloadable poster

$100       Listing in the Ending Credits  

$250       Downloadable Preview of Episode 2

$500       Downloadable Preview of Episodes 1, 2 and additional Season 1 (if and when) 

$1,000    Associate Producer Credit (Limit: 2)

$2,500   Executive Producer Credit  (Limit: 1)

 

The Impact

The reason we are willing to move forward with Freddy is, simply, that we believe in this show. Freddy is a comedy. We want to bring  laughter and a little lightheartedness, especially during these trying times. With that said, we are professionals who love the work and believe we are making a worthwhile show for everyone’s enjoyment.

 

Risks & Challenges

In anything you chose to do there will be challenges. We’ve already survived the covid-19 “stop everything” challenge  artists faced with our enthusiasm intact! We won’t bore you with the ins and outs of putting a production on its legs, developing it, etc.  This team has done it before (episode 1) and we can an are eager to do it again. So, hard work, dedication, experience and flexibility will see this happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help us financially at this time don’t be discouraged, we completely understand.  We’d be very pleased if you spread the word about Freddy, especially if you have any generous millionaires in your contacts.  Indiegogo also has tools you can use to share our campaign with your friends and family.  This is an In-Demand campaign which will allow us to keep raising money after we have reached our goal. We've set an achievable goal, and anything above it will go toward funding the rest of the series.

story:
HELLO & WELCOME!

 

The Project

"Highly Unlikely" came about from wanting to see the stir craziness that so many have experienced this last year played out on stage through the eyes of young actors. We found this to be especially entertaining because young actors are already directionless to begin with, so when Covid hit and the major entertainment centers were so deeply affected, so many were  left asking what now? Is this industry still worth pursuing? Will things ever return to the way the were? 

 We want to show the members of the film and entertainment industry who have barely found their footing as amateurs  but are still trying to "make it" and the humor that comes out of that optimism against insurmountable odds. 

Even when all the safe havens for movie nerds and thespians are closed, our characters do their best to keep some dream alive of breaking into the world of theater and film as a profession.

Our pilot and soon to be series is about how the  dreams of our characters are  deferred and what they do to keep their hopes alive, even when their environment is not reflecting their same optimism.


 

The Mission

  • This campaign is so important to all of us because of its message, and also our passion for creating art.  We, along with the rest of the cast and crew have personally connected with this script , which is one of the reasons why everyone is so eager to make this production a reality!
  • In order to make it a reality we need your help! Everyone is ready to work and give there 100% to this project and really make it something special.  Whenever we set our minds to something we wont stop until it's at its very best, and we have extremely high expectations for this film.  We will be submitting to every film festival available in the US.  Creating access to this film on every platform possible. Along with much much more!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our first goal is to reach the $8,000 mark! We know we can do it!

  • Donating $1,000 or more and we will let you be a Producer in Highly Unlikely with full access to our set and helping and collaborating with our team, and of course credits with your name on screen and IMDB credits. Along with any of the merchandise you prefer. 
  • Donating $500 or more will give you a small speaking role in the film, and your choice of any 3  merchandise items. 
  • Donating $250 or more will give you a Production credit on the film as well as an IMDB credit and access to our set. This will also include your choice of any 2 merchandise items. 
  • Donating $150 or more will give you access to a live zoom or facetime call with the two creators of the show asking them anything about film making, creating, or writing and acting.
  • Donating $100 or more will give you access to our set for 1 whole day, and you will get to hang with the cast and crew. This will include your choice of any merchandise item. 
  • Donating $75 will give you your choice of a Highly Unlikely T shirt, mug, or signed poster,  as well as a hand written poem about covid from one of the creators and writers.
  • Donating $50 will give you a signed poster and a Highly Unlikely face mask.
  • Donating $25 will give you a hand written thank you note and a signed post card from the creators and writers.

All donations go directly to the movie, to cover the cost of production and to take care of the cast and crew. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you would like to be a part of this project without donating you can always help spread the word about our film! Tell your family and friends, support and repost us on social media! What goes around comes around!

We will be posting our links on every social media platform for you to repost including this one.

HELLO & WELCOME!
 
The Project
"Highly Unlikely" came about from wanting to see the stir craziness that so many have experienced this last year played out on stage through the eyes of young actors. We found this to be especially entertaining because young actors are already directionless to begin with, so when Covid hit and the major entertainment centers were so deeply affected, so many were  left asking what now? Is this industry still worth pursuing? Will things ever return to the way the were? 
 We want to show the members of the film and entertainment industry who have barely found their footing as amateurs  but are still trying to "make it" and the humor that comes out of that optimism against insurmountable odds.
