story:
Overview

We are a group of fourth year RTA Media Production students enrolled at Ryerson University, and are currently working on our final thesis project. Forming in January 2020, we came together as a committed and passionate team with a multitude of strengths and perspectives that can bring this production to life. ‘Before She Was” is a coming-of-age psychological thriller television series that was written and conceptualized by our very own writer and producer, Deni Valchev and Sharla Sidon. We’re so excited to share this project with the world, but we can not bring it to fruition without your support.

Please read on to learn more about our project!

 

 

Jessica Wilson’s life isn’t all that bad. She lives in a small town called Maplewood with her loving parents and has a great group of friends. However, something’s been off - she sees images of a strange man while she sleeps and is constantly being taken over by her nightmares. Jessica can’t seem to escape them or find any answers, so she uses these nightmares as inspiration for her writing. After she enters a short story “Before She Was” in a national high school story competition, she unexpectedly wins. As the local news channel broadcasts her achievement, things take a turn when a troubled man named Ronnie Jackson drops everything to find the girl he’s been trying to hunt down for years.

Teaser 1:

 
The Making of Before She Was:

 

 

Inspiring from the cinematic works of Fincher and Villenueve, this series’ naturalistic cinematography treads the line between upbeat teen shows and dark thrillers, immersing the audience in the turbulent world of Jessica’s new reality. Focusing on perspective and movement, the camera is an omnipotent character in every scene, capturing the drama unfolding before the lens in the most human way possible.

 

Tech Specs:

A-Cam: Arri Amira with Sony CineAltas

B-Cam: Blackmagic Pocket 4K with Sigma Arts

 

 

 

Sharla Sidon (Producer)

Sharla is the producer and co-creator for Before She Was. She has  over 5 years experience working on several productions for television,  film and commercial behind and in front of the camera. She prides  herself on bringing a positive and creative energy to every project she tackles. With a passion for storytelling, she enjoys taking stories and bringing them to life.

“I am so excited for everyone to see this story come to life. I have been with it from A to Z, and I am so fortunate to have had Deni turn my concept into a captivating story that the audience will enjoy.”

 

 

Deni Valchev (Writer & Co-Producer)

Deni is the writer and co-producer of Before She Was. He's passionate about producing and the business and legal aspects of the entertainment industry. He's excited for audiences to dive into the story and its multifaceted characters. 

“I’ll tell you truthfully that writing this story has presented a lot of creative challenges for me. Being a pilot, I found that there needs to be a healthy mix of grabbing the audience's attention, but also being careful not to reveal what’s to come for the rest of the season.

I’m forever grateful that my story was chosen to get produced. I’ve always wanted to write a psychological thriller and when I heard Sharla’s idea, I knew I could expand it into a whole world filled with twists and turns. I’m passionate about producing the story because the characters all have so much history to uncover about others and even themselves. I’ve put in an awesome cliff hanger and can’t wait to get audiences excited about the next episode and the season to come!”

 

 

Parnika Raj (Director)

Parnika is passionate about telling stories not traditionally told. She has been honing her skills by being a part of various music videos, web series, commercials and other projects throughout her RTA career. She is very excited to put those skills and experiences to work on Before She Was. 

“Telling stories that aren't traditionally told and giving opportunities to people who don’t usually get them are things I keep in mind while directing. We are very strong in having a BIPOC lead and mixed cast in order to honour this philosophy.”

 

 

 

Philip LeMoyne (Cinematographer)

Philip LeMoyne is a Montreal-born cinematographer with 17 credits to his name on major productions, with an overall focus on dramatic narratives. Having committed the past eight years to the creation of moving images, recent accolades include Excellence in Cinematography at Buffer Festival 2019 for his role as Director of Photography on Émile Roy's "My Life is Scripted" (FR: J'écris ma vie), as well as the 2020 William F. Whites Cinematography Scholarship. Aside from his work as a cinematographer, Philip is a part owner of Ten Four Pictures, a Toronto-based production company specializing in high-level narrative and commercial film.

“There’s nothing I enjoy more than being on set, and that was no different on this project. Being surrounded by such passionate people is incredibly inspiring, especially with everyone working towards a common goal, elevating each other’s craft to create the best possible finished product - and I definitely think we succeeded on that front. My mission is to always capture the actors’ performances in the most faithful way possible, and thanks to the fantastic work of my close collaborators, namely my gaffer and focus puller, we were able to create some pretty remarkable cinematography. The sort of imagery that you’d see on Netflix (but we didn’t have that sort of money, so they should really call us up).”

 

 

Rebecca Dinh (Marketing Lead)

Rebecca enjoys being in a creative space and is passionate about relationship building and connecting with people. As she envisions  herself working in a collaborative environment where she can create impact, she has chosen to become the marketing lead for Before She Was. In this position, her main goal is to bring creativity to the project in a visual sense - this includes tackling the promotional application of social media platforms and considering the design/ layout of online materials. She also assisted in set dressing and wardrobe during production.

“I was drawn to the story - not only for its edge-of-your-seat suspenseful plot, but because of the relatability of the characters to the audience. People can definitely empathize with the character’s and their motives in this show, where themes of family issues, relationships, love and loss are interwoven. The story is familiar, yet captivating. Who doesn’t love a good psychological thriller?”

 

 

Filmmaking is a shockingly expensive profession to be stepping into as university students. We scraped together whatever cash we could to finance this project out of our own pockets, so any money that you donate would be put directly towards paying back this project that we begged, borrowed, and stole our way into making. We’re also looking to cover our overages and post production expenses, such as paying a video editor, a sound editor, and much more. 

 

We’re so passionate about this project and want Before She Was to be accessed by audiences everywhere. We may be fourth year university students, but we plan to deliver cinematic quality visuals and strong storytelling. We know what audiences are looking for, and we’re so close to delivering a finished product which will hopefully mean as much to you as it does to us. With your help, you’ll give us the ability to grow, market, and expand this pilot and bring us closer to our end goal, seeing this on everyone’s screens. 

Thank you so much for your time and contribution! We can’t wait for you to see the final product!

story:
The Show

The fellowship between a group of obsessive Live Action Role Players (LARPers) is broken when a player rises up against their tyrannical leader. With the declaration of war, their fantasy exploits begin to seep into their everyday lives. No nine-to-five office space is safe.

The Characters

LORELAI: Protagonist. Charming and spunky with an unwavering, intimidating degree of confidence. She’s always ready for battle, whether it be in the form of hand-to-hand combat or shutting down ignorant idiots.

AIDAN: The world builder. Stubborn and dramatic. He believes that he has surpassed the geniuses of JRR Tolkein and George RR Martin combined and will tell you so...in one of the eight functional languages he developed himself. Endearing, but kind of an asshole.

SARAH: Meek and mousy by day, noble and powerful in character. She finds her voice in the game. She has a passion for storytelling and yearns to one day reach Aidan’s level of “genius”. Vastly underestimated.

MICHAEL: A stocky yet docile man. Despite being on the local police force he resigns himself to the role of a humble potter. He LARPs not for the battle, but for the friendship.

ARTHUR: Lorelai’s boss. No funny business. Anti make-believe, pro historical reenactment.

The Impact

Your contributions will help us bolster our:

  • Production Design (props, costumes, set dressing, etc.)
  • Equipment rentals
  • Catering
  • Locations 
  • Overall morale (powerful stuff)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't find the funds to help us out, feel free to share our campaign and spread the word! And when our pilot hits an internet streaming platform near you, go ahead and check it out.

story:
What is Off Beat? 

Off Beat is a Sitcom being produced and directed by Sheryl Roberts. (https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3185918/?ref_=fn_al...) 

It is a collaborative effort by the cast and crew. We have all been putting in many hours to write, rehearse and prepare to film.  It is now time to produce the series and we need your help.  Funds raise will be going to pay the crew and cast first, then it will go to production costs; such as feeding the cast and crew on the long 12 hour shoots. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are first working to make sure that the crew and cast are paid for their time.  Here are the ways you can contribute and become an important part of this project. 

  • Be a Fan, for just $20. 
  • Become #1 Fan, for bumping up to the $50 contribution level. 
  • Your a VIP, for generously contributing $100. 
  • Turn into a VIP Superstar, for moving up to the $150 contributor level. 
  • Go full Celebrity when you generously contribute $250. 
  • Become an Associate Producer by providing support of $400. 
  • Go the Extra Mile by contributing $500. 

 

 

The Impact

Your contribution could help launch an actor's career or give a crew member the stepping stone they need.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our campaign on Social Media and other places. Indiegogo has some great tools to make it easy for you with just a few clicks.
  • Share the campaign with your Friends and Family
  • Like/Share/Follow our Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/obtvshow

Thank you for whatever support you can contribute to the project.

story:
The Imagination that led to Imagine PD

Like many great TV shows, Imagine PD came to fruition while creator, Mai Linh, was sitting in LA traffic. As she glanced at the people in the cars around her, she began to imagine a world where they all had their Imaginary Friends in the passenger seats -- someone to talk to when life got slow. One thing led to another, and Eric Ford and his pal Duke were born. 

 

Eric, Duke and the Funky Bunch

The Party Just Get's Better With More Characters

Detective Sally "Sal" Kieu - Eric's ball busting partner.

Sal is intense, hard to please, and begrudgingly works with Eric. Despite his obvious personality shortcomings, Sal knows she's partnered with the best of the best and puts up with his idiocracies because... Well, hell.  Because he makes her look sane. Completely without her knowledge, Sal's childhood imaginary friend, Princess Pony, reappears alongside Duke -- but only Eric can see and hear them.

Princess Pony - Sal's edgy, doe-eyed imaginary  best friend.

Princess Pony is a bright, innocent, and sometimes wry contrast that has haunted Sal since childhood. She desperately tries to get Sal to soften up and to be kinder to her fellow human beings. The only problem -- After the age of 7, Sal doesn't know that Princess Pony still exists. 

Detective Harold "Smitty" Smith - Beloved by all. Hated by Eric.

Smitty is the precinct's boy scout.  Not only does he serve the badge with his quick wit and irresistable charm, he also serves the community by volunteering his heart out for any cause possible.  Your grandma loves him, the gangbangers who are carjacking you LOVE him, and even Sal tolerates him moderately!  Which is all the reason why Eric can't stand the guy.  The office rivalry between the King of OCD and Prince of Boyish Charm is going to be one for the books at Imagine PD.

 

The Heart of The Story

This Show Is Really About The People That We Wish We Could Be

Eric Ford is a stiff, by-the-book rule follower. He gets lost in his drive for order and justice that he never learns how to enjoy the little things that life has to offer.

Enter: Duke.  The loud, unrestrained imaginary best friend that never hesitates before speaking his mind.  Duke does what he wants and when he wants it.  He irritates Eric endlessly, but is exactly what Eric needs... and really, what Eric wishes HE himself could be -- after all, Duke manifested from his childhood subconscious.

 

What Happens Once the Pilot is Shot

After we shoot this pilot, with your generous help, it will be submitted to film and television festivals, Pilot competitions, agents, and producers. We feel that we really have something charming and wonderful here, and we will launch it full force at the world. 

It won't be available for public viewing for quite some time after we finish shooting and editing, which is why YOU should contribute at a perk level that gets you early viewing! 

 

Where is Your Money Going?

Making an episode of television requires a ton of people, costumes, sets, equipment, etc. 

  • Our pilot is SAG, which means it is protected by the actors' union. We love the union because it makes sure actors get paid accordingly for their work! We, in turn, must pay our actors at least SAG minimum for their work with us. 
  • We have to pay a Director, a Director of Photography and a whole camera crew for him or her, Makeup Artists, Wardrobe people, and so much more. It is exciting to ensure that people in this industry really are getting paid for their special talents!
  • We have to pay for locations. Renting spaces, building small set pieces, and filling out the sets with props is all coming out of your contributions. 
  • Food! We have to feed our cast and crew each day of filming. Full tummies make for great television. Gandhi said that, I think. 

We have designed perks that we hope get you excited about getting involved. This is a team effort!

 

What if we don't reach our goal?

If we don't make it all the way, we will accomodate accordingly. This amount really is what we need to make a quality episode that has a shot at getting picked up by a network, but IF we don't reach our goal, we will still work hard to make either a minisode or a webseries for you. You will still get to find out what happens to Eric and Co., no matter what!

 

Risks & Challenges

The hardest part of this show is that it involves realistic Police characters, sets, and situations. When we shot our trailer, we already had to overcome a few hurdles and learned a lot about how we can make it as authentic as possible. 

  • We had a retired Policeman on set as a consultant. He made sure Eric and Sal's uniforms were authentically correct and taught them the proper footwork and gun handling for entering a dangerous scenario
  • We got permits for the use of fake weapons
  • We secured the use of a set that looked like an authentic setting for a crime scene

As we shoot the pilot, we will continue to take every necessary step to keep our show as authentic as possible. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we understand! Here are some ways you can still help:

  • Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/ImaginePDofficial/
  • Watch our trailer! Tell your friends about the new show that they would love and can be a part of!
  • SHARE this page! If you share it, we would LOVE if you captioned it with any enthusiasm you may have about the project. Shared posts are so much more effective with captions!

 

And that's all there is to it.

THANK YOU SO MUCH for being here on this page, and supporting our work! We can't wait to bring this project to a screen near you.
story_txt:
The Imagination that led to Imagine PD
Like many great TV shows, Imagine PD came to fruition while creator, Mai Linh, was sitting in LA traffic. As she glanced at the people in the cars around her, she began to imagine a world where they all had their Imaginary Friends in the passenger seats -- someone to talk to when life got slow. One thing led to another, and Eric Ford and his pal Duke were born. 
 
Eric, Duke and the Funky Bunch
The Party Just Get's Better With More Characters
Detective Sally "Sal" Kieu - Eric's ball busting partner.
Sal is intense, hard to please, and begrudgingly works with Eric. Despite his obvious personality shortcomings, Sal knows she's partnered with the best of the best and puts up with his idiocracies because... Well, hell.  Because he makes her look sane. Completely without her knowledge, Sal's childhood imaginary friend, Princess Pony, reappears alongside Duke -- but only Eric can see and hear them.
Princess Pony - Sal's edgy, doe-eyed imaginary  best friend.
Princess Pony is a bright, innocent, and sometimes wry contrast that has haunted Sal since childhood. She desperately tries to get Sal to soften up and to be kinder to her fellow human beings. The only problem -- After the age of 7, Sal doesn't know that Princess Pony still exists. 
Detective Harold "Smitty" Smith - Beloved by all. Hated by Eric.
Smitty is the precinct's boy scout.  Not only does he serve the badge with his quick wit and irresistable charm, he also serves the community by volunteering his heart out for any cause possible.  Your grandma loves him, the gangbangers who are carjacking you LOVE him, and even Sal tolerates him moderately!  Which is all the reason why Eric can't stand the guy.  The office rivalry between the King of OCD and Prince of Boyish Charm is going to be one for the books at Imagine PD.
 
The Heart of The Story
This Show Is Really About The People That We Wish We Could Be
Eric Ford is a stiff, by-the-book rule follower. He gets lost in his drive for order and justice that he never learns how to enjoy the little things that life has to offer.
Enter: Duke.  The loud, unrestrained imaginary best friend that never hesitates before speaking his mind.  Duke does what he wants and when he wants it.  He irritates Eric endlessly, but is exactly what Eric needs... and really, what Eric wishes HE himself could be -- after all, Duke manifested from his childhood subconscious.
 
What Happens Once the Pilot is Shot
After we shoot this pilot, with your generous help, it will be submitted to film and television festivals, Pilot competitions, agents, and producers. We feel that we really have something charming and wonderful here, and we will launch it full force at the world. 
It won't be available for public viewing for quite some time after we finish shooting and editing, which is why YOU should contribute at a perk level that gets you early viewing! 
 

Where is Your Money Going?
Making an episode of television requires a ton of people, costumes, sets, equipment, etc. 

Our pilot is SAG, which means it is protected by the actors' union. We love the union because it makes sure actors get paid accordingly for their work! We, in turn, must pay our actors at least SAG minimum for their work with us. 
We have to pay a Director, a Director of Photography and a whole camera crew for him or her, Makeup Artists, Wardrobe people, and so much more. It is exciting to ensure that people in this industry really are getting paid for their special talents!
We have to pay for locations. Renting spaces, building small set pieces, and filling out the sets with props is all coming out of your contributions. 
Food! We have to feed our cast and crew each day of filming. Full tummies make for great television. Gandhi said that, I think. 

We have designed perks that we hope get you excited about getting involved. This is a team effort!
 
What if we don't reach our goal?
If we don't make it all the way, we will accomodate accordingly. This amount really is what we need to make a quality episode that has a shot at getting picked up by a network, but IF we don't reach our goal, we will still work hard to make either a minisode or a webseries for you. You will still get to find out what happens to Eric and Co., no matter what!
 

Risks & Challenges
The hardest part of this show is that it involves realistic Police characters, sets, and situations. When we shot our trailer, we already had to overcome a few hurdles and learned a lot about how we can make it as authentic as possible. 

We had a retired Policeman on set as a consultant. He made sure Eric and Sal's uniforms were authentically correct and taught them the proper footwork and gun handling for entering a dangerous scenario
We got permits for the use of fake weapons
We secured the use of a set that looked like an authentic setting for a crime scene

As we shoot the pilot, we will continue to take every necessary step to keep our show as authentic as possible. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, we understand! Here are some ways you can still help:

Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/ImaginePDofficial/

Watch our trailer! Tell your friends about the new show that they would love and can be a part of!
SHARE this page! If you share it, we would LOVE if you captioned it with any enthusiasm you may have about the project. Shared posts are so much more effective with captions!

 And that's all there is to it.THANK YOU SO MUCH for being here on this page, and supporting our work! We can't wait to bring this project to a screen near you.

story:
What is in it for you?

I have several perks available for contributors:

1. $1 Donation

Just $1 can help me with my goal. I will read out your name in a special 'thank you' video for my supporters.

2. Postcard from Hong Kong

I will send you a personalised postcard when I'm in Hong Kong.

3. Poster from my set

I have approximately 28 posters from my original 'Pieces of Work' set that I have up for grabs. These posters will be sent to you 'as is' or signed by me (at no extra cost).  First come, first served. 

The posters I have a available are as follows:

KANO

Godzilla 2000

SPL 2: A Time for Consequences

Bakuman

Battle Royale

The Wailing

The Man from Nowhere (SOLD)

The Raid 2

The 36th Chamber of Shaolin

Ip Man 2

Audition

The Yellow Sea

The Boy and the Beast

The Divine Move

Killers

Drunken Master

Shaolin Soccer

Rurouni Kenshin

Drug War

The Lunchbox

47 Ronin (Keanu Reeves version)

Raghav 2.0

Haunters

Brother

Gangs of Wasseypur

Gamera 2

Baahubali 2: The Conclusion

I Saw the Devil (SOLD)

This is your chance to own a piece of 'Pieces of Work' (pun intended). 

4. Movie Review Request

I will review a film of your choice and give you a 'shout out' at the beginning of the review. 

5. Personal Skype call 

We can chat on Skype one-on-one and chat about anything you like. I will schedule the chats when I return from Hong Kong.

6. Confession of Murder (Korean) Review and Commentary

I will watch and review the South Korean film "Confession of Murder". I will record a feature length commentary for this, too. 

7. Confession of Murder (Japanese) Review and Commentary

I will watch and review the Japanese film "Confession of Murder". I will record a feature length commentary for this, too. 

8. Film Analysis Video

I will construct an analysis of a South Korean or Japanese film of your choice. Please only pick films that can be analysed; a good example would be Na Hong-jin's "The Wailing". This type of video would take a very long time to put together and I would need to spend time on research. Unfortunately, I cannot give a time frame on a video like this and you will just have to be patient with me.

story:
Summary and Impact:

My name is Lisa D. Adams, Seed Sowing Maven, I am an award winning author, filmmaker, actor, and most importantly a youth leader. Help Me Help Son the Documentary was originated by the request of an American American mom seeking books for her African American son. Although I did not have a book specified for the well-being of African American young men, her zeal and command conceived the birth of Help Me Help My Son. 

As a parent and grandparent of African American boys, I have made mistakes. I do not claim to have all the answers but I am committed to establishing better relationships. It is important to allow our youth to voice their concerns. How else can we resolve the problem unless we address the root which entails the stigmatism of expressing emotions as a sign of weakness, lack of communication, and the feeling of being unheard. 

Help Me Help My Son the documentary has segue into a multi series of episodes titled Help Me Help My Son the Ongoing Conversation. The variety of episodes will open lines of communications that were once considered as a barrier. The goal of this venture is to create a healthier dialogue and ultimately break risky cycles and bring awareness while providing solutions.

Budget

Description  Total Cost

Brick Motor/ Location=$2,000

Production Equipment=$2,000

Production Crew=$3,500

Employee Payroll=$2,000

Guest=$2,000

Budget Total $                   11,500.00

 

Perks:

$1-$25 Help Me Help My Son Sticker

Let everyone know you’re a Help Me Help My Son supporter with a sticker for your water bottle, notebook, laptop, etc.

Included Items

  • Help Me Help My Son Vinyl Sticker

$26-$69 Special Thanks:

Your Name Here:

See your name mentioned as a sponsor as a Special Thanks + Help Me Help My Son Sticker

Included Items

  • Special Thanks
  • Help Me Help My Son Vinyl Sticker

$70-$99 Book Insert

Personal letter to added as an addition to our book “Letters to Our African American Boys and Girls” + Help Me Help My Son Sticker

Included Items

  • About you page with Photo and Donation Information
  • Help Me Help My Son Sticker

$100+ T-Shirt + Book insert

Personal letter added as an addition to our book “Letters to Our African American Boys and Girls” + Help Me Help My Son T-Shirt, +Help me Help my Son Sticker

Included Item

  • About you page with Photo and Donation information
  • Help Me Help My Son T-Shirt
  • Help Me Help My Son Vinyl Sticker

Other Ways to support us:

Subscribe to our YouTube Channel: Help Me Help My Son

Check out our Facebook and Instagram account: Help Me Help My Son

Buy our merchandise by clicking http://bit.ly/seedsowingapparel

story:
WELCOME, PALS!

We are so excited to announce that Season Two is underway!  But this time, it's going to be bigger, better, and, yes, gayer.  Season One was completely self-funded and made on a small amount of money, and in order to build upon that and give you the Season Two you deserve... we're gonna need a little bit of help.

 

A little about us if you don't know...

For those of you stumbling upon us for the first time, GAL PALS is a short form, comedic LGBTQ web series that follows the interwoven lives of a group of women-loving women living in Los Angeles. Think of it as The L Word for the Broad City generation. It's light-hearted, it's romantic, and nearly all of the characters are LGBTQ. 

We surpassed over a million channel views and have nearly 20,000 subscribers, proving that there is an audience for these stories. 

Season One followed Bee, whose self-destructive game of cat and mouse came to a halt when she fell for one of her seemingly straight targets, Dylan.

The show is created by us, Sarah Soderquist & Kallie Tenney, two real-life 20-something gal pals living in Los Angeles. We worked with a small, yet crazy talented group of people to bring GAL PALS to life and we are beyond excited at the possibility of continuing this story. It has been so meaningful to us to create a show that we wished existed when we were figuring out our own sexualities. We want GAL PALS to be a reminder that it's alright to like who you like! 

 

Why should I donate? 

We have BIG plans for Season Two that we can't wait to share with you. But in order to do that, we need money, honey.  No money= no more GAL PALS. :( 

But fear not. This is where you come in.  The support we've found since the release of Season One has been amazing. If each of our YouTube subscribers donated just one dollar, we'd reach our goal in no time at all. 

Oh yeah, and have we mentioned the awesome perks included in our campaign? We're talking exclusive GAL PALS swag, people. Keep an eye out for the release of the exclusive IndieGoGo tee shirt design! 

 

Ok, I'm listening. How will the money be spent?

Filmmaking is great, but it can be pretty expensive.  In order to create the season two GAL PALS deserves, we want to go big or go home.  ALL funds raised will go towards:

  • Meals/Crafty - a well-fed cast and crew = a happy cast and crew!
  • Equipment - sound, camera, grip, electric
  • Production Design & Props -including but not limited to cheese puffs. 
  • Wardrobe - our characters have some pretty signature looks.  We want to make them even more unique.
  • Locations - This is a huge expense.  As much as we love Bee and Olivia's apartment, they don't always hang out there, believe it or not.
  • Post Production & Music - We had a killer soundtrack to season one, but acquiring the rights to those songs was not free.  We want to make the next soundtrack just as good, if not, better.
  • Production Insurance

 

That sounds great, but I don't have any money! 

First of all, we've been there. Hang in there. If you are unable to donate, we still love you! Please SHARE our campaign to spread the word!

story:
Sonkhonkett is a puppet, townie, comedy webseries and live show that details the lives of Boston's North Shore townies. I want to turn Sonkhonkett into an entertainment company that can pay artists, craftswomen/men and laborers a fair wage. These types of workers tend to get shafted in payment and if we want to hold on to our workers' rights in this world we need to fight the fight to make sure all people are paid fairly. What we raised will go to compensating these people that create wonderful art.

I'm Kyle Mackesey. I'm a jack of many trades and a proud Massachusetts Townie. For the past seven plus years I have been learning the craft of building hand- puppets along with writing comedy, building sets, drawing, lighting, video and audio work. Now that I have assembled a quorum for performance production I am ready to bring my puppet, Townie, comedy webseries: Sonkhonkett, to the wider world. This fictional town lies where the Rumney Marsh takes up Boston's North Shore towns of Revere and Saugus. The webseries aims to capture the local persona of the region, the Townie. Being one myself, we are a unique people that I feel is either overlooked or misrepresented in popular culture. For me there is no better way to parlay information than humor. I meticulous sculpt and gather jokes and comedic structures I feel capture the Massachusetts style of comedy. The show is ADULT (Not for children), ball-busting and fearless but done out of great love for the land that has shaped my ways and spirit.

Many hours, days, weeks, months and years has been invested into this town I call Sonkhonkett. Laying out every street of the town which you can check out at http://www.sonkhonkett.com/  , https://www.facebook.com/sonkhonkett/  and https://www.instagram.com/sonkhonkett/, researching North Shore history and creating the town's own lineage, building sets and figuring out how to film has pushed this project to it's next evolution. There are shorts on Youtube, https://www.youtube.com/user/skaskaskadank/videos , called "Sonkhonkett Samplers" that introduce the viewer to the world of this town.  They start out with limited production value but as time progressed over these past 5 years we have acquired a DSLR camera, a variety of sets and props, better audio and better lighting.

Sonkhonkett is about fun anthropology in a Squidbillies / Trailer Park Boys sort of manner but Sonkhonkett is more than that. I can't do Sonkhonkett without collaboration. My collaborators come from a variety of backgrounds and they kill at what they do. I want Sonkhonkett to become a production company that pays people for what they are worth. I, like many others who "Sonk The Honk" are artists and more often than not our work is rarely paid appropriately or even at all. Artists are skilled, passionate folk that deserve better. But this also applies to all workers. As the cost of living goes up and wages either stagnate or decrease many people struggle to survive and live a happy life. This production will not just need puppeteers, videographers, painters, sculptors but accountants, janitors, marketing folk, software engineers and you name it. We would like this $1,000 to act as an investment to forward us in the direction of creating a company that is fair to its workers. A company that will stay local to portray what is local because we got what no other state has got. GO MASSACHUSETTS!

story:
About Gay Accent

  • I'm a very gay boy who has dealt with depression for most of his life--luckily I also write and act! So I decided to create something funny about the struggle of pursuing your dreams whilst dealing with mental illness.
  • We've made it to the final stages of the project, and we're ready to pop this gayby out for the world to see, but we have to get the sound fixed up first.
  • By contributing to this project, you will help us wrap post-production and get the project posted online, as well as submitted to festivals.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We only need $500, which will go straight to the sound edit!
  • $5 gets you a personalized thank you email!
  • $10 gets you a thank you email, and a shoutout in the credits of an episode!
  • $25 gets you above prizes, and a link to the episodes before they premiere!
  • $50 gets you above prizes, and a producer credit!
  • If you donate $100 or more, you will get all of the above plus a special Gay Accent t-shirt!
  • Whether you're an artist yourself or not, this is a chance for you to be apart of creating something!

Risks & Challenges

  • If we don't reach our goal, the money we do get would still go towards the sound edit and I'll just have to figure out another way to pay my rent...
  • But we're going to reach the goal! Since I announced this web series, I've received so much moral support, and felt the excitement of family and friends. I know we can reach the finish line together.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't spare even $5, I live in Los Angeles, I get it. You can still help by sharing this campaign on social media, and watching/sharing Gay Accent when it premieres!

About Gay Accent

I'm a very gay boy who has dealt with depression for most of his life--luckily I also write and act! So I decided to create something funny about the struggle of pursuing your dreams whilst dealing with mental illness.
We've made it to the final stages of the project, and we're ready to pop this gayby out for the world to see, but we have to get the sound fixed up first.
By contributing to this project, you will help us wrap post-production and get the project posted online, as well as submitted to festivals.


What We Need & What You Get

We only need $500, which will go straight to the sound edit!
$5 gets you a personalized thank you email!
$10 gets you a thank you email, and a shoutout in the credits of an episode!
$25 gets you above prizes, and a link to the episodes before they premiere!
$50 gets you above prizes, and a producer credit!
If you donate $100 or more, you will get all of the above plus a special Gay Accent t-shirt!
Whether you're an artist yourself or not, this is a chance for you to be apart of creating something!


Risks & Challenges

If we don't reach our goal, the money we do get would still go towards the sound edit and I'll just have to figure out another way to pay my rent...
But we're going to reach the goal! Since I announced this web series, I've received so much moral support, and felt the excitement of family and friends. I know we can reach the finish line together.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't spare even $5, I live in Los Angeles, I get it. You can still help by sharing this campaign on social media, and watching/sharing Gay Accent when it premieres!

story:
FANGIRL 

FANGIRL follows the titular obsessive, Phoebe Schwartz, as she avenges the career-death of her celebrity crush, disgraced actor Julian Poole. Set in New York City, the show is a pitch black comedy that ties up celebrity worship, scandal in the social media era, and industry secrets and lies into one gordian knot. It's Crazy Ex-Girlfriend (albeit without the musical numbers) meets Mulholland Drive. 

REUNION 

REUNION follows four students who attend their 5 year high school reunion at their Upper East Side Private School. Through multiple timelines, the story explores the relationships between Rachel, Griffin, Lucy and Dylan and the decisions they have made that have led them to be the people that they have become.

REUNION follows four students who attend their 5 year high school reunion at their Upper East Side Private School. Through multiple timelines, the story explores the relationships between Rachel, Griffin, Lucy and Dylan and the decisions they have made that have led them to be the people that they have become.

story:
Now it's time to talk shop...

I'm Karen Joseph Adcock, a third year MFA student in Loyola Marymount University's Television Writing and Producing Program. Talking Shop is my graduate thesis project. I’m hoping to raise $5,000 to fund production and post-production for the first two episodes of this digital series.

Talking Shop is a project that’s incredibly special to me and has been a long time coming. It follows Leslie Thompson, a 40-something beauty salon owner whose shop and presence are both staples in her neighborhood. The season takes place over the course of one day, and each episode focuses on a woman or girl who comes to the shop for an appointment. As we learn about the women in her chair, we also learn more about Leslie, where she is in life and what she's keeping from her clients.

Episode One centers on Rochelle. Rochelle’s… doing her best. Two months out of jail and three months clean, she’s determined to regain custody of her two young kids at a court hearing later in the day. When she starts to become uneasy about the process, it’s up to Leslie to encourage her to not give up hope.

Episode Two focuses on Isabel, a young girl getting her first relaxer. As far as Isabel knows, she needs straight hair to be beautiful and that’s all that matters. Isabel’s the embodiment of the kind of values parents sometimes push on their children. Her steadfastness makes Leslie rethink her own parenting.

Outside the doors of the salon, life throws everything at these women. Inside these doors, however, they’re allowed and encouraged to literally let their hair down. The shop chair mimics the therapist’s couch and they’re able to let it all out for their stylist and confident, Leslie.

You Scratch My Scalp and I'll Scratch Yours!

Did you like what I did there?

While Talking Shop will eventually have a 10-episode season, I’m currently shooting the first two episodes as my thesis. The $5,000 you help me raise will be used for food, cast and crew, equipment, locations and post-production fees.

Any donation counts and will push me closer to my goal! Nothing is too small!

There are also great perks! The right side of this page details what you can get in return for helping fund this project. Each donation tier is named for a black hair style I’ve either enjoyed or admired from afar. Perks include social media shout outs, personalized thank yous and merch featuring original artwork designed by Talking Shop resident graphic artist Sasha Hollomon!

But... Why Should You Donate?

Talking Shop is a story ABOUT black women, created primarily BY black women! Over 75% of the crew are black women, and the intent is to have 100% of the cast be black women as well! 

Beyond the black women involved, every other cast and crew position on Talking Shop is filled by a woman. That’s right, no boys allowed! It was my mission to create a safe space for women on screen, and that safe space will be upheld by having women behind the camera as well.

This project shatters the idea that there’s no room for us in entertainment and will show viewers exactly what we can do!

The Team

Karen Joseph Adcock - Writer/Director/Executive Producer

I'm from the small town of Lake Charles, Louisiana where I got my first relaxer at the age of 11.  During undergrad at Columbia University, I decided to transition to wearing my natural hair for two reasons - 1. I wanted to embrace my natural beauty through my crown and 2. I was too lazy to put in the work to find a new stylist to press my hair. The rest is history - or should I say hairstory! As you've read, Talking Shop is incredibly important to me, and I couldn't be prouder of the team I've assembled to make it a reality.

Chloe Gardiner - Producer

Originally from Connecticut, Chloe always had a dream to work in the film industry. Hoping to accomplish her dreams, she packed her bags and left for the City of Angels. With goals of becoming a film producer, she has been helping directors and writers bring their visions to the big screen and allowing audiences to be immersed in interesting and unique stories. No stranger to hair salons, Chloe has had every style from relaxed hair, braids, twists, weaves, but is now embracing her thick, beautiful natural hair. 

Daion Chesney - Director of Photography

Originally from a small, one-horse town, Daion Chesney, has always creatively challenged herself by pushing the limits. She has developed a strong visual language through her photography that has helped her become a visual storyteller. Finishing up her senior year at Loyola Marymount University, she is picking up the camera to tell Karen’s story, Talking Shop, in order to capture the cultural experiences of the African-American community. In her free time, Daion likes to reread all the Harry Potter novels and maintain her wins at Jenga. 

Cierra Lockett - Assistant Director

Cierra Lockett is from Memphis, TN. A quirky 90s kid with a love for writing, she's been crafting stories that reflect her life and imagination from an early age. No stranger to the beauty shop, she has had the same stylist for the last 10 years, from relaxed to natural.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel you can donate, don't worry! There are still other ways you can help Talking Shop become a reality.  Spread the word, tell others about my project, share it on your social media, give me compliments when you see me, etc... Anything helps!

Thanks again for your time! I'll see you at the salon!

story:
Short Summary

Our web series will be set and shot in St. John's, Newfoundland. It will tell a tale of vanishing trust, moral ambiguity, the recent Fentanyl epidemic and how your decisions impact everyone around you. "Blue Moon" is a crime thriller as told through the eyes of a young, innocent woman who's approach to the situation she finds herself in will leave the audience wondering: what would I do?

We are excited to have the opportunity to tell a fast-paced crime thriller with a young woman at the helm and to showcase the lesser talked about side of the beautiful St. John's.

What makes us different than every other web series?

A web series is a great professional development tool as it gives you an opportunity to have your work seen by a wider audience. It is our goal for "Blue Moon" to be a professional development/learning experience for as many people as possible.  We plan to create a crew made up of professional and experienced department heads who will have assistants/crew working under them who are students or people in the early stages of their film careers. This will allow a mentorship for the students involved and an opportunity for them to network with local professionals.

What would your funding be put towards?

Not to pay ourselves! Production is expensive and any and all contributions wouldn't go a stray. Your funding will be spread between the production of each of the four episodes and will be distributed amongst props, production design, wardrobe and equipment rental. We are a micro-budget project operating under a $20'000.00 budget for all four episodes combined.

Perks!

The fun stuff. 

> $10.00 - a special thank you on our social media

> $25.00 - you get to see the show before everyone else! A password protected link to each episode will be sent to you before the release date you VIP you!

> $50.00 - we will send you a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

> $75.00 - your name will roll in a special thank you credit on one episode + you will receive a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

> $100.00 - your name will appear in a special thank you credit on all four episodes +your name will be entered in a contest to win a print by a local artist + you will receive a poster signed by one of our cast + some behind-the-scenes photos + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

> $150.00 - you will receive a special Skype call with our producer and you can ask them any questions you have about the process + a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

> $200.00 - you will receive an opportunity to have your very own script edited by our writer! they will go over your script and provide you with notes in a personal coffee meeting (if local) or via Skype (if out-of-town) + a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

> $500.00 - wow! thank you! you will receive the title of "Associate Producer" on all four episodes. + you will be sent an original copy of the scripts + you will be invited to come visit our set and meet the cast and crew + a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

>1000.00 - holy hannah! you will receive the credit title of "Executive Producer" of all four episodes + you will be invited to come visit our set and meet the cast and crew AND be a background performer in one of our scenes + you will be invited to a dinner with the producer and directors + you will be sent an original copy of all four scripts + a poster signed by one of our cast + a password protected link to see the show ahead of official release

 

Can't Donate Money?

You can still help by sharing this link on your social media accounts - we would greatly appreciate it!

story:
Hey! Hello! So, here’s the thing. Last year, I ran a Kickstarter campaign for Mr Biffo’s Found Footage – a campaign that was successful beyond anything I could have imagined.

Thanks to that money – a shade over £18k – I’ve learned a lot in the past year about how to make TV and film projects a reality.

One of the most important things I’ve learned is that making things is really bloody expensive. Even something like catering can eat up nearly a hundred quid a day.

Given that some of the money we raised must be earmarked for venue hire for our premiere, and DVDs, and the like… and the fact that Kickstarter takes a cut of the money… £18 grand isn’t even what we had to spend on the show. 

Still, since the completion of the Kickstarter campaign, we’ve bought props, costumes, software, equipment... we’ve hired studios, we’ve paid actors’ expenses, and the only way we’ve been able to do this, frankly, is because so many people were so generous in the first place, and because almost everyone who has done work on the series thus far has given their time and expertise for free. 

Because of that, I’ve tried to ensure that your faith in my ability to pull this off will be rewarded. This September, there will be at least six episodes of lunacy from Mr Biffo’s Found Footage – possibly more. I think the show looks at least as good as anything you’ll have seen on proper telly – and will be considerably stranger. We've songs, cartoons, sketches, bizarre TV shows - and more!

STYLE

I really want to end the series in style. The finale we have planned brings together the threads of backstory that are woven throughout the series. It's part of the series, but also something rather different. It is also going to be the most ambitious episode we’ve attempted – nothing less than a short science fiction movie, clocking in at around 20 minutes. To get an idea of what's planned, watch the video at the top of this page - though the actual finale will be even bigger, better, and more widescreen...

We’ve already booked a stunning location for two days filming later this month, started building the props and finishing the costumes, and we’ve got commitment from our cast. You WILL learn the strange and secret origin of Goujon John and Xenoxxx Industries. 

However… to realise this on screen isn’t cheap. I’ve already dipped quite deeply into my own pocket in order to make it a reality. As a result of the main series being funded – and then some - a number of you have suggested I try to avoid poverty by launching another Kickstarter to help pay for the finale. 

EXPENSES

Here are the three main outstanding expenses on the Location hire: £800 Accommodation for cast and crew: £650 (approx.) Vehicle hire: £300 (approx.). 

That doesn’t take into account the props, costumes, and equipment (such as a camera jib, a new DLSR, and a Steadicam) purchased already with the finale in mind. So, ideally, we need to raise at least £1750 to cover the above. That's what I'm asking for (plus a little extra to cover fees etc.).

If we make more than I'm asking for, I'll ensure all of it goes into the filming. We still need to pay for a number of prosthetic masks, pyrotechnics, and prop purchases, plus CGI effects. I promise that every penny will be up there on the screen for you to enjoy - and I'll find a way to use your donations creatively. If you've always wanted to see a version of Aliens where the monsters are living bums... then this is what you've been waiting for.

NO OBLIGATION

I know a lot of you reading this will have given already to Mr Biffo's Found Footage via Kickstarter - and I completely understand you not wanting to fork out again for the finale. There's absolutely no obligation here: the finale will be getting made one way or another. 

However, we've come up with what I think are a nice selection of unique rewards for those who do fancy backing it. Some are designed for those who didn't get to support the series first time around, and some may be of interest to those who have already. Take a look!

And thanks for reading this. I will hopefully see you in the vortex...

Paul

story:
Summary

For the past 8 months, I’ve been sharing what I’ve learned in 27 years of art study with each of you through my Facebook Live videos.  I’ve been honored and astounded by the reception these videos have received – often with over 3,000 of you tuning in to enjoy the live videos.   It has brought me an incredible amount of joy.  Through the process, I got the idea to develop this into something more, and have collaborated with Emmy-award winning producers to develop a TV show concept called "Paint Your Adventure.”  The theme of the show will be all about capturing the heart and soul of plein air painting (painting in the outdoors), while exploring adventure and honoring and preserving our nation’s parks and natural areas.  

Recently, I shared that I am a cancer survivor. Getting into the outdoors to paint and explore has had healing and inspirational benefits for me, and I want to share that experience on a broader spectrum.  

In order to make this possible, I’ll need your support.  I’m looking to raise $10,000 to fund a Pilot episode and sizzle reel of “Paint Your Adventure” which we will use to present the concept to distributors… which means that if everyone who has been enjoying my videos donated just $10, we’d easily reach our goal!  

My vision for the full series is about embracing the beauty of nature by plein air painting coupled with the adventure offered at specific locations - from horseback riding in the Rocky Mountains to hiking the Grand Canyon, to kayaking, camping and exploring Hawaii Volcanoes National Park and so on!  It’s part art instruction, part travel, part adventure.

I'd love to raise enough to allow for guests to come along this adventure with me.   Sometimes that guest may be a seasoned professional artist sharing inspiration and conversation, or the guest may be a beginner, ready to explore the joys of painting in the great outdoors for the first time.  I want to encourage others to realize the possibility of discovering a the joy and experience of painting en plein air, and discovering a new adventure that awaits!

What We Need & What You Get

Jeremy Salo, Emmy-winning producer of “Your Brush with Nature” on Netflix has teamed up with me to create this series.  He and his crew are based in Michigan, and for $10,000 we could shoot in the beautiful Great Lakes area, so I set the fundraising goal at $10K. 

I am very excited about this opportunity to bring this to the world and since I am asking you for help, it is not without incentive, so I’m giving my art to top donors to thank them for their help in achieving this goal!

I will be gifting original plein air oil paintings that I have done to top donors:

$10 signed postcard of one of Jessica Henry's paintings, thanking you for your donation.

$30 A signed 16" x 12" Print of "Open Mind & Open Sea" Jessica's newest painting.

$50 A signed print plus a one time special offer of 30% OFF any art work from Jessica's web site (Less work that is currently at Sunti World Art Gallery)

$100 The same as the ($50) offer, but 50% off any art work from Jessica's web site (Less work that is currently at Sunti World Art Gallery)

$200 Original 5" x 7" (or 6" x 8") Oil Painting

$500 donated – an original 8" x 10" oil painting.

$1,000 donated – an original  "11 x 14" oil painting. 

$2,000 donated - an original 16" x 20" oil painting. 

And if you are one of those amazing souls who would like to donate $5,000, I will send you a very large spectacular landscape oil painting, approximately 24’’ x 48.” 

All things considered, if everyone that has enjoyed one of my videos gave just $10, it would more than help us get the ball rolling on this fantastic journey.  

The Impact

I’ve shared the experience of plein air painting with my 10 year old daughter, and we have created incredible memories together.  As a cancer survivor, I would also love the possibility of offering interested children of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital the opportunity to paint along with me in the restorative ambiance of nature, and feel the joy of creating a painting outside!

As a contributor to this project you will be helping this vision of inspiring people to get out and enjoy nature, respect and preserve our nation's natural areas, and find the renewing qualities of capturing a moment with brush and paint in the heart of stunning natural scenery.  

My current instructional videos have been enjoyed thousands of times by viewers and continue to grow in popularity, thus spreading the inspiration and rejuvenating qualities of being surrounded by nature, and keeping the Plein Air Movement thriving and alive.

Join us in creating an inspirational and exciting gateway into the world of outdoor painting and exploration!

Other Ways You Can Help

We have one month to raise the funds, as we aim to shoot this in early summer.  If you feel inspired to share this with your friends who might like to support the arts, please do.
story_txt:
Summary
For the past 8 months, I’ve been sharing what I’ve learned in 27 years of art study with each of you through my Facebook Live videos.  I’ve been honored and astounded by the reception these videos have received – often with over 3,000 of you tuning in to enjoy the live videos.   It has brought me an incredible amount of joy.  Through the process, I got the idea to develop this into something more, and have collaborated with Emmy-award winning producers to develop a TV show concept called "Paint Your Adventure.”  The theme of the show will be all about capturing the heart and soul of plein air painting (painting in the outdoors), while exploring adventure and honoring and preserving our nation’s parks and natural areas.  
Recently, I shared that I am a cancer survivor. Getting into the outdoors to paint and explore has had healing and inspirational benefits for me, and I want to share that experience on a broader spectrum.  
In order to make this possible, I’ll need your support.  I’m looking to raise $10,000 to fund a Pilot episode and sizzle reel of “Paint Your Adventure” which we will use to present the concept to distributors… which means that if everyone who has been enjoying my videos donated just $10, we’d easily reach our goal!  
My vision for the full series is about embracing the beauty of nature by plein air painting coupled with the adventure offered at specific locations - from horseback riding in the Rocky Mountains to hiking the Grand Canyon, to kayaking, camping and exploring Hawaii Volcanoes National Park and so on!  It’s part art instruction, part travel, part adventure.
I'd love to raise enough to allow for guests to come along this adventure with me.   Sometimes that guest may be a seasoned professional artist sharing inspiration and conversation, or the guest may be a beginner, ready to explore the joys of painting in the great outdoors for the first time.  I want to encourage others to realize the possibility of discovering a the joy and experience of painting en plein air, and discovering a new adventure that awaits!
What We Need & What You Get
Jeremy Salo, Emmy-winning producer of “Your Brush with Nature” on Netflix has teamed up with me to create this series.  He and his crew are based in Michigan, and for $10,000 we could shoot in the beautiful Great Lakes area, so I set the fundraising goal at $10K. 
I am very excited about this opportunity to bring this to the world and since I am asking you for help, it is not without incentive, so I’m giving my art to top donors to thank them for their help in achieving this goal!
I will be gifting original plein air oil paintings that I have done to top donors:
$10 signed postcard of one of Jessica Henry's paintings, thanking you for your donation.
$30 A signed 16" x 12" Print of "Open Mind & Open Sea" Jessica's newest painting.
$50 A signed print plus a one time special offer of 30% OFF any art work from Jessica's web site (Less work that is currently at Sunti World Art Gallery)
$100 The same as the ($50) offer, but 50% off any art work from Jessica's web site (Less work that is currently at Sunti World Art Gallery)
$200 Original 5" x 7" (or 6" x 8") Oil Painting
$500 donated – an original 8" x 10" oil painting.
$1,000 donated – an original  "11 x 14" oil painting. 
$2,000 donated - an original 16" x 20" oil painting. 
And if you are one of those amazing souls who would like to donate $5,000, I will send you a very large spectacular landscape oil painting, approximately 24’’ x 48.” 
All things considered, if everyone that has enjoyed one of my videos gave just $10, it would more than help us get the ball rolling on this fantastic journey.  
The Impact
I’ve shared the experience of plein air painting with my 10 year old daughter, and we have created incredible memories together.  As a cancer survivor, I would also love the possibility of offering interested children of St. Jude Children's Research Hospital the opportunity to paint along with me in the restorative ambiance of nature, and feel the joy of creating a painting outside!
As a contributor to this project you will be helping this vision of inspiring people to get out and enjoy nature, respect and preserve our nation's natural areas, and find the renewing qualities of capturing a moment with brush and paint in the heart of stunning natural scenery.  
My current instructional videos have been enjoyed thousands of times by viewers and continue to grow in popularity, thus spreading the inspiration and rejuvenating qualities of being surrounded by nature, and keeping the Plein Air Movement thriving and alive.
Join us in creating an inspirational and exciting gateway into the world of outdoor painting and exploration!
Other Ways You Can Help
We have one month to raise the funds, as we aim to shoot this in early summer.  If you feel inspired to share this with your friends who might like to support the arts, please do.

story:
Rendered in Unreal Engine 4 using a custom cel shader developed by our internal code ninjas, Abyssian Knights is a cross-media IP making its first appearance as a web series. The base funding goal of our crowdfunding campaign is to fund the production of the first two episodes and improve the quality of the final product.

The story itself focuses around Aria, a young woman who's gone a bit too far infiltrating a clandestine organization in hopes of burying a secret she's been hiding.

Conceptually, we took the drama and mystery from a Cold War spy story and mashed it up with a modern fantasy version of the secretive Knights Templar. All done in the style of Japanese anime with a splash of Hong Kong action cinema.

story:
Who the hell are we?

We are a gaggle of young(ish) performers living in NYC, working to bring a voice to the entertainment industry for an underrepresented population of the LGBT community-- the nerd!

With the positive outpouring from season one-- and the successes of web series like My Gay Roommate and The Guild-- viewers have shown that they relate to our characters and our brand of storytelling. They love us! They really love us!

The Queens Project Team:

Creator/Writer: Ken Arpino

Production: A stori A Film 

Producing: It Gets Funnier and Wolfbane Productions 

Director: Dustin Williams

Cast: 

Ash: Ken Arpino

Gabe: BJ Gruber

Nick: Trey Gerrald

Nick 2: Tim Murray

Andre: Andre Jordan

Trey: Chris Dwan

Mike: Ian Paget

Plus some fun, new characters we can't wait to introduce to you.

Why do you boys want my donation?

Season two hit the mark-- viewers have been super engaged and have been sending us brilliant messages! We have an incredible team assembled for season three, but production takes time, equipment, marketing, and so much more-- all of which demands those Benjamins. In order to bring you the best product we can, we need your support!

We’ve crunched the numbers and trimmed the fat.

Budget Items Breakdown:

  1. Crew
  2. Cast
  3. Camera Equipment
  4. Lighting Equipment
  5. Audio Equipment
  6. Craft Services (especially for Ash)
  7. Locations/Transportation
  8. Post-Production! (Editing, color, scoring, audio correction, etc)
  9. Publicity/Marketing Costs
  10. Graphic Design

The Queens Project is meant to be used as a positive tool for the LGBT community. We have had viewers from all over the world telling how much the show means to them.

No donation is too big-- I mean too small-- and every little bit helps! We understand that not everyone can show their support through financial donations. That’s okay! You can help us out if you SHARE this campaign, SUBSCRIBE on YouTube, leave us a COMMENT, and FOLLOW us on all social media platforms for updates and pics. Most importantly, keep watching!

Thank you for all your love and support! We look forward to bringing you smiles and laughs with season 3 of The Queens Project!

Catch up here: Season Two Playlist or Season One Playlist

Some media love:

Out Magazine

GuysLikeU

Times Ledger

story:
Think The Flying Nun, All the fun but without the Aerodynamics!! 

Thank you for stopping by just now! I am Jacqi Bowe, creator of the show. My roots in comedy go way back when in third grade, I begged my mom to enroll me in Catholic school. Yes, it's true! At age seven,  I decided we needed religion and  after shopping around signed right up with the Catholics. So into Parochial School I marched, incredulous to some of my fellow students some who had been dragged screaming and kicking into the 3rd grade.  Our delightful Sister Katherine played folk guitar and made us laugh. This all changed in the 4th grade when we got Sister-To-Remain-Nameless and I realized the dire necessity of comedy to make it through homeroom and life!

 

At Sacred Heart Parochial school I found my calling. To become a nun...on television!!!!!

My past credits so you will know I have the chops to be a show runner!

I have been touring non-stop with The Jacqi Bowe Variety Show for the past fifteen years. Notable gigs before this whirlwind run, include the

  • national company of A CHORUS LINE,
  • dancing for Kenny Ortega on Young Turks
  • industrials with celebrities including Tim Conway,
  • performing in "Show Biz Is" as a Kid Of The Kingdom at Disneyland, 
  • starring in the comedy sit com pilot-"In The Soup"
  • guest starring in Spike TV's  Reality Show World Worst Tenant. (Please don't tell my landlady)

I have written, produced and acted in numerous videos on youtube for Life Boat Coaches and Our Lady of Hollywood and Vine. And have been encouraged by the thousands of views and enthusiastic comments from fans.

 I have romped on stages doing

  • Improv at Second City, The Comedy Store and Bang Theater.
  • A national Stand-Up Tour of the Pacific Northwest and Mid-West USA
  • AND
  • I won first place for my cartoon strip "The Add-ventures of Pam'la Pesto Perfekt-The Perfekt Estrogen American" in the Charles M Shultz Cartoon Contest at the Marin County Fair and was published in The San Jose Mercury News, Campbell Times and Santa Cruz Good Times. 

The Consecration of Sister Mary Mallarkey

I created this unorthodox Irish Catholic Nun in my solo character solo show, "Jacqi Bowe is Not Quite Herself" and "Emotional Garage Sale".  Sister Mary Mallarkey was an instant onstage hit and my audiences insisted I write a sit com for her. So for the past few years I have done just that!

Why it's time for a comedy starring Sister Mary Mallarkey

Not since the Flying Nun has there been an American comedy set in the Catholic Church. With the scandals surrounding this institution in recent years, we can probably see why no network has been green lighting any Sister Beatrice-centric pilots! HOWEVER!! There are many recovering Catholics out there that could use some healing from laughter,  devout Catholics, lapsed, ex-Catholics, who appreciate the irreverent and atheists who have a daily requirement for the spiritually absurd.

 Mischief Mission Statement

I am dedicated to bringing laughter to the world.

Funding the Fun, Helping out with The Hilarity, 

Our immediate goal is to raise enough money to get this series off the ground. We will use the funding to shoot the pilot and one more episode to jump start the show’s first season. We hope to follow the business of "High Maintenance" which started as a web series and is now a comedy show on HBO.

Our Lady has been in research and development for a couple of years,  and I just know it will bring you joy and laughter. Let's make this together. With your help we can produce a visually stunning show and a side-splitting hit. We can all say we knew each other when!

I have surrounded myself with a top notch cast so we can't go wrong! Robert Babish, Jake Novak, Steve Cardwell, Garrett Miller, Linda Lodge, to name a few! 

Here are some of the things for which we shall use your love offerings!

Equipment  rentals

Locations and sets (Churches don't come easy!)

Director and Crew

Lighting (Sister Mallarkey is fussy about her close ups)

Sound (Gotta hear the jokes)

Props and wardrobe (Hollywood Costume Shoppe got us thus far but it's time for authenticity)

Insurance and legal

Pre-production

Stipends for the writing team and crew - it’s important to pay artists and technicians for their work!

Food for hungry staff during 12-hour shoots 

Post-production

Celebrity Cameos (A listers have a price)

Marketing (God is omnipotent but the people need to be told about it!)

This is just the beginning.  We have lofty goals and are well aware that Comedy Central, Hulu, Amazon, Netflix are all looking for the next new funny thing! Let's make this IT!

 

Jacqi Bowe  writer/producer/creator

You already heard my story! Let's hear about the top notch team I am lucky enough to have attracted to the project.

 

Robert Babish,  Father Abernathy/Creative Consultant

is from Philadelphia where he received a BA in Theatre and Film from Temple University. He moved to San Francisco in 1980 to attend The American Conservatory Theatre. Working under many of the Equity contracts there including a season at The Berkley Repertory Theatre. He has also been a set designer and talent agent for children. With three years in NYC. He has been living in Los Angeles working in film and Television for 12 years. Appearing on shows like Frank TV, Studio 60, Rules of Engagement, Twenty Good Years, Californication and Your Family or Mine. Film credits include The Soloist, 2012 , Batman: The Dark Night Rises, Viva, Choose Connor and Punching the Clown. Most of all he enjoys his creative partnership with Jacqi Bowe on Lifeboat Coaches and Our Lady of Hollywood and Vine.


 

 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help!!!

    Check out the perks to find the one that’s right for you. We have so many fun gifts to show our appreciation ranging from credits in the first episode to digital downloads, t-shirts, Home Concerts by Sister Mary Mallarkey, acting and extra roles and even Exorcism Insurance.

    If you aren’t able to contribute dollars, you can help tremendously by sharing this page with your own network! You can help us spread the word on Facebook, Instagram, email, re-tweet us, Tumblir, whispering to your neighbor at church, making new friends at Starbucks or whatever your go-to communication mode is! Thank you so much! 

    Warning: Not endorsed or dispensation-ed by the Vatican...YET!!!

story:
Short Summary

Gotham Knights is a fan series that a couple of cosplayers and a production company (Eaze Day) came up with because we have an extreme love for these characters and wanted to tell their story. But we can only do that with your help. Please help us make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get

Things like Actors, locations, costumes and props don't come cheap and it's a HUGE burden when you pay for those things out of pocket. So we're looking to the community to help us make this series as great as it can be.

Risks & Challenges

This will be the biggest project we have EVER DONE, but we plan on making it the best we've ever done as well.

story:
What it is

"Threads" is a series about a thrift store written and created by Emily Ashenden. Every episode follows a piece of clothing being bought, sold, or donated. Through the clothing, we meet the people.

Team:

Writer/Actor/Producer- Emily Ashenden

Director/Producer- Taylor Washington

Producer/Actor- Sophie Parens

Cinematographer- Emmett Kerr-Perkinson 

Pan-Up Productions

(Visit our website for bios!)

www.threads-series.com

What We Need

Help us reach our budget to get us into production and make the best pilot we can and subsequently make the best series we can! ANYTHING helps. From $1-$100, you are giving us a huge hand. 

Any donation over $20 and we will shout you out in the credits (and forever be in your debt).

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in the position to lend a financial hand, you can STILL HELP! Whether it's sharing this campaign or our website, it would be great if you could make any noise to bring this project into the light. 

We love you and appreciate you!
