story:
EFFIE IS SINGLE AND SHE’S FINE!!

No, really, she is – at least with being single.

What Effie’s NOT fine with is feeling singled out. With all of her friends in committed relationships, Effie struggles to connect with them as the perpetual third wheel.

Though hijinks, potty humor, and passive aggressiveness abound, this series not only celebrates the friendships that make us feel whole, but also examines the qualities that render us as wholly individual.

 

WHY THE EFF ARE WE DOING THIS?

Because as actual and former singles ourselves (if you’re trying to guess, RUDE), each of us has struggled to learn the difference between being alone and being on your own. At one point or another, we’ve likely all asked ourselves – am I as an individual really enough?

As Effie herself comes to realize, the beauty of friends vs lovers is that you get to have more than one (unless you’re into that, which is awesome and we’re jealous). With friends, you don’t have to be everything for one person, and one person does not have to be everything for you – you can get more than everything you need from several wonderful (if sometimes crazy) people.

 

WE’LL GET BY WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM OUR FRIENDS

As with all things Hollywood and glamorous (which we obviously are), a web series costs money – and that’s where you, our friends and family come in. If you enjoyed the trailer above and want to see more, please consider donating whatever you can. And if you can’t donate, we totally understand (we are arts majors) – you can also support us by sharing our page on social media! #LiterallyPayItForward

Seriously though, thank you so much for taking the time to visit our page and watch the trailer. Whether you’re able to donate a penny, a pretty penny, likes and/or shares, whatever offer you make will be one we can’t refuse.

 

EFF YEAH, INCENTIVES!

If you are able to donate, you have the option of receiving one of receiving some rad swag – you can find further details on the right hand side of the page!

 

WAIT, BUT WHO THE EFF ARE WE?

 

Rebecca Munley (Writer, Actor - “Effie”)

Rebecca is an alumnus of Tinder, Bumble, OKCupid, and most recently, The League. She also has a Masters in Writing for Screen and Television from USC and a BS (yup) in Theatre from Northwestern University. Additionally, Rebecca once won a Harry Potter-themed spelling bee. Ask her why she’s single.

 

Linda Barsi (Director)

Linda is a writer, director with an MFA in Screenwriting that she recently acquired from the University of Southern California. She has been a Video Producer at BuzzFeed Video and is a regular guest speaker at VidCon—the world’s largest conference for online video. Her proudest accomplishment is her YouTube channel where she gives 17,000+ subscribers fun life advice, including how to find a good therapist and why some guys won’t date you when you vlog (www.youtube.com/openellbey). Linda would also like everyone to know that she met her awesome boyfriend (who appears in the video above) on Tinder. That’s right, folks—on Tinder. Linda thanks the lordy above for such a miracle because she went on a lot of bad dates. Like. A lot of them.

 

Ben Greene (Producer)

Ben is a writer and producer with a degree in film and narrative studies from USC film school in 2015. Ben's theater and film work has been featured at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and the Cannes Film Festival, where Ben won the Creative Mind Competition's Best Film and Best Director award. Now Ben works full time in television production on shows like The Mayor, The Guest Book, The Great Indoors, Real Housewives of Beverly Hills and Dr Ken. Lately Ben’s been leaning into Jswipe because his grandma told him to start dating in the tribe. Ben takes his grandma very seriously.

 

Hey, you made it to the end of the page! You really do love us! And we love you. Once again, thank you so much for checking out our campaign and showing your support - you truly are the bee's knees.
story_txt: EFFIE IS SINGLE AND SHE’S FINE!!No, really, she is – at least with being single.What Effie’s NOT fine with is feeling singled out. With all of her friends in committed relationships, Effie struggles to connect with them as the perpetual third wheel.Though hijinks, potty humor, and passive aggressiveness abound, this series not only celebrates the friendships that make us feel whole, but also examines the qualities that render us as wholly individual. WHY THE EFF ARE WE DOING THIS?Because as actual and former singles ourselves (if you’re trying to guess, RUDE), each of us has struggled to learn the difference between being alone and being on your own. At one point or another, we’ve likely all asked ourselves – am I as an individual really enough?As Effie herself comes to realize, the beauty of friends vs lovers is that you get to have more than one (unless you’re into that, which is awesome and we’re jealous). With friends, you don’t have to be everything for one person, and one person does not have to be everything for you – you can get more than everything you need from several wonderful (if sometimes crazy) people. WE’LL GET BY WITH A LITTLE HELP FROM OUR FRIENDSAs with all things Hollywood and glamorous (which we obviously are), a web series costs money – and that’s where you, our friends and family come in. If you enjoyed the trailer above and want to see more, please consider donating whatever you can. And if you can’t donate, we totally understand (we are arts majors) – you can also support us by sharing our page on social media! #LiterallyPayItForwardSeriously though, thank you so much for taking the time to visit our page and watch the trailer. Whether you’re able to donate a penny, a pretty penny, likes and/or shares, whatever offer you make will be one we can’t refuse. EFF YEAH, INCENTIVES!If you are able to donate, you have the option of receiving one of receiving some rad swag – you can find further details on the right hand side of the page! WAIT, BUT WHO THE EFF ARE WE? Rebecca Munley (Writer, Actor - “Effie”)Rebecca is an alumnus of Tinder, Bumble, OKCupid, and most recently, The League. She also has a Masters in Writing for Screen and Television from USC and a BS (yup) in Theatre from Northwestern University. Additionally, Rebecca once won a Harry Potter-themed spelling bee. Ask her why she’s single. Linda Barsi (Director)Linda is a writer, director with an MFA in Screenwriting that she recently acquired from the University of Southern California. She has been a Video Producer at BuzzFeed Video and is a regular guest speaker at VidCon—the world’s largest conference for online video. Her proudest accomplishment is her YouTube channel where she gives 17,000+ subscribers fun life advice, including how to find a good therapist and why some guys won’t date you when you vlog (www.youtube.com/openellbey). Linda would also like everyone to know that she met her awesome boyfriend (who appears in the video above) on Tinder. That’s right, folks—on Tinder. Linda thanks the lordy above for such a miracle because she went on a lot of bad dates. Like. A lot of them. Ben Greene (Producer)Ben is a writer and producer with a degree in film and narrative studies from USC film school in 2015. Ben's theater and film work has been featured at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival and the Cannes Film Festival, where Ben won the Creative Mind Competition's Best Film and Best Director award. Now Ben works full time in television production on shows like The Mayor, The Guest Book, The Great Indoors, Real Housewives of Beverly Hills and Dr Ken. Lately Ben’s been leaning into Jswipe because his grandma told him to start dating in the tribe. Ben takes his grandma very seriously. Hey, you made it to the end of the page! You really do love us! And we love you. Once again, thank you so much for checking out our campaign and showing your support - you truly are the bee's knees.

story:
Help us create TV for your idle moments!

We're Joe and Joe, and we want to create original, short content for you to watch daily and conveniently. There's a lot of original content out there, but we aim to make dependably unique and interesting shorts. Like, it won't be pranks, or videos of people's pets and children. It will be interesting. Don't believe us? Well, good thing we aren't asking for much!

We've set our goal at $2000. Enough to put into getting the camera and our gear. We'll cover the rest, and then you'll get an enriched feed on your social media of choice.

 Anything you can give to help us reach this goal would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

story:
I Swear It’s Not Boring is a comedy about local public radio - yeah, yeah, we swear it’s not boring. The show is about WNKD Darien, a fictional NPR member station in a fictional town in suburban Ohio that is profoundly bored by the smooth voices and smooth jazz of wannabe-NPR. Our series follows Eliza, a smart but hypersensitive pipe dreamer with a This American Life-esque show perpetually on the brink of cancellation, and the rest of WNKD Darien staff as they face budget cuts, bored listeners, and their own lofty ambitions trying to hang onto their jobs and pay tribute to the town they call home.

I Swear It’s Not Boring is a full-length pilot and four 10 to 15 minute subsequent episodes. It’s a quick-witted character comedy and a love letter to public media, relentless optimists, Ira Glass, dying industries, strategy board games, suburban boredom, and people who cry in public.

 

Gabbi Boyd as Eliza, the host of thematic storytelling show Our Darien Everyday (very different from This American Life, and, in fact, if you close one ear, better); a hopeless optimist with an emphasis on the hopeless

(She's also the writer and showrunner, so here's a bit about her if you're gonna give our show money: Gabbi is a Chicago-based funnygirl. She’s studied and performed in Chicago with the Second City Conservatory, Second City’s Comedy Studies, iO Chicago, and The Annoyance. She studied writing and acting for the stage and screen at Ball State University where she won awards for her full-length sketch show Nobody Panic and her one-act play Friends in High Places and got lucky enough to have conversations about writing and acting with smart people like Mindy Kaling, Spike Jonze, and Ted Griffin. She’s been featured on the web as an actor in series like The Soon to be Cancelled Sketch Show and Go Fund Yourselves (which she also co-created). She likes writing jokes and characters much more than writing boastful paragraphs about her work and thus would like to stop bragging now.)

 

Laura Petro as Gina, WNKD's sound engineer; cold as ice and full of hot air.

(She's also the producer, so here's a bit about her if you're gonna give our show money: Laura is a graduate of Depaul University's Digital Cinema program. She has worked as a producer, art director, production designer, and assistant director on feature and short films such as Bernadette. Putt World, Lo Que Pasa, White Noise, Wouldn't That Be Something, Wham, and more. As a comedian, she is one half of Chicago sketch duo Meggie and Laura, with whom she has written and performed four original revues and traveled across the country performing her work in festivals and showcases. She has the same personality as lemonade.)

 

           

Henrik Blix as Topher, the host of Room and Board, the inexplicably popular talk show about tabletop games; Topher is a man of many apologies, endless trivia, and gentle charm.

 

    

Caleb Hearon as Simon, the host of classical music show Difficult Listening; the quickest and queerest person in Darien, Simon insists he knows more than Bach and should need no introduction. In a nod to The New Yorker, Simon "has nothing nice to say" and will instead "say something clever but devastating".

 

Devin Middleton as Kyle, the host of Big Questions, a meditation on spirituality and existence; Kyle is a certified cool guy with a new crisis every week. Please, don't ask him about his theory of relativity.

 

Seth Thomas as Ed, WNKD station manager who is perpetually and unflinchingly at the end of his patience.

 

                                                                     

Devin Sullins, Director of Photography: His photo is small but his talent is huge. He makes things beautiful.

 

Making film and TV is costly. It takes a special kind of clever to keep your bar for quality high and your budget reasonable. All funds from this campaign will cover the season’s costs from start to finish. Our budget begins with the big things, like deposits on locations and equipment rentals and stretches all the way to the other side with festival submissions and promotional material, because a tree falls in the forest and… yeah, you know how it goes.

Here’s where your money would be going:

 

And here's when you can expect us to be doing, yknow, the stuff your money would be helping us pay for:

PRE-PRODUCTION: March 2018 - May 2018

PRINCIPAL PHOTOGRAPHY/PRODUCTION: June 2018 - August 2018

POST-PRODUCTION: September 2018 - October 2018

RELEASE: November 2018

TAKING THE LITERAL SHOW ON THE LITERAL ROAD (Festivals): Spring/Summer 2019

I Swear It's Not Boring in rehearsal

 

Here he is.

 

A lot of people can be funny. We are making something that is funny, but it’s also sweet and smart and warm-hearted. Making your own project is tiring, costly, and really quite difficult, but we are practiced in doing it anyway. It’s worth it to take a look at the world, see what you’d like more of, and create it in a tiny way.

We don’t need to tell you that the internet is the new access point to the film and television industry. You probably have a Netflix account - you know how this works. But we aren’t just making a show so we can shop it around to people with more money and resources than us. We’re making a show that’s the kind of show we’d want to watch, want to be in, want to make even if we had all the money and resources. If we had the money and resources that Netflix does, we’d still want to make I Swear It’s Not Boring.

We put together a team of people who should be making great things that get seen. Let’s make a great thing and get it seen.

story:
"Allow me to introduce myself!"

Hello! I'm Will DiNola, the Creator of "Independent Music." I am currently in New York City-- or the big Tim Apple, as I call it! Here I am busily working, both in the planning (we television and film people call this "pre-production) stage of this project and doing internships and other freelance work in the city!

 

Project History

I have been recording my own music and creating my own film projects since I can remember and now it's all culminating into one project. The idea was originally conceived in my freshman year of college. After putting on house shows, touring the East Coast, and recording our own material with Golf of Mexico, and later continuing in the same fashion with Val Jester in Philadelphia, I realized the complexity, hypocrisy, and most importantly, the humor that comes with being "Do-it-yourself" (that's DIY) touring band. So I wrote a script about it.

Fast forward three years later to preparing my senior project, I realized that I wanted to make something that was easily producible (using my friends and family) AND that included all of my passions (music, comedy, and sitcoms!). So I rewrote the script just for that. 

And now I need you! Yes, YOU!

Making films and television is difficult. And everything has been written, designed, and planned so that it can be accomplished in the most cost-effective manner, but there are still a few things that we need YOUR help with!

 

"What Do We Need?"

Well, yes. Your money. But for what? 

We've got a lot covered, so really we are only asking that you help support us to cover:

  •  Food: feeding a cast and crew can get pricey, especially since we won't be serving McDonald's.
  • Transport: many of us are in New York and many of us are also in Philadelphia. So it's not too bad of a trip, but it's still a trip!

 

"Why donate? Why me?"

Besides being the capstone project for my graduating college, this project is very important to me. I like to think I have a decent track record-- I've made dozens of shorts and dozens of songs. But this will be BETTER than all of that. It will be all of it COMBINED!

Here are some links of relevant material I've done in the past:

  • A short film making fun of Rick and Morty fans (with the cast of Independent Music).
  • A short film I made for my experimental video class.
  • A mockumentary about colors.
  • A fake tutorial for an emo song.
  • A short film with the kind of humor you might find in Independent Music.
  • This Napoleon Dynamite-esque short film about a band and it's a sequel made years ago with my cousins.

Also, YOU'LL GET STUFF! There are a variety of perks-- exclusive music written and recorded by the cast, your name in the credits, executive producer title, a blooper reel and MORE!

In Conclusion

In conclusion, please help us out. We love television and we love you! You're the best. With your help filming will start the end of this semester! The film will be edited this summer with plans for eventual release in Fall of 2019!

Also, keep an eye out on social media and on this page for more updates and promotions!

story:
What's so special about Fancy-Free?

Fancy-Free is a found footage style music video web series occuring in Uncanny Valley-- a dystopian resort located  in the heart of Death Valley, frozen in 2007 after a national government collapse. This story aims to please music-lovers and binge-watchers alike with 12 weird and wacky narrative episodes and 8 intermittent music videos from a concept album. It's a sci-fi crime show wrapped in a whimsical Tim Burton-esque look, and driven by a cast of badass girls struggling with power dynamics and what it means to be human in a mass-market dystopia.

Riley Buffington began Psykobreak! in his senior year of high school performing at his talent show and battle of the bands. Since then, he's directed four music videos underneath the same story-driven concept, the last three of which have been with Klopfgeist Amusement, a production group he helped to form after moving from California to the DC area.

The plan has always been to make Psykobreak! into a series, and now is the time. Riley has a dedicated team of filmmakers, and an amazing group of performers ready to bring the characters to life on the screen as well as sing on the show's concept album.

We hope this series will also serve as a proof-of-concept, potentially paving way for four albums chronicling the adventures and mishaps of the doll-girls and their ever-plotting creator.

Here's where you come in...

Our team is so dedicated to bringing this story to life, and we are unbelievably excited to take on this challenge. With songs and scripts already in the works, we need your help so that we can film Fancy-Free this summer!

With your support, we can cover the costs of everything that goes into making this web-series, from wigs and gaff tape, to food for our crew.

Where's your money going?

We're going to be working with a shoestring budget considering the scale of this project, so we're lucky to have a cast and crew ready to volunteer their time, talents, and hardwork. To keep costs down, we have to be creative. We're working as much as possible with what we already have, thrifting for our new costumes, and making some DIY equipment. That still leaves us needing $4,700, and as a group of aspiring artists, we can't cover for everything out of pocket. Here's what you'd be helping us pay for:

  • We need about $900 to assemble costumes for our otherworldly characters
  • To feed our lovely cast and crew throughout filming of all episodes will cost about $800
  • We have most of our equipment already, but will need $1,130 more for some upgrades
  • All our props, production design materials, and special FX have an estimated budget of $570
  • To cover travel costs of going between locations around MD/VA/DC will be about $500
  • The new makeup will run us around $300
  • On top of that, unexpected costs for last minute materials are sure to come up, and we're budgeting in $500 for that

No matter what, we're going to see this series through in one form or another, but the more help we get from you, the more resources we will have to construct a believable world for Fancy-Free.

What's in it for you? The perks:

In addition to the personal fulfillment of helping to see a unique passion to fruition, we've got some Fancy-Free swagger to sweeten the deal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute by donating, we'd really appreciate if you'd give us a shout out on social media or told a friend or family member about our project

Thank you for being a part of the making of this web series. We are so excited to bring you "Fancy-Free."

story:
Short Summaries Of Each Show

Fitting:

Wanting independence away from the legacy of his family’s restaurant, Sam Liu makes a deal to move into the apartment upstairs while still working part-time. But inside the cramped New York apartment, Sam finds Zoya, an inspiring stand-up comedian having doubts about her arranged marriage back home. Now, the two 20-something year olds must help one another break expectations and discover who they are before their families’ legacies fully take over.

Lapsed:

Amber should be knocking it out of the park, but right now she’s striking out. Once a bright engineering student, Amber’s future becomes uncertain when her occasional drinking turns into full blown alcoholism. Whether by random chance or divine intervention, Amber’s older brother Vincent finds her at her lowest moment and takes her in to help “solve” her issues. In Lapsed, Amber’s closed off, sarcastic demeanor clashes with her uber-Catholic brother’s sickening positivity. The dark comedy looks at how these two learn to live with each other while exploring addiction, family, faith and annoying the ever-loving hell out of your siblings.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are aiming for a goal of $5,000. This amount will be split evenly in half for each of the 2 shows to use towards budgeting. That way each show will get $2,500.
  • Showrunners Alex Tolerico and Kevin Loh have been refining their ideas on each series since this past spring, and the crowdfunding will be used to make these ideas into production realities.
  • Even if we do not meet our goal of $5,000, the amount that we do receive will be split evenly and will still be put towards making these shows, so any amount helps!
  • Money from crowdfunding will be put towards budgeting equipment, locations, company moves, and more in order to put out the best shows we can.
  • Estimated series release dates are in this spring, so those who support us will be able to see how their contributions have helped.

The Impact

Thoughtfully written and passionately made, here's why we care about these stories and how your donation is directly supporting us students:

  • Based in personal experience and heritage, Kevin's and Alex's stories show the creativity of the film industry's next generation.
  • Each student in the class is committed to putting out incredible work and have done so every other semester during their time at NYU, so the same can be expected from Fitting and Lapsed.
  • Not only are these projects a culmination of our hard work and learning technicality-wise, but also story-wise, as both shows have a little bit of each student's personal experiences in them as put forth in the writer's rooms.

Risks & Challenges

As TV series rookies, Lapsed and Fitting will have a learning curve for all of us, here's what to know:

  • Despite these mini series having new territory for all of us, we have plenty of guidance from our production advisors and Professor Goutman here at NYU.
  • We look forward to putting out the best work we can and overcoming the challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot directly donate, there are other ways to support our class:

  • Send the campaign to other family members and friends.
  • Feel free to share this campaign on social media and get us out there!
story_txt:
Short Summaries Of Each Show
Fitting:
Wanting independence away from the legacy of his family’s restaurant, Sam Liu makes a deal to move into the apartment upstairs while still working part-time. But inside the cramped New York apartment, Sam finds Zoya, an inspiring stand-up comedian having doubts about her arranged marriage back home. Now, the two 20-something year olds must help one another break expectations and discover who they are before their families’ legacies fully take over.
Lapsed:
Amber should be knocking it out of the park, but right now she’s striking out. Once a bright engineering student, Amber’s future becomes uncertain when her occasional drinking turns into full blown alcoholism. Whether by random chance or divine intervention, Amber’s older brother Vincent finds her at her lowest moment and takes her in to help “solve” her issues. In Lapsed, Amber’s closed off, sarcastic demeanor clashes with her uber-Catholic brother’s sickening positivity. The dark comedy looks at how these two learn to live with each other while exploring addiction, family, faith and annoying the ever-loving hell out of your siblings.
What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming for a goal of $5,000. This amount will be split evenly in half for each of the 2 shows to use towards budgeting. That way each show will get $2,500.
Showrunners Alex Tolerico and Kevin Loh have been refining their ideas on each series since this past spring, and the crowdfunding will be used to make these ideas into production realities.
Even if we do not meet our goal of $5,000, the amount that we do receive will be split evenly and will still be put towards making these shows, so any amount helps!
Money from crowdfunding will be put towards budgeting equipment, locations, company moves, and more in order to put out the best shows we can.
Estimated series release dates are in this spring, so those who support us will be able to see how their contributions have helped.

The Impact
Thoughtfully written and passionately made, here's why we care about these stories and how your donation is directly supporting us students:

Based in personal experience and heritage, Kevin's and Alex's stories show the creativity of the film industry's next generation.
Each student in the class is committed to putting out incredible work and have done so every other semester during their time at NYU, so the same can be expected from Fitting and Lapsed.
Not only are these projects a culmination of our hard work and learning technicality-wise, but also story-wise, as both shows have a little bit of each student's personal experiences in them as put forth in the writer's rooms.

Risks & Challenges
As TV series rookies, Lapsed and Fitting will have a learning curve for all of us, here's what to know:

Despite these mini series having new territory for all of us, we have plenty of guidance from our production advisors and Professor Goutman here at NYU.
We look forward to putting out the best work we can and overcoming the challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We're Amanda Copeland and Megan Winiarski. We are asking for your help in creating a 5 episode web series for Amanda's final senior project as a film student. We go to Kent State University and have been working on television shows our entire time here. Amanda has written the script and signed on to direct the series, and Megan will be the producer handling all the logistics. 

Now all we need is your help to fund this awesome series!

What We Need & What You Get

For our production to go as smoothly as possible, we are looking for money to help with the basics essentials. We are poor college kids with big dreams, and with your help, we can achieve them. 

The money will be going towards food and drinks for our cast and crew, props, costumes, and equipment. If we raise enough, our hope is to also pay some of our cast and crew for all their work they have been doing out of the goodness of their hearts. 

What do you get for supporting?

  • Credit in our mini series!
  • Early access to watch the mini series before others
  • Props and signed copies of scripts
  • Even a producing credit if you donate enough!

Risks & Challenges

Making a television series, especially as students, is a big undertaking. This is going to require months of work to make it as best as it can be. 

  • We are experienced in making television shows before, and are ready for this new challenge
  • This production is looking for funding so that we can make this as smooth as possible for everyone involved. 
  • Our struggles come with finding the time to do this as well, but our cast and crew is committed to making this project because they believe in it so much.
  • We will be working until the end our senior year to make this the best mini series possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that asking for your money is tough, but there are other ways you can support this project:

  • Share this page with friends and family!
  • If you're in the area, we'll need help with extras for scenes as well as food, which goes a long way to making our cast and crew happy.

story:
The Nobodies...

Meet Hanah, Beatrice, Brady and Daniel James Bond - a group of nobodies battling the expectations that they should have amounted to more with cheap wine and good company.

Hanah is a modern day Pollyanna driven by her ability to see the bright side in even the darkest of situations. But not even her unbridled optimism could convince her roommate, Beatrice, a snarky feminist with a knack for sarcasm, that her impending nuptials to the nerdy Brady are a good idea. 

But when her pal forces her to reckon with her engagement and new fiancé - who becomes the unlikely inspiration for the movie maker's latest documentary - Beatrice's life and art seem to fold into each other, sometimes for better and sometimes for worse.

The Cast 

Jessica Schladebeck as Beatrice

Samantha Smedley as Hanah

Travis Czap as Brady

Justin Michael Wagner as Daniel James Bond

We need your help!

You don't have to stay a nobody forever - even a penny will make you a somebody to us! Our goal is to create a relatable, 90s-infused series that always leaves you smiling, so we're asking you to help us raise some funds. In exchange, not only will you become a part of the team making this world come alive, but you'll also get some great perks! 

Here's just a few things your money will go toward:

  • Props/Set dressings
  • Special Effects
  • Animation
  • Festival Entry Fees
  • Marketing
  • Cast/Crew
  • Equipment

This is a low-budget passion project that everyone involved is incredibly excited about and with your help, we know we can make something you'll love too!

Poor like us??

That's okay because you can still help! Check out our Instagram and Facebook pages and if you like what you see, follow us for updates and a behind-the-scenes look at "Nobodies of New York."

And don't forget to subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch all of our episodes and behind-the-scenes clips when they first air!

And no one wants to stay a nobody forever, tell your friends about us and share our stuff!

story:
Our First Episode

Here's our first episode - check it out! It's a proof-of-concept, not up to the level of quality we anticipate for future episodes... but that's where you come in!

 

The Gist

We're a bunch of people, most of whom reside in the Los Angeles, CA area.​

Some of us are actors. Some of us are writers. Some of us are editors, production assistants, camera operators or craft service picker-uppers. ​

But all of us share a passion. We envision a better world than the one we've currently got, and we want to have a hand in changing it for the better. 

Why are we creating this show? So that we can convince the progressive-minded, forward-thinking old people of tomorrow (i.e. young people) to use their votes and activism to stem the current tide of political corruption in this country, and start replacing all the baddies with smart, principled people of high integrity and admirable vision. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are working toward a goal of $15,000. That amount would be enough to finance the next half dozen episodes of We Can't Even, at which point we hope to be significantly monetizing shows from that point forward, mainly through YouTube advertising clicks and views. 

Here are some of the things that the money raised will cover: 

  • Lighting, sound and camera equipment
  • Props and costumes
  • Minimal pay for actors, writers, editors, camera operators, etc., so that we can reward our artistic talent for their time and effort, and attract better talent to cover the technical aspect of the show (which is currently lacking)
  • Website maintenance and fees
  • Set pieces and design
  • Graphic design
  • Craft services
  • A foosball table (jk; we're more into air hockey)

What do you get out of it? Other than contributing toward a project that's trying to save the freaking world? 

  • If you make a donation of at least $25, we'll mention you in the credits of an upcoming episode
  • If you make a donation of at least $50, you'll get a credit mention, plus we'll send you advance footage of an upcoming episode, weeks before anyone else sees it!
  • If you make a donation of at least $100, you'll get all of the above, plus you'll have access to some outtakes and bloopers. 
  • If you make a donation of at least $500, you'll get all of the above, plus one of us will call you on your birthday and sing you a song. 
  • If you make a donation of at least $1,000, you'll get all of the above, plus calls on the days before and after your birthday. And we'll be naked. 

In the unfortunate event that we do not hit our goal, we will still film as many episodes as our bankroll will allow. If we feel that we have not raised enough to reasonably embark on any more episodes (which we do not anticipate), all funds raised will be donated to the ACLU, or returned to you if you would prefer. 

The Impact

We know we're setting our sights high. We don't expect this one little show to flip the world's script entirely. But doing what we can to engage America's youth and get them active in politics seems - to us, at least - like a pretty big deal. 

And who knows? Maybe this thing will really take off, and we'll become the Daily Show of the interwebs. The actual Daily Show had a large hand in getting Obama elected in 2008; it isn't completely outside the realm of possibility that another show could have a similar effect in the coming years, especially if it is one specifically targeted at first-time voters, answering their questions and addressing their needs and interests.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're excited about this project but don't have a dime to spare, here are some other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! Use Indiegogo's share tools to let your friends, enemies and loved ones know what we're all about. 
  • If you know someone who's smart, funny, politically interested and willing to work for peanuts, send them our way! We might have a boom mic for them to hold!
  • VOTE. Make other people vote. Yes, that's right - MAKE THEM. 

Okay, so that's our spiel. We hope you'll consider making a contribution to get this thing kickstarted! Er... indiegogo'd!

story:
The Dare To Be Kind TV Show – Make It Happen

Introducing Dare To Be Kind TV! A series produced and directed by Gabriella van Rij, founder of the Dare To Be Kind movement, featuring your stories to spark ideas of how we each can BE the difference in our personal 2-mile radius—because every ugly, sad, or beautiful TRUE story reveals the footprints we leave on each other and underlines how kindness can be used to create safer communities and healthier relationships.

To make this TV series a reality, Gabriella is taking to the road on a Dare to Be Kind World Tour and interviewing YOU to capture the KIND moments that made a difference to your life!

She began her travels on the West Coast, Los Angeles, on November 1st, and has been working her way through Arizona, Albuquerque, Oklahoma, and then up toward Iowa and the East Coast. She has already begun to interview not-for-profit associations that are doing a stellar job in their communities! Plus, the people who have taken up the Dare To Be Kind challenge of 1 act of kindness in a 2-mile radius—to highlight to everyone how kindness begins at home.

Through showcasing people who took their pain and made it into their greatest strength--the strength that enables them to help others--we will be giving people hope that they can do the same. This TV show will be about helping millions make the shift from bystander syndrome to becoming an active witness.

Who this TV series is for…

  • If you are tired of seeing blame, finger-pointing, and problems without much progress toward solutions…
  • If you feel there’s too much nonsense and negativity on TV…
  • If you want to see kindness make the news…
  • If you want a series that will encourage your children, your family, and your loved ones to see each other and the world with eyes of acceptance and hearts filled with kindness…

Gabriella van Rij is pushing kindness into the news cycle and creating a TV show that will be pure positive energy from start to finish. But we need your help!

If you feel like blame is not the cure to all the negativity on TV, then DARE to do YOUR part!

P.S.: Additionally, you can donate your hotel reward points to the Kindness Team who are in the trenches and that will also go far to support collecting footage, interviews, and stories for the D2BK TV show! If you'd like to help out in this way, write to this email address: kind-team@daretobekindmovement.com

story:
Hi, I am the Creator and one of the Executive Producers for PRIDE: The Series, Dorell Anthony. Our show is currently on Amazon Instant Video and is gearing up for production on the second half of the second season of our show. We are looking for potential sponsorship partners and contributors for our series. Our show strives to be more than entertainment; we promote a mission statement that empowers the LGBTQ community and, in general, those who are underrepresented.

What we need from you is any and everything you can donate. Any little thing helps. We are looking for approximately $60,000 in funding. That money will provide everything we will need to finish production on the second half of the second season. You will find a list of perks we are offering for those of you who donate to our cause. If we do not reach our goal of $60,000, then we will still take what we raise and put it all towards finishing the second half of the second season.

Our series follows four friends, each navigating their own personal complexities to find out who they are, what they want, and what they’re willing to do to get it. Their stories and struggles are centered on multiculturalism, gender roles, and sexual diversity all seen through a dark, gritty lens. I created the series showcase and explore more stories with the LGBTQIA+ community and create discussions about the issues we are facing in the world today; including, but limited to acceptance, identity and prejudice.

As I stated before, anything little helps, but if you can’t donate then please, please, please share our story. Share this idiegogo with your friends and family. Share our social media. You can find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram--@pridetheseries.

story:
Bloodsquirt XL, and the meaning of denim

Evan Rollo had a vision, an idea, of a man who sought justice at costs- Bloodsquirt XL, formerly Detective Yahn Yandle, is that man. Slipping on his signature jean jacket, Bloodsquirt XL feels the power overcome him...

A Little More On Walter Smits and Evan Rollo

Evan Rollo has spent the majority of his time writing trying to create pieces that anyone can relate to. He doesn't always succeed. He currently lives in Duluth MN and is always looking for ways to be a better listener, so his writing can be even easier to relate to.

Walter Smits graduated from University of Milwaukee Wisconsin film school last spring. During his time at UWMilwaukee he started the Queens of Scot stop motion club where the team created a dark-comedy about the future of robots… Henry Sellick even approved and they won First Place prize at the student film and video festival.

Walter has been making movies since 2004 when he debuted GIJOE the movie living in the jungle and JEDI vs PIRATE. Since then he has made animations, puppetry, and live action shorts. This is his first time creating a multi-episodic series.

Note: Walt insists you read the “DEAD BIRD” Calvin and Hobbes strip.

Walt is forever interested and driven by surreal beauty and the absurd. 

On BSXL:

“Evan came to me with this idea and said, Bloodsquirt and then proceeded to giggle. He told me that he has an idea. “Bloodsquirt,” he repeated, again giggling. He told me about this denim-clad idiot who was overly intense about fighting justice. I said ok, write it…. and he did. Three episodes down, here we are. There is a lot of denim, a lot of justice, some blood, and one dream donkey. We have two episodes left to shoot. 

The series grows from goofy, to bizarre, to surreal, to over the top and is set entirely in DULUTH MINNESOTA, my hometown and only true love.

Oh, and, Bloodsquirt XL kinda made me love denim. So, I’m pretty into denim now. In fact, I literally just bought a denim jacket.”

How We'll Use The Money

Making a webseries ain't cheap! Especially one with copious amounts of fake blood and fine denim. We're looking for your support to finance the production of BSXL episodes 4 & 5, the grand culmination of the BSXL series. We need help with all sorts of production related items, including: 

  • Wardrobe (primarily the aforementioned fine denim)
  • Set Design (these episodes are gonna have some pretty sick sets)
  • Equipment (two words- dream sequence)

THE GOODS

I know, I know, "get to the good stuff already!" you're shouting. Well here it is, the section where we talk about the PERKS. 

It's 2018, you can go out on Amazon and you can pretty much buy whatever your heart desires. We know that, and that's why our perks are unique to the project and are all designed by us, with several perks handmade by Walter Smits himself. We want to give your perks that are emblematic of the spirit of BSXL that you can hold onto for years to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you're a little short on cash. Don't sweat it, we know that feeling well. There are other ways you can help out! First off, you can share this Indiegogo campaign on social media right here on the campaign page, or share the original post that brought you here. Second, you can follow Bloodsquirt XL on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter (@bloodsquirtxl on all three) and interact with our pages to get the word out about the series in general as well as the premiere this September! Trust us, we've got some cool content in the works for the future- you won't regret the follow. 

The Final Word

Thank you for visiting our page, and for your support of BSXL. This project means everything to those involved, and we can barely express how much we appreciate your support. We hope you love the finished product as much as we do, and don't forget to ask yourself-

r u into denim?
story_txt:
Bloodsquirt XL, and the meaning of denim
Evan Rollo had a vision, an idea, of a man who sought justice at costs- Bloodsquirt XL, formerly Detective Yahn Yandle, is that man. Slipping on his signature jean jacket, Bloodsquirt XL feels the power overcome him...

A Little More On Walter Smits and Evan Rollo
Evan Rollo has spent the majority of his time writing trying to create pieces that anyone can relate to. He doesn't always succeed. He currently lives in Duluth MN and is always looking for ways to be a better listener, so his writing can be even easier to relate to.
Walter Smits graduated from University of Milwaukee Wisconsin film school last spring. During his time at UWMilwaukee he started the Queens of Scot stop motion club where the team created a dark-comedy about the future of robots… Henry Sellick even approved and they won First Place prize at the student film and video festival.
Walter has been making movies since 2004 when he debuted GIJOE the movie living in the jungle and JEDI vs PIRATE. Since then he has made animations, puppetry, and live action shorts. This is his first time creating a multi-episodic series.
Note: Walt insists you read the “DEAD BIRD” Calvin and Hobbes strip.
Walt is forever interested and driven by surreal beauty and the absurd. 
On BSXL:
“Evan came to me with this idea and said, Bloodsquirt and then proceeded to giggle. He told me that he has an idea. “Bloodsquirt,” he repeated, again giggling. He told me about this denim-clad idiot who was overly intense about fighting justice. I said ok, write it…. and he did. Three episodes down, here we are. There is a lot of denim, a lot of justice, some blood, and one dream donkey. We have two episodes left to shoot. 
The series grows from goofy, to bizarre, to surreal, to over the top and is set entirely in DULUTH MINNESOTA, my hometown and only true love.
Oh, and, Bloodsquirt XL kinda made me love denim. So, I’m pretty into denim now. In fact, I literally just bought a denim jacket.”
How We'll Use The Money
Making a webseries ain't cheap! Especially one with copious amounts of fake blood and fine denim. We're looking for your support to finance the production of BSXL episodes 4 & 5, the grand culmination of the BSXL series. We need help with all sorts of production related items, including: 

Wardrobe (primarily the aforementioned fine denim)
Set Design (these episodes are gonna have some pretty sick sets)
Equipment (two words- dream sequence)


THE GOODS
I know, I know, "get to the good stuff already!" you're shouting. Well here it is, the section where we talk about the PERKS. 
It's 2018, you can go out on Amazon and you can pretty much buy whatever your heart desires. We know that, and that's why our perks are unique to the project and are all designed by us, with several perks handmade by Walter Smits himself. We want to give your perks that are emblematic of the spirit of BSXL that you can hold onto for years to come. 
Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you're a little short on cash. Don't sweat it, we know that feeling well. There are other ways you can help out! First off, you can share this Indiegogo campaign on social media right here on the campaign page, or share the original post that brought you here. Second, you can follow Bloodsquirt XL on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter (@bloodsquirtxl on all three) and interact with our pages to get the word out about the series in general as well as the premiere this September! Trust us, we've got some cool content in the works for the future- you won't regret the follow. 
The Final Word
Thank you for visiting our page, and for your support of BSXL. This project means everything to those involved, and we can barely express how much we appreciate your support. We hope you love the finished product as much as we do, and don't forget to ask yourself-
r u into denim?

story:
Hi everyone! 

Since last year, we have developed the show even more and have the show a more colorful story to it. We are so lucky to have Jon Lovitz, Catherine Curtin, Eric Close, Dwayne Hill (Coach Carr in Mean Girls) and broadway star Andy Karl. We completed filming and we are now at the point where we need the last piece of the puzzle and this is where you come in - editing. Editing is essential when it comes to filming because this is how the story is told. With your help, you can see this in some film festivals next year and maybe even on a network!

 

ps the video you see above is what was created last year. Let’s make magic happen!

story:
The Overview

TAIM is a mainstream original dramedy series that uses the adult industry as the vehicle for the storytelling, but it's the unique characters and their connection that will drive each episode. The protagonists include an easy going adult star and a high strung adult virgin who have been best friends since they were in school.

This Crowd Funding Campaign (CFC) is seeking to raise money to produce the pilot script, which we can then use to develop and launch the entire series. We have two plus seasons worth of scripts already completed with an awesome and dedicated team of artists ready to go... Simply put, you cannot begin to imagine the positive energy and creativity that will stem from your involvement!

Please check out this mini episode we shot in one afternoon in a place I'm told is called "Culver City." If nothing else, with a shoestring budget and minimal time, the production team and cast knocked it out of the park and then some!

 

Funding Goal

We're looking to raise $10,000 to produce the entire pilot episode in SoCal. (That stands for Southern California TAIM's developer recently learned...) The funding is intended for, but not limited to, principal photography, sound and lighting, production design and film equipment. There is also insurance, transportation, craft services (food/catering) and post production that includes editing, color grading and sound mixing. Talent and press promotion is key as well for obvious reasons; especially considering that these performers are as skilled and capable as they are, and we want to help get their talent out for the world to see.

No doubt there are other components to a production of this nature not being mentioned, which is all the more reason to reach and or exceed our goal... Truth be told it's the unknown that keeps the developer up at night. Well that's an exaggeration, he doesn't sleep well to begin with. However, considering the possibility of exceeding this fundraising goal, which would allow us to potentially produce more episodes, well that's the best kind of insomnia to have!

As positive as we all are though, even if we don't reach our goal, we will still be grateful for any and all support, and use every penny to create something that you really won't expect, while loving every minute. 

TAIM's Impact

Through virtue of breaking the stereotypes and appreciating walking contradictions in all forms, we're going to employ that and more in telling great stories. The humor will be quick smart and adult, and the drama will include elements of romance suspense and even science fiction. And if those needles don't seem like the easiest to thread, you should check out TAIMSeries online and peruse some of the script samples and see just that!

And if you can't contribute no worries; because getting the word out through social media Indiegogo's share option or just to actual living breathing people will do just that!

TAIM Perks

Now as you’ll see to the right of this page, we have a few exclusive perks setup for you to enjoy as a reward for your much appreciated contribution. Since this isn’t exactly a tangible widget, you’ll find most of the rewards will be digital. However it’s not just the unique insight into filmmaking you’ll be getting, but also what makes TAIM tick as well. With your kind donation, you’ll become part of the driving force as well as help create something genuinely unique in the entertainment world.

In The End

Potential is a word often used to describe TAIM, and it's especially appreciated when it's not just coming from its developer! And now that there are finally living breathing individuals behind these years old characters, that's even more of a reason to see the possibilities in what they can accomplish in front of the camera. And don't just take this CFC author's word for it; let their bio's do the talking!

 

The Cast

Miles Faber - Blake

Miles Faber grew up in Calgary Alberta, where he started Bboying (Breaking) at the age of 16. He began his professional career at the age of 19. Miles was recently choreographing and dancing with artists on the hit show "Canada's Got Talent" as well as just finished shooting the movie "Molly Maxwell", and the Family Channel show "The Next Step". He also has an extensive background in acting and continues to pursue his many dreams.

(Fun Fact: TAIM's developer is known for many things, dancing isn't one of them. However, it never hurts to curry favor with the boss; so no matter how many hours it'll take, Miles is going to help Matt learn a step or two... Second fun fact, Matt is the stereotype of his race when it comes to dancing!)

Rebecca Tarabocchia - Val

Rebecca Tarabocchia is an up and coming talented and hard working actress and model. From leading and supporting roles in theater and film, modeling work for national campaigns, she not only proves how eager she is to do her best work; but to learn the craft in a deeper and more meaningful way. Rebecca also has experience with voice over work, commercial and music videos, and is fluent in English and Swedish. She is also more than a natural when it comes to being able to channel the right energy in that and all she does.

(Fun Fact: TAIM's developer has said there isn't an accent he doesn't love, which is why he originally had 'Val' from the Boston area. However because Rebecca is from Sweden and Matt's "heavy South Jersey accent" is annoying to most, they're going to take dialect classes and learn to sound like they're either from São Paulo in Brazil or something Australian-ish.)

Nazanin Kavari - Sierra

Nazanin Kavari stepped on the scene at the young age of 14 years old when she uploaded her first YouTube video out of her bedroom in Columbus, Ohio. Fast forward to the present, Nazanin now resides in Los Angeles and has reached over 1 million plus YouTube subscribers. On Instagram, she is widely admired by almost a million followers. Her many talents has caught the attention of top tier brands such as Clinique, Sephora, Bobbi Brown, and more. Like many digital stars, Nazanin Kavari is using her platform to break into the acting world after training under some of Hollywood's top acting coaches.

(Fun Fact: It's hard to imagine that a dude in his "mid" 30's from Jersey, isn't exactly known for knocking it out of the park fashion wise. Naz however is the absolute opposite of that. So because Matt's open to new experiences, Naz is going to help him learn how to dress like the hanger still isn't in his shirt... They have Kohl's out in Cali right?)

Alessandra Marandola - Alicia

Alessandra Marandola is an actor pursuing her dreams in Los Angeles. Her love for acting has compelled to her to pursue a career in TV and film, having gained experience both in front and behind the camera. Since moving to Los Angeles, she has acted in a number of films, TV series and national commercials. She graduated from Boston University with a degree in Broadcast Journalism and has participated in musical theater for eight years.

(Fun Fact: Alessandra's character was written for the mini episode, but having done so well with 'Alicia' the podcaster, her role is now going to be reoccurring because they're both awesome! And that TAIM's developer is a podcaster himself, what better way for Alessandra to learn about her role than have Matty talk in hyper detail about what it's like to be a podcaster!)

Matt Preston - Niles \ Developer

Matt Preston isn't a professional actor and doesn't have any headshots, as demonstrated by the above photo; though he did once host a Reddit AMA for his podcast, as illustrated by his attempt at being clever in his franchise gym's locker room. Having hosted The Apathetic Vegan Podcast and blog for over two years, his professional and creative writing career is much older. His high energy is only matched by his communication skills, which if that doesn't make sense to you no worries, this is just filler to be honest.

(Fun Fact: If you're left with one thing after reading through this CFC, know that the motivation in making TAIM something positive and awesome through compelling stories and unique situations is vital to this. And so your investment and positive energy will be gratefully accepted and utilized in the most professional and creative way possible. You have no idea how much we appreciate your help, but know that we do; and can't wait to demonstrate just that for the next decade plus!)

story:
I need your help finishing season 1 of F*D & Blessed! 

I can't thank you all enough for helping to achieve the original goal! We want to maintain the momentum and stretch to $15,000 - This will allow me to pay the wonderful production team, increase our marketing budget to offer you all more content and opportunities to engage in this important conversation, increase the level of subtitling throughout and maybe for the first time in years I can also pay myself a little bit :) Thank you all so much! 

 

 

My name is Rotana. I'm an independent artist from Saudi Arabia living in Los Angeles. I am F*D & Blessed. I was born and raised in Saudi Arabia. I'm blessed because my culture  taught me devotion, and truly sees women as sacred. I am f*cked because I was also taught that sexuality was shameful and dangerous. I grew up with no sex education at all, I knew nothing about my body, how it worked, or the power available to me when I am in right relationship with it. 

Yet, I always loved moving my body, being loud, drama and all things erotic. 

This led me into internal confusion and self-hatred. It left me disempowered to set boundaries and say no.  I don't want anyone else to feel that way. I spent last two years in a deep dive reading and educating myself on these topics of body, pleasure, sexuality, consent and eroticism. I had so many aha! moments I couldn't contain myself anymore and decided to make a show.

F*D & Blessed is a hilarious educational, straight-to-camera show where I talk about things no one ever told me anything about (anatomy, pleasure, sexuality, eroticism, boundaries, consent) and more.

I made it in collaboration with my dear friend and director Clara Aranovich. We have filmed 15 episodes and now need to edit/market them. The episodes will be in English and some Arabic. There will be full Arabic and English translation provided for all episodes.

Making this show has healed me, and I believe it can heal so many in the Muslim community and beyond. So many of us are carrying shame and confusion about our bodies and sexuality. F*cked & Blessed is a chance for us to bring these topics to light and say no, these things are not bad, they are good. In fact, they are holy. 

It is a chance to normalize talking about sexuality in MENA and Muslim communities. When we do this, we become empowered in our bodies and no longer allow cycles of sexual abuse and domination to play out in the shadows of our culture. We are literally gonna be freeing ourselves of inherited intergenerational trauma and breaking the cycles of shame!! 

THAT IS EROTIC!!! LET'S GET FREE!

I'm too hype.

The second part of this is my Sex Doula Training that will support the show in it's coming seasons. My certification will be through The National Black Doula Association.  This certification is 2 levels will be completed in the summer of 2021 and will contribute largely to the development of season  2 where we will cover more topics on sexuality, power, cultural bondage, our mothers and  beyond. 

 

What's the money for?

Covid has hit me very hard financially. I am not eligible for the unemployment system here in the US. I used to have my management's help to cover these costs, but we have recently parted ways and I am no longer able to finish the show or pay for my training.  

Costs for F*cked & Blessed 

  • Paying our editor for 15 episodes + editing promotional content  
  • Paying our translator and transcriber (we are offering full subtitles in English and Arabic)
  • Production costs for season 1 ( hard drives, location, camera/lighting equipment, Mic., transportation, food, gas, props etc.)
  • Marketing + Promotion (video/photo content, digital ads and collaborations) 
  • Sex Doula Certification Training Course Level 1 and 2 Training with https://www.blackdoulas.org/ will allow me to begin working with womxn to [facilitate them reconnecting with themselves sexually] which will inform Season 2 . 

Impact

Even though F*cked & Blessed is a show with comedy in it, it is a deep prayer of revolution.

I believe this show has the capacity to bring womxn, girls -and anybody that resonates- back into their bodies and primal nature. Back into their safety and power. 

Our internal compass and intuition can only be felt through the body.  It is there where all of our freedom, power and liberation lies. We cannot access our power and agency when we  are  disconnected from our sexuality and bodies. We cannot access our power and liberation when we are taught that our bodies are bad and not to be trusted.

F*cked & Blessed has been a revolution to me. I cannot wait to share it with you!

story:
We're Taking Things Back to the Glory Days!

Glory Daze is a comedic web series created by Ailish Elzy and David Larkin and will serve as our third-year thesis project for the Writing and Producing for Television Program at Loyola Marymount University. We both gained experience producing, writing and directing while at grad school and are ready to put it all to good use.

You know that feeling when your friends around you are succeeding and you're not? When your entire 20s seem like nothing is going according to plan and the only way to feel better is by getting drunk and reliving the past?

Oh, you don't? Uh, yeah... us either. But that's the story we're telling with Glory Daze anyway!

The episode we're producing is the story of four friends, Mia, Shane, Dexter and Marlo, who don't quite have their shit together. The night before Shane is supposed to move away for a job, they decide to have one last epic night of pregaming before a concert. As these things tend to play out, nothing goes according to plan and they all have to deal with the consequences.

How You Can Help

We're hoping to produce the first episode of this series, and we have a flexible budget of $5000 that will cover production and post-production costs. Although it all takes place in a single location, there are some expenses involved to really bring this epic night to life.

Aside from wardrobe, location, transportation, and feeding our awesome cast and crew, we'd also like to have a few trippy special effects, a ton of fun props, and license some original party music, and any donation will go a long way to helping get this off the ground. But that's not all...

We also have rewards! Each donation level comes with its own series of special perks, as seen off to the side. Not only will you be helping a couple film students' dreams come true, but you'll also get some cool swag for doing so!

Other Ways To Help

If you can't donate to the campaign but still want to help, that's totally great too. Sharing our campaign on social media with all your rich, generous friends will also go a long way!

And we'd love any food, drink, or craft service donations!

Our Team

 

Director, Co-Writer, Producer

David Larkin (on the right) graduated magna cum laude from Cal State Fullerton with a degree in Liberal Studies. He’s worked on a bunch of MFA thesis projects, and written, produced, and directed a variety of different projects of his own. A lifelong fan of comedy, parties, and leaving friends behind for better opportunities, David is the perfect person to bring Glory Daze to life.

 

Assistant Director

Sabrina Luppi is a commercial photo/video producer in San Francisco. She has a BA in Cinema from SFSU and co-founded The New Grls Club, a platform for intersectional feminist content creators, with Ailish. When she’s not working she’s watching Netflix on the toile-I mean planning out more work ideas because she’s very organized  

 

Producer, Co-Writer, Art Department

Ailish Elzy graduated from SFSU in 2015 with a degree in Cinema. She is an Award-nominated production designer who has worked on half a dozen MFA thesis projects. She enjoys quoting episodes of Broad City, crafting personalized gifts, and as much as she wishes, she did not make that shirt. 

Director Of Photography

Taylor is a recent grad of LMU's undergraduate Film Production program. Throughout her time at LMU, she's shot countless projects with a ton of different subject matter. Her life has recently changed after adopting an adorable dog, but don't worry, she is not distracted and fully committed to making this project come to life. (No word yet if her dog will be on set, here's hoping!)
story_txt:
We're Taking Things Back to the Glory Days!
Glory Daze is a comedic web series created by Ailish Elzy and David Larkin and will serve as our third-year thesis project for the Writing and Producing for Television Program at Loyola Marymount University. We both gained experience producing, writing and directing while at grad school and are ready to put it all to good use.You know that feeling when your friends around you are succeeding and you're not? When your entire 20s seem like nothing is going according to plan and the only way to feel better is by getting drunk and reliving the past?
Oh, you don't? Uh, yeah... us either. But that's the story we're telling with Glory Daze anyway!The episode we're producing is the story of four friends, Mia, Shane, Dexter and Marlo, who don't quite have their shit together. The night before Shane is supposed to move away for a job, they decide to have one last epic night of pregaming before a concert. As these things tend to play out, nothing goes according to plan and they all have to deal with the consequences.

How You Can Help
We're hoping to produce the first episode of this series, and we have a flexible budget of $5000 that will cover production and post-production costs. Although it all takes place in a single location, there are some expenses involved to really bring this epic night to life.Aside from wardrobe, location, transportation, and feeding our awesome cast and crew, we'd also like to have a few trippy special effects, a ton of fun props, and license some original party music, and any donation will go a long way to helping get this off the ground. But that's not all...We also have rewards! Each donation level comes with its own series of special perks, as seen off to the side. Not only will you be helping a couple film students' dreams come true, but you'll also get some cool swag for doing so!
Other Ways To Help
If you can't donate to the campaign but still want to help, that's totally great too. Sharing our campaign on social media with all your rich, generous friends will also go a long way!
And we'd love any food, drink, or craft service donations!
Our Team
 
Director, Co-Writer, Producer

David Larkin (on the right) graduated magna cum laude from Cal State Fullerton with a degree in Liberal Studies. He’s worked on a bunch of MFA thesis projects, and written, produced, and directed a variety of different projects of his own. A lifelong fan of comedy, parties, and leaving friends behind for better opportunities, David is the perfect person to bring Glory Daze to life.
 
Assistant Director

Sabrina Luppi is a commercial photo/video producer in San Francisco. She has a BA in Cinema from SFSU and co-founded The New Grls Club, a platform for intersectional feminist content creators, with Ailish. When she’s not working she’s watching Netflix on the toile-I mean planning out more work ideas because she’s very organized  
 
Producer, Co-Writer, Art Department

Ailish Elzy graduated from SFSU in 2015 with a degree in Cinema. She is an Award-nominated production designer who has worked on half a dozen MFA thesis projects. She enjoys quoting episodes of Broad City, crafting personalized gifts, and as much as she wishes, she did not make that shirt. 
Director Of Photography

Taylor is a recent grad of LMU's undergraduate Film Production program. Throughout her time at LMU, she's shot countless projects with a ton of different subject matter. Her life has recently changed after adopting an adorable dog, but don't worry, she is not distracted and fully committed to making this project come to life. (No word yet if her dog will be on set, here's hoping!)

story:
Over 320,000 people are being sexually assaulted in America each year; approximately 32,000 of them are men. Sexual assault is more than physical violence. Its specific dynamic of power and control can leave survivors feeling especially vulnerable in unique ways. If left unaddressed, it can seriously affect the lives of victims and their families. With the rise of the #MeToo movement we do not want to forget the male victims who more often suffer in silence. #MenToo will shine a light on the devastation of sexual assault against men, whether it occurred as a child or an adult. While it's impossible to know exactly how many men are impacted, researchers' best estimates are that it affects at least one in five men. We want people to know that there is help and healing available. Each compelling episode will depict compilations of actual case scenarios (using fictitious names and events) from the practices of real counselors along with proven therapeutic techniques for healing the wounds of these egregious crimes.  Sexual violence against men is grossly under-reported. If you have been a victim of sexual abuse, start getting the healing you need by contacting the National Sexual Assault Hotline at 800.656.HOPE (4673). Please support survivors of sexual abuse by supporting this important project.

 

 

So the Indiegogo campaign ends, what's next? We have already been in pre-production of this show since the end of February, financing it ourselves as we go. We will go into full production on this exciting project the second week in May 2018.  The Pilot Episode, "Marcus," will take four days to get "in the can".  We will then take approximately four weeks to do ALL POST PRODUCTION, including picture edit, sound edit and sound mix. We feel that it is incumbent upon us to have distribution in place for #MenToo, since it would basically be a waste to create this tool and not put it to work.  To that end, we will deliver the Pilot Episode to Amazon Prime to be added to their streaming service almost immediately after post production.  We anticipate a Fall 2018 release. In total we intend to deliver six, one-hour episodes in our first season.

- We’re inviting you into CHIKARA’s Action Arcade, on Saturday mornings at 11:00 am Eastern! (Watch along on either CHIKARAtopia or IWTV.) This campaign allows YOU to support the workers with your donations as you watch!

- 100% of the money raised will go to the wrestlers and the team that make Action Arcade! Many of us count on wrestling as our sole source of income. We are all facing uncertain times. 

- If you are not already a subscriber to IWTV, subscribe now using promo code: arcade and get a FREE trial right now!

- Episode 2 goes live on Saturday morning, April 4th, and Episode 3 goes live on Saturday morning, April 11th.

story:
Summary

'Mature' is a comedy web-series, created with the goal of breaking down the stereotypes surrounding middle-aged university students. As university students ourselves, we've seen first-hand the kind of gossip and down-grading comments that follow some of the older students around, and we aim to banish these stereotypes for good.

Combining comedy, family, and drama, 'Mature' is a series that everyone can enjoy and relate to, and we hope that you will join us on our journey to get our project filmed and out into the world.

 

Where the Money Goes

Let's start by saying where the money doesn't go. 'Mature' is a made-by-students, for-students, production, supported by the Queensland University of Technology. With the support of QUT, we are lucky enough to have access to top-notch film equipment, and editing software, as well the University itself, and we will be sure to make the most of it. 

But what does University support mean to me, as the backer?

Having University support means that all money raised will go directly to the making of the film itself, that is:

  • Wardrobe - what the actors will be wearing
  • Production Design - what you see in the film (you see that lamp? that couch? that's all you)

No hidden expenses. No wondering where your valuable contribution went. It's all visible, right there on the screen.

Meet the Team

No film can be made alone. Our team is comprised of a group of like-minded people who are eager to pool their resources and make their vision a reality. We all come from a wide-range of backgrounds, with many of us mature-age students ourselves; we consider this our strength, using our different perspectives to bring something new to our production, and make sure we're not leaving anyone out. It's never fun to be singled out - comedy should be enjoyed together, not laughing at, but laughing with.

Our Directors:

 

        Stephen Rice                 Evie Hart-Reid

        ​(Episode 1)                      (Episode 2)

Our Producer:

 Annaliese Mauchline

Our Writers:

  

      Lucy Hamilton            Brittany McDonald          Letitia Thomas

         (Episode 1)                     (Episode 2)                     (Episode 2)

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but still want to help? No worries! We value every contribution, no matter how small. You can contribute by simply giving our FaceBook page a like, or sharing our campaign with your friends.

Click here to like us on FaceBook: http://fb.me/MatureWebSeries

story:
'Fans of the Zombie sub-genre take note, “Dead Town” will be the next big medium.' - Decay Mag

'An absolute freakin’ blast!' - Horror-Movies.ca

'My favorite zombie horror-comedy web-series from the UK' - Horror Society

 

The dead have risen and humanity is crumbling. In the small industrial town of Runcorn in the North West of England, John Diant, his survivalist, spam loving, apocalypse obsessed brother Butty and his retro, chain smoking smart arse best friend 80s Dave, are doing what needs to be done to survive – From both the living and the dead!

Series 2 of Dead Town, like series 1  will consist of 3 episodes, continuing the adventures of John, 80s Dave and Butty as they search for John’s Daughter Emily.

We are currently in pre production with filming scheduled to begin mid October running through to February 2018. Unlike series 1, where we released an episode as and when they were ready, this time round we will be filming all 3 episodes before releasing. This way, you the amazing Dead Town fans, won’t have long to wait between watching each episode. In fact, once all three are ready, we will be releasing one a month!

How much do we need?

We have budgeted series 2 of Dead Town at £800. Those of you that have been with us from the beginning will note that this is a considerable lower budget than series 1, where we raised £1,940.

How are we doing it for less?

As a production company, Slumberjack Entertainment grows with each project we do. We have invested wisely in production equipment, ensuring costs in this area are kept to a minimum. This means our budget for series 2 can be lower that series 1.

Where will your money go?

All funding will go towards making our gruesome zombies, production costs and marketing so we can spread the Dead town infection as far and wide as possible.

Risks & Challenges

There are a million things that could happen to a production. But we have a dedicated and experienced team bringing Dead Town to life and we are willing to do whatever it takes to bring series 2 to your screens.

story:
The Play

WORLD SERIES tells the story of Adrian Page, a senior at Boston University who takes a side job sorting through the archives of retired LGBTQ rights lawyer Charles Finley. The play is about Charles remembering the early years of the AIDS epidemic, and Adrian learning why Charles cannot forgive the straight community for their behavior in those years. It is serialized into seven parts, each around forty minutes, and will be presented online starting on the first day of the World Series in October. The play will be free to stream online.

This play is about home, I’m from Massachusetts and went to Mass College of Art and Design in Boston. I now a performer at the iO Theater, where I am on an improv team and also where I had live recordings of my first radio play You and Eye.

It is very important to me as a writer to be a part of a gay tradition. With my work I want to honor those that came before me and push forward and keep working for those to come. History, the history of gay people in this country is so important to me.

What I need for this play to happen

I need to pay my people. 

 

  • The funds for the cast will be split between the 8 actors. 
  • There will be five days of production. I will need to pay the cast and crew for their days of work on recording and for the many days of work my editor and composer will spend on piecing the play together and making the score. 
  • If I do not reach my goal I will put all the money into paying my cast and crew first. Who needs food when you have theater? 

Why is this play important?

In a world of huge productions and enormous budgets, the dignity of the story and the production can be lost, which is why I think it is tremendously important to support small productions. I am telling this story about gay history working with gay people, keeping the integrity of queer storytelling intact. 

I wrote this play as a memorial for the people who died of AIDS in Massachusetts in the early years of the epidemic. I wrote it as an everlasting thank you to the activists who fought valiantly for fair treatment by their government and by the scientific institution.  I wrote this play as a warning to my generation. Do we want to repeat the behavior of our government and straight citizens exhibited when faced with AIDS? Do we want to stand back and watch ourselves die? Do we want to treat life as if it’s a game? If we continue as we are, that is just what will happen.

My Team

Here are some of the main players in the project:

Lane Flores plays the main character Adrian Page.

Rob Lindley plays the retired lawyer Charles Finley.

Alison Gates is the assistant director and guitarist. 

Matt Mahaffey is the production editor. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page for me. Help me tell these stories.
