story:
About me and the show...

Hello! I'm Ronni Menzies-Stirling, and I've been involved in Demonologist For Hire since its beginning in April 2017. Our comedy webseries is entirely filmed and created in Scotland, and we have won 5 awards in the past year, as well as having our episodes screened at film festivals all around the World.

As a gay Actor, I've always thought Glasgow has an amazing drag and cabaret scene, but I feel it is very underrated. For two years I've wanted to create a Drag Queen episode of our web series, and now, that time has finally come! It is my hope that this drag episode of our award-winning comedy series will bring attention to the Glasgow drag scene, and get it some exposure around the World.

Your contribution to the production costs of this episode will help us make this the biggest and best episode we've made yet! The more we raise, the better this episode will be. I want to do the Glasgow drag scene proud, and showcase some of its incredible performers in this, the 1st episode of our 3rd series. This will be our biggest, most ambitious episode so far - and we need your help!

We have secured all dates, locations and performers, and we're ready to roll. All we need now... is funding!

What We Need & What You Get

"Drag Me To Hell, Bitch!" will be the 1st episode of our 3rd series, which we will be filming in Central Glasgow in the middle of March 2020. As with all our previous episodes, we are a small crew, and aim to shoot this episode in 2 days across 2 locations. We are aiming to raise a minimum of £500 to make this episode, but if we raise more, we can raise our game, and make this episode even bigger and better!

We have some amazing perks for contributors, including a beautiful Demonologist For Hire t-shirt, a chance to star in an episode of "Joe Caxee and his Haunted Taxi!", and some incredible branded merchandise! These are just some of the perks we can reward our contributors with.

We need to raise a minimum of £500 to cover our production costs for this episode. If we can reach our 1st stretch goal of £1,000 though, we can really go all out on the production and post-production to make this episode look even better... but, if we reach our 2nd stretch goal of £1,500 (or above!), we can hire a composer to create a unique, one-of-a-kind soundtrack for what is sure to be an amazing episode.

The Impact

My hope for this episode is not only will it be very funny, but also that it will bring attention to the Glasgow drag scene, and bring it the publicity it deserves.

We have been creating episodes since April 2017, and now have 2 series online. In the past year alone, we have won 5 awards, and our episodes have been shown at countless film festivals all around the world.

Your contribution will help us make this episode the best it can be, and showcase the Glasgow drag scene to film festivals around the World!

The Players

Here are just some of the amazing cast we have lined up for this massive episode!

Starring in this epic episode will be Series regulars Bryn Owen and Ronni Menzies-Stirling, alongside some very special guest stars;

Alex Robertson (Still Game, Rab C. Nesbitt, King's Theatre Panto)

Beverley Lyons (The Showbiz Lion)

..and legendary drag performers The Vesta Girls, and more!

You can help!

Even if you can't contribute to this episode, don't worry - you could still help!

Share this campaign to your social media pages, tell your friends, and help us get the word out there.

Web series Website: www.demonologistforhire.com

Web series YouTube: www.youtube.com/demonologistforhire

Web series Social Media:  Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.

story:
The Team

Hey guys! Although we reside in Los Angeles, CA,  Dot (actress/producer ) and I (director) are both from Wisconsin. We connected through a mutual friend a year ago and our passion for film and creating made it inevitable that a collaboration between the two of us had to happen. I've already had the opportunity to gain a name and following for myself with my web series, Harley Quinn. I've gained over 12,000 subscribers proving that I have a great understanding of how to engage an audience.I've also had the privilege to work on TV shows such as Atlanta and Legion, and worked with companies such as DJI and Bleacher Report. Dot McDonald has produced shows for Issa Rae's Youtube channel & keeps the people laughing in Buzzfeed videos. One in which went viral receiving over 30 million views.  Together we've laid out our best ideas on the table and combined our strengths to give you something unique and alluring.

 

The Campaign

Our campaign will run for 30 days. During this time, we will be in pre-production; holding auditions, scouting locations and building up momentum for our release. Influenced by movies like BELLY, Friday, and the TV series Power, we believe that the story of Noodles will resonate with our targeted demographic. Your contributions will play a crucial role in taking our film to the next level and assuring that there are no limitations to our vision. The money that we raise will go directly to actors, locations, equipment, crew, food, transportation, wardrobe, video post, audio post, music, insurance, legal, and marketing. Imagination Upgraded whole-heartedly believes in delivering high quality, and enticing work. With Noodles, we aim to exceed anything we've ever done!

.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need people who are excited about supporting new entrepreneurs and are eager to cheer on dream chasers. We need backers who can not only see our vision but can also see the greater picture. Your contributions will help create a film that celebrates all truths. A film that says all walks of life deserve to be told. A series that will empower our women to find independence in this world and get it on their own!

Because Noodles wouldn't be anything without you, Imagination Upgraded has created some awesome perks that will allow you to get an exclusive experience to our process and see exactly how your contributions will be put to use. We want you to get to know us with behind the scene footage, represent and show your support with t-shirts, feel appreciated with special thanks and shout outs, and even get VIP tickets to special screenings. Check out our perks to see how you can get involved!

 

The Impact

Coming from Wisconsin, we both feel a responsibility to not only represent our overlooked home state but also to instill inspiration in those who come from less. We want to motivate those back home and be proof that they can truly do anything. Noodles is a film that will force our viewers to evaluate their relationships, understand different motives for joining the street life and allow people to adventure on a journey they may never step foot on. Noodles is a film that gives a voice to the stories that are neglected. It's a reveal of a reality that seldom gets brought to the light.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to make a monetary contribution, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Use your voice! Help us get the word out by making some noise about our campaign. Tell your friends, make an announcement at your church or use the Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word. Be a part of creating a buzz around our film title, Noodles.

story:
The Problem Addict is being produced as Will Fowler's thesis production project at Ithaca College, serving as a culmination of the skills and theories taught in the undergraduate program. 

We plan to produce, market and distribute this episode as a pilot for a full series to be produced. Projects created by our team are typically distributed by Amazon Prime, and we expect the same for this project. 

Check out this link for additional info on the story of this project: https://www.midnightskyproductionsllc.com/the-problem-addict

Why do we need money?

While we are both lucky and extremely fortunate to have access to a lot of the equipment that we'll need from the Park School of Communications at Ithaca College, filmmaking is still an expensive process. The money you donate will go directly to:

  • Food for the cast & crew
  • Travel & lodging
  • Props, costumes & set dressing
  • Location rentals
  • Other equipment rentals (generators, etc.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the ability to donate to our film?  There are other ways that you can help!

Share the campaign with your friends on social media.  Maybe someone you know will be interested in my project and be in a position to help out!

Follow @midnightskyproductions on Instagram and Facebook to stay up to date on this project, and future projects to come!

And be sure to stay tuned for the finished product!

story:
Introducing us

The video you see there is Episode 1 of Melbourne Survivor: Warrandyte (Season 2)

Melbourne Survivor is like the reality show 'Survivor' but played over a single weekend in Melbourne. For the contestants it's like a small taste of what it would feel like to play Survivor. 

Our host and editor, Liz, started things back in 2018 with Season 1 which she hosted over 12 hours in a local park. It was filmed & edited by a friend into a 30 minute video which was shown at a Survivor-themed 21st birthday. Being part of a 21st celebration was a great reason to get people trying something they otherwise might not have done. 

Realising what was possible, Liz got together with some Season 1 contestants and started planning for Season 2 - this time over a weekend. Many emails, a Kickstarter campaign and a lot of Facebook posts later, Season 2 happened in a scout park in Warrandyte. It was a hectic week leading up to it with cast and crew pulling out and last minute replacements being found, as well as a stressful Friday picking up hired filming lights in the city - but it was a fantastic season and the weekend format proved to be pretty great, as every person got the chance to have a Survivor-y experience of sleeping on the ground, getting enough time to strategise and make friendships without so much time as to have major ill will or bitterness from being voted out. 

The only thing missing was fire. That and some better visual and audio equipment. Also more an even male to female ratio, and more crew who were willing to 

Now, we have all of that. (except we still have way less female applicants than male, women please apply) Because we're planning for October or more likely April because the Covid situation is not so great, we won't be in the fire restriction months and so instead of spending time putting cellophane in torches we'll be researching fire safety. Contestants will be cooking rice on a fire which they'll start themselves and when they get voted out a torch filled with fire will be snuffed. 

 

What We Need 

Here's what we need funds for:

  • $660 for buffs - we will reuse some of these for our trial games (same thing over a day, not filmed)
  • $189 or more for Public Liability Insurance - if we postpone to April we will have to rearrange or seek new cover. 
  • $250 minimum for campsite booking. This depends on the amount of people present. It is likely to be more expensive if we have to change location by postponing the event. 
  • $100 for props such as replacing broken buckets, balance beams, torches, permanent markers etc.
  • $85 for lighting hire

 

Some of this is covered by previous buff purchases and we're grateful that food is being covered by the Reilly family. Some very keen production members have also used the lockdown period as a time to construct challenges at their own expense. The contestant fee goes straight to accommodation

If we have extra funds that means we can do a whole lot more. We can purchase or hire more filming equipment, to create a better result for viewers and an easier editing process for us. We can also create ads to get more traction and find people willing to help out or apply. 

 

The Impact

Without supporters we can't run the event. We're not a business, we don't have investors. Any money we need that isn't raised comes from our own pockets and those pockets do have limits. 

Ultimately our goals with all of this are:

  • to bring people together who wouldn't otherwise have met, forming significant friendships
  • to create a fun experience for everyone, including people who watch it on YouTube
  • to encourage people to get out of their comfort zone and try something new
  • promoting the idea of getting back to nature for a bit and taking a break from technology

 

Risks & Challenges

While we have some really cool Survivor challenges, we also have some planning challenges, the main one being dealing with Covid. We would prefer to postpone rather than attempting to enforce precautions that would be near impossible to follow. Of course we won't be able to run the event if it is illegal to do so, but we also will not run the event if we believe it is unsafe.

This means it could very well take a long time for Season 3 to happen. However, the longer it's delayed the better it will be. 

The reason why we can still aim for October or April is that it will be outside and with a relatively small number of people. We will be prepared with hand sanitiser for everyone, cast replacements, change of format, and a refund and spot in a future season if someone who has been cast gets sick before the event. 

There will also be a no-whispering rule, not just because talking right up to someone's face is not a good thing to do even if cases are lowered, but also because it's a pain to edit a narrative when you have no idea what people are saying. 

The risks as you can see are health and safety related. There are precautions we need to take as we use fire for the first time, and will be guided by the scout park mangagers/rangers in doing so. If we are unable to book our preferred location for April we may go back to Clifford Park which will be a bit more expensive but also more familiar. 

There is also a mental health risk in playing a social strategy game like Survivor. People will be lying and voting people out, and things can be hard afterwards particularly for people voted out early or those who weren't perceived how they thought they would be. In our experience the short time span and lack of focus on prize money helps with this as people aren't too invested in the game but rather can enjoy the experience.

This is also why no one gets voted out until after the first night, so that everyone still gets a solid Survivor experience. Upon being voted out contestants still get to watch challenges and tribal councils and crew members are open to discussing what's been happening. They understand as most of them have played games like this before. 

There's also always a chance that something could go wrong with footage, a laptop could die or a hard drive or SD card could go missing. It was actually kind of a miracle that all we had to deal with for Warrandyte was 2 missing camera angles at Tribal Council, considering the laptop used to edit is 5+ years old and fell down 2 concrete steps once. This time there is much less chance of that happening as we just have more people involved and more contingency plans. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry! There are still valuable ways you can help:

1. You can get the word out by sharing this campaign! To share it in an effective way it's worth a little bit about it like "hey my friends are doing this cool thing" or "if you like Survivor, check this out!"

2. You can watch episodes of Melbourne Survivor so that you know what we're up to and can inform people who are interested.

3. You can apply as a contestant, join the crew on the day, or recruit a friend who might enjoy one of those two things 

Apply here: https://forms.gle/45qHTBQE16T9j4fq7

Production team form: https://forms.gle/HJQJawfqExJ9iZ5F6

We're also putting together a post-production team for editing the footage later. If you have skills in this area and would like to be a part of this, please let us know by getting in contact with us via one of the methods below.

 

Contact

Email - melbournesurvivor@gmail.com

Facebook - Melbourne Survivor

Instagram - @melbsurvivor

Twitter - @liz_reilly97

story:
Short Summary

My name is Cornell Thomas. I'm a father, husband, author, speaker, and social entrepreneur from New Jersey. I travel all over the world sharing my story of overcoming adversity, chasing dreams, and finding purpose. I was raised in a single family home (my father passed when I was 3) by my mother the great Tina Thomas. She raised five of us with very little money. So who I am is a direct result of who she is. We were taught that if you don't like something don't sit around and complain about it just go out and fix it. You see a problem find the solution, and I have a big problem.

Non-Fiction television SUCKS!! Yes there are some pretty good shows out there, but for the most part we are inundated with crap. Every night we have to sit through another "reality" show where drama is the main focus. It's all scripted nonsense (I mean seriously how many arguments can you have at the dinner table) Why don't we ever see the good that happens in our world? Why are we force fed all the negativity? This is why this show is so important.

Each episode I will be traveling the world and interviewing "ordinary" people doing extraordinary things for humanity.  During the episode you will be able to support their causes, and help them help others. I want to bring a positive light to all the darkness we're seeing on television right now. I want to show my kids, and the next generation that they don't have to repeat the cycle. That they can be the change this world so desperately needs

What We Need To Make It Happen

The cost of shooting both the pilot and the first episode is 45K. Yes 45,000 dollars, and you might be asking yourself what does that COVER. Well here's the information you need:

Cost of a 3 man camera crew for a 15 day shoot: 12K 

Cost of 100 hours of editing: 7500K

Travel Expenses: (For Three People/Pilot Episode) 2K

Cost of entertainment lawyer: 15K

Cost of Venue For Fall Premiere Event: 8K

OUR THANKS TO YOU!!! WHAT YOU GET!!

$5 (unlimited) Special shout out from international speaker and author Cornell Thomas, on one of his social media platforms.

$10 (unlimited) Shout out from international speaker and author Cornell Thomas on Facebook Live.

$20 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, and a custom made video thank you from Cornell to YOU.

$50 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, and your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode.

$75 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, and your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode.

$100 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 3 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support.

$200-$500 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 3 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support.

$500- $950 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 5 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support.

$1000 (20 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 5 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose.

$5000 (10 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 10 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose. You will be an extra on our TV show (no speaking lines but you’ll be in the background)

$10000 (5 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 10 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose. You will be an extra on our TV show (no speaking lines but you’ll be in the background) Cornell Thomas will come speak at your company or event for free.

Your Contribution

There is a reason that anyone that contributes gets something in return. Because every single person that does is saying they are ready for a change. I have never been someone that talks about doing something, I'm about action, and you contributing to this cause shows me that you are too. Thank you so much for making this dream come to fruition. We love you all!!

Risk vs Reward

There are always risk when you are chasing a dream, but they pale in comparison to all of us sitting in front of a large movie screen and watching OUR show "On Purpose" will help change the landscape of the television world as we know it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!!!! We all have people that we know that want to make a difference. Usually they're not sure how. All it takes is $5, share it with the world my friends!!!

$500- $950 (unlimited) An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 5 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support.
$1000 (20 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 5 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose.
$5000 (10 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 10 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose. You will be an extra on our TV show (no speaking lines but you’ll be in the background)
$10000 (5 tickets) Club: An official “On Purpose” Bracelet, a shout out from Cornell Thomas, a custom video made from Cornell to You, an official On Purpose T-Shirt, your name at the end credits of the Pilot episode, and a 10 minute phone call from Cornell thanking you for your support. Your name or company logo in the first two episodes of our show. Free tickets to the premier of On Purpose. You will be an extra on our TV show (no speaking lines but you’ll be in the background) Cornell Thomas will come speak at your company or event for free.
Your Contribution
There is a reason that anyone that contributes gets something in return. Because every single person that does is saying they are ready for a change. I have never been someone that talks about doing something, I'm about action, and you contributing to this cause shows me that you are too. Thank you so much for making this dream come to fruition. We love you all!!
Risk vs Reward
There are always risk when you are chasing a dream, but they pale in comparison to all of us sitting in front of a large movie screen and watching OUR show "On Purpose" will help change the landscape of the television world as we know it.
Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!!!! We all have people that we know that want to make a difference. Usually they're not sure how. All it takes is $5, share it with the world my friends!!!

story:
About Me and My Project

Hello! My name is Rachel Gordine and I am a student at The New York Film Academy where I am working towards a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Acting. This is my final semester, so I am tasked in creating a web series pilot. 

My web series, The Apple Pie Affliction, is about Elizabeth, a senior in high school who is completely alone. Her only escape is music, and that is what she plans to use to get out of her small town and to a place where she is surrounded by people who accept her.  

I am from a small town of 8,000 in Nebraska, and while I didn't feel isolated like Elizabeth, I felt that in order to chase my dream I needed to leave. This story is very close to me and combines various truths in my life as well as fiction. 

​This is a great opportunity for me to showcase my writing, acting, and music skills. It also has a great message that everyone can understand.  

What We Need 

We need funding for the project as a whole. This will include funding for my talented crew, cast, and locations. Our budget of $2,500 will allow us to produce a professional pilot, which will give us a better opportunity to produce the rest of the series. 

So What Do You Get?

We have many perks that vary by your contribution. Since Elizabeth, our main character, loves music, we have covers of songs available. I have been playing instruments since I was 4 years old, and have been singing for just as long. I would love to give you a gift that I personally create to show you how much I appreciate your contribution.

Below is a cover I've created previously!

You will also get the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped a college student receive her diploma and have set her up with a project after she graduates! 

 

The Impact

This project has a great message. It tells people that they are never truly alone and not to be afraid of chasing your dreams. This is a message that is for everyone!

It also has a message against bullying. In school, no matter how much we try to preach bullying is bad, it happens anyway. I can remember having speakers come and talk about it and watching boring informational videos about it. I think that putting this message in an entertaining show, which would be on the internet, in a quick video will help kids accept the message. It is in a format that is really understood and used by them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that is okay! If you'd like to help, please spread the word. Post on social media or tell your friends! More exposure means more donations!

story:
Short Summary

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our new amazing project, "Unstable!" Our show is about two people learning how to deal with things thrown at them, day by day. Getting tested and still working on being their best selves! We're telling a story of growth. Taking situations that may seem unfortunate and always fight to find the positive in them. My name is Dashay and I took this journey with one of my best friends, Luis who will also co-star with me. We're so excited to share our truths with you and give you guys some giggles! This campaign is to help pay the amazing people who decided they believe in this, and us. They took a leap of faith by giving us something precious, their time. We're dedicated to using it to make something great happen! We can't wait to show you guys what we've got cooking over here!

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal at $10,000, but of course every donation matters! This money is going to be used in many spectacular ways.

We'll be using the funds raised for locations, production design, equipment, wardrobe, transport and of course to pay and feed our awesome cast and crew! 

- Jo Galloway, Director

- Nick Kane - Director of Photography 

- Nicole Dillman, Composition and Post Production

- Harrison Bobbins, Camera 

- Camilo Gomez, Sound

- Meghan Pezzano, Assistant Director &Writer

Production By Showorks Entertainment - Jo Galloway & Darren Portilla.

Hopefully, if we are VERY VERY lucky, we can put some money aside for a small launch of the series and a prospective Season 2!

We have also added some awesome perks to bribe you all and thank you for helping us create this story.

The Impact

Unstable is my baby. It's ready to start crawling, walking, and eventually one day running. With your help we will be able to achieve this. You have no idea how much your contribution means to me, and the impact it will have on my journey as a storyteller. It will be forever appreciated! We hope you will join us and be part of helping this beautiful project grow. You never know how strong you are until you need to be!

Risks & Challenges

As this is based on our personal journey navigating the "Hollywood Hills and valleys," The most important thing is keeping the story honest, authentic, and fun! This is a slice of life from the bigger pie filled with the tantalizing tease of tinsel town...(whatever that is!) The story itself is powerful, encouraging and depressingly hilarious. I have no doubt we can help change the world if we take our time, have patience, and always do our best!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow our process on our Instagram page @unstableofficial

Share us, talk about it, and help us make it great!

Thank you again for your time, and I hope we can make some really awesome things come to fruition together =)

story:
Short Summary

Filtered Water is a web series about an all girls high school swim team and their conversations that occur while stretching before practice. The oddities and seriousness of topics spoken during stretches is a fond memory for Dir. Dannah Eckhardt; she can distinctly remember hearing one of her teammates say loudly in front of the entire co-ed swim team, “My uterus hurts so much!” This series follows those moments of outrageous --- honesty? The series is about what it means to be a young woman and have your voiced denied as being “dramatic” or “silly” and the struggles this then causes when trying to find the courage to take action.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $500 which will go to helping the project reach festivals. We have some great perks including a poster, a social media shoutout, and IMBD credit!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE US WITH YOUR FRIENDS!!

Follow our Instagram account @sadgirlprods and subscribe to our YouTube https://www.youtube.com/c/SadGirlProductions

story:
Our Story

PseudoHouse, LLC is a web-based entertainment company that houses the shows: Song Battle, Theme Song Battle and Rap Roulette.

  • PseudoHouse launched late of last year and has already reached over 40 million users
  • PseudoHouse brings a sense of nostalgia and comedy to our web community
  • Your donations will help us branch out and spread positivity through laughter and fun games.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need to complete our next season and what you will receive in return:

  • In order to complete our first season, we'll need at least $15,000. The funds raised will go 100% towards the production of Song Battle and Theme Song Battle. We will order, new lights, additional cameras, higher quality microphones, 9 seamless background rolls, a small studio space, and much more. These will facilitate the filming and editing process to ensure faster production.
  • For donating, you can receive exclusive PseudoHouse merchandise, episode credits, BTS footage, + more! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, thats ok! Here are a few ways you can still help PseudoHouse:

  • Spread the word and share our campaign to family and friends.
  • Follow us on instagram @PseudoHouse 
  • Subscribe to our Youtube https://www.youtube.com/pseudohouse
  • Like our Facebook Page @PseudoHouse

Thanks for your donation!

story:
A bit about us and the project:

Director: Kermel Yohannes BA, multiple projects directed as well as working for the AMPAS in Los Angeles.

Director: La’Perria Harvin BA, AMPAS, production work from Philadelphia to Los Angeles podcasting as well as live events.

Producer and Top Billing Actor: Reginald Darby: Serious Actor with numerous credits as well as an established comedian.

 

This project is us taking action to bring to fruition a vision of the director. From inception to completion, this is a project from the minds of creatives and we have the passion to see this project through. Contributors will help young creatives continue their path and dream of creative new ways of expression and storytelling told from a BIPOC viewpoint.

We will continue to produce great works, made by people of colour. We are seeking to raise 5K to complete this pilot to be distributed to locations fees, casting fees, production- pre and post costs, crafty (nourishment) and promotional costs.

We anticipate reaching our goal, however if we don't the funds will still be allocated properly between order of importance of completing this pilot project.

We want to continue to produce more work and show those that have hopes and dreams that they too can achieve them.

As producers, actors and directors our time in the business, we understand the hard work, planning, and flexibility needed to complete a project like this. We are no longer bound by issues with filming. We are solution based and will see this project through.

Challenges are filming through this pandemic, however all precaution and safety measures will be taken. As we branch off and begin to create projects on our own, asking for monetary assistance is helpful.

Please make sure to spread this word to thoughts that are in production, those that like to help, those that watch tv and those that genuinely would like to help break generational curses.

story:
______________________________________________________________________________________

Hello and welcome to the   family.                       

Come in, take your shoes off (no seriously) we just vacuumed. Sit down (but not there, that's the good couch) and stay awhile. 

Last year, a bunch of us got together and shot a 2 minute proof of concept demo which you can watch below. We felt  that we were onto something special back then, and judging by the positive feedback, it resonated with many viewers. Our TARGET GOAL is to raise $25000 to produce the first 6 webisodes of Season 1 and word on the street is you want in on the action. Today, the cost to produce a broadcast quality web series with professional actors and crew is roughly $1500 to $2000 per minute. That's a lotta cheddar. We believe we can achieve the same look for half of that. Are we overambitious? Maybe. Crazy? Fuggedaboudit! With your involvement and generous donations, we're confident we can reach our goal and maybe then some, but before you dip into your wallets and purses, let me introduce you to our amazing TEAM: 

_____________________________________________________________________________________ 

______________________________________________________________________________________

We are also very lucky and grateful to have some of Canada's finest actors in the supporting roles, like MARIA VACRATSIS - (Mama Mia - Here We Go Again), as Mob Boss Mrs. Scrota, MICHAEL MIRANDA - (Saw V) as Father Romano, DAN LETT - (The Shape of Water), MARY LONG - (Come Dance With Me), MELISSA D'AGOSTINO - (Tactical Girls), ALIA DeSANTIS - (Impulse) and MAURICE DEAN WINT - (Her Stolen Past) to name a few.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

 On your right, you'll see a list of cool perks we're offering, depending on the size of your contribution. They run the gamut from material, like 'autographed posters', to experiential, like an 'authentic Italian meal', prepared in your home by Nonna and her boys. Check out the budget 'cheese wheel'  below  to see where your hard-earned dollars will be spent (i.e. cast and crew, equipment, legal, props, insurance, permits, transportation, locations,  wardrobe, music recording, sound and picture editing etc.. and of course food, to keep everyone happy.)

Remember, no donation is too small. Even $10 can help us out, but if you can't afford to come on board as a backer, no problem. You can still support us by sharing the Indiegogo link https://igg.me/at/boombats/ with all your friends and family via Twitter, Instagram, Facebook etc, which will generate some buzz and help us to reach our target goal. 

 $25,000 PRODUCTION BUDGET BREAKDOWN:  Or how we intend to 'cut the cheese'. 

 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Here's the       demo we did last year,              which you may or may not have seen, take a look.

 

               
 

______________________________________________________________________________________

What happens if we don't raise our target goal? Good question. Depending on the final tally, we may have to cut back and shoot less than 6 webisodes. Or if we fall just short of the mark, we could still do all 6, if we creatively cut some corners and call on our guy who knows a guy... If we happen to go OVER our target goal, here's an outline of where that money will go.

STRETCH GOALS

$30,000 - shoot 1 more webisode/ more funds for postproduction. 

$35,000 - shoot 1 more webisode plus unlock a mystery perk for backers $75 and up.

$40,000 - more funds for marketing, promotion and festivals - shoot 2 more webisodes.

$50,000 - enhance social media profile/promotion and P.R. - shoot 2 more webisodes.

 _____________________________________________________________________________________                                                     

WARNING: {Corny baseball cliché ahead}

So, are you ready to step up to the plate and go to bat for:     

                                

Imagine the satisfaction you'll get out of funding a web series. Just think, you made it happen. How cool is that? High five! Take the rest of the day off, you deserve it. Now don't be a stranger huh? You're family now. Check in from time to time either here or on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/BoombatsBattali  for updates, new perks and giveaways or just to say 'ciao ragazzi'. And finally, we can't say it enough,  

 

  and big   from Nonna, for setting her free.

Frequently Asked Questions: 

  • When will I receive my perks?   
  • Some perks will be sent off shortly after the campaign ends. Others will be delivered after production is completed.
  • When will filming begin?
  • We're hoping to start filming mid to late June, depending on scheduling and availability.
  • How will you keep the funders informed? 
  • We will send out regular updates through our Facebook and Indiegogo pages as well as via email to all the contributors. https://www.facebook.com/BoombatsBattali/
  • Will I make any money from my investment? 
  • This being a reward based campaign, you won't receive a monetary return on your investment but rather 'incentive perks' in exchange for your financial support.
  • Can I claim my contribution for income tax purposes? 
  • Unfortunately, your donation is NOT tax deductible, as there are no tax benefits for the contributor.
  • Is there a requested amount I should donate? 
  • No, it's whatever you can afford. Contributions start as low as $10 and go as high as $5000.

Some perks will be sent off shortly after the campaign ends. Others will be delivered after production is completed.

When will filming begin? 

We're hoping to start filming mid to late June, depending on scheduling and availability.

How will you keep the funders informed? 

We will send out regular updates through our Facebook and Indiegogo pages as well as via email to all the contributors. https://www.facebook.com/BoombatsBattali/


Will I make any money from my investment? 
This being a reward based campaign, you won't receive a monetary return on your investment but rather 'incentive perks' in exchange for your financial support.

Can I claim my contribution for income tax purposes? 

Unfortunately, your donation is NOT tax deductible, as there are no tax benefits for the contributor.

Is there a requested amount I should donate? 
No, it's whatever you can afford. Contributions start as low as $10 and go as high as $5000.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, and thanks for at least looking at our crowdfunder!  You've made it this far, so that means we've basically already gotten your money, but in case we haven't, let's tell you a bit about us!

Aspire Productions is an independent production company based out of Northwest Indiana AKA The Region (AKA the county that has Gary, IN for you people not from around here).  For four years Aspire's been making shorts and comedy sketches in our free time, but our goal has always been to bring The Collector to life.

So what is The Collector?  The Collector is a web series about a man--known only as the Collector--who works for an agency that is contracted by criminals to collect debts as loan sharks and "tie up loose ends" (Kill them).  The Collector's been in production for four years.  We even shot an original pilot that was just so awful we needed to destroy it, rewrite, recast, and try again.  So that's what you're seeing now!

The Collector's universe that we constructed is vast, and there are plenty of colorful characters we want to bring to your screens.  Your contributions to this crowdfunder will allow us to create the very first 6 webisode season independently so that we can begin to garner interest for a full web series.

What We Need & What You Get

So why do we need money?!  Well if you didn't watch that video at the top with our little introduction, we'll break it down very simply for you:

  • Equipment Rentals:  This is probably the biggest one.  We have one decent camera, and a few lights amongst ourselves, but things that need to be rented will be dollys, jibs, better lights, better lenses; basically we need the type of equipment that will make it seem less like a student film and more like a professional web series.
  • Props:  We went through two pistols when we shot the original pilot of The Collector.  Those airsoft guns are so fragile.  To ensure we're not wasting money, we're going to need quality props.  And not just guns, we'll also need various props and set dressing to make each scene feel real (we have an episode with a creepy organ harvester that will need medical equipment, for example).
  • Cast Fees & Transportation:  Actors always expect to be paid, at least for gas which is just the biggest inconvenience.  Unfortunately we need them, and since we're in the suburbs and a lot of our cast comes from Chicago or Indianapolis, we'll need to pay for them to get out here.
  • On Set Meals:  We'll be pulling long days to ensure all 6 episodes get filmed before August, so we're going to need to feed our cast and crew during those days.

So you know why we need our money, but what's in it for you?  Well, you get an awesome web series of course!  Wait, that's not enough?  Crap.  Well we made up some perks that don't include you getting a Skype meeting with a couple of nobodies or getting an executive producer credit that you probably didn't care about.

  • At $5 you get a shout-out on social media and your name in the credits of each episode.  It's 5 bucks, what'd you expect?
  • At $25 you get a digital download of the complete first season.  Better yet, you get those digital downloads one week before each episode comes out.  (Plus above perks)
  • At $50 you get a Blu-ray of the complete first season with bonus features AND a poster of the official cover of The Collector Blu-ray.  (Plus above perks)
  • At $100 you get a fancy pants t-shirt, and a walk-on extra role (if you want it).  (Plus above perks)
  • At $250 (only one of these), you get to help us create a character that The Collector kills.  You can even play him/her!  How cool would it be to be killed by our Collector?  (Plus above perks)

This all sounds great so far, right?  But what happens if we don't reach our goal?  Well, we'll still go forward with the six episodes, but we can't guarantee what the quality's gonna be like out of this one.  $2000 is our bare minimum

The Impact

The indie film industry in Northwest Indiana continues to grow every day.  One of the great things that we aim to do with The Collector is spotlight iconic NWI areas, and let is secondarily serve as a sort of love letter to the area.  Not to mention, so many people have invested so much time, energy, and money into this project already (on the prologue alone!).  Why not help us finish it up?

Risks & Challenges

With filming independently (and not, to be honest) there's always the risk of unpredictable variables ruining a shoot.  Anyone who's filmed knows this and--most importantly here--we know this.  We've run into pretty much every problem possible, and we've become experts at working around them.

So here's what we're saying:  No matter what risks hit us, we WILL power through to ensure you all get the best series that you paid for.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE!

Seriously, we of all people totally understand coming across a cool crowdfunder that we simply can't afford to support.  That's why we put up a $1 option to just give what you can!  Plus, share!  Tell your friends, tell your family, tell the world!  We want to make sure everyone knows about The Collector by the end of this campaign!

story:
Hi, 

I'm Ryan. The producer of Finny and the Egg Man: Adventures Within.  I also play Eggy in the web series.   I'm so excited to start shooting this episodic absurdist comedy.  We just need a couple things first. A little funding to help us lock down permits and the other boring (but necessary) production details, and your ability to spread the buzz about the show and this crowdfunding campaign.

The goal of this series is to provide you with ten funny, slapstick 30 seconds to 2 minutes episodes, and to add a little light-hearted frothiness to your day! :) In order to do that, we need to raise $1000 to make it all possible.  And we're prepared to give back to the people who donate and support. Please see the list of perks you get for each donation category.

story:
Sweet Talk is an innovative, colorful TV series created by Evelina Saulo.

It's being written and produced in collaboration with Story Academy and Film Crew Academy at Gotlands Folkhögskola. A funny, heartfelt, LGBTQ+ inclusive series that will mix two of our most beloved mediums; film and podcasts.

Story and Film Crew Academy have been working together on Gotland for years. Writing and producing a TV show each year is a staple of their collaboration and education. The shows that have been made through the years range from sitcoms to action, from comedy to the most dramatic of dramas.

This year we’re making an emotional rollercoaster of a show. It’s low-key, it’s personal, and most of all: it’s an unapologetic queer love story without dramatic "coming-out" arcs, without explicit and violent homophobia. It’s simply two people falling in love.

Inspiration can be found in the Scandinavian hits Skam & Sjukt Oklar, as well as American shows such as Shrill, Modern Love, & Dear White People. 

However, money makes the world go round, as we all know, and to make sure Sweet Talk lives up to our ambitions, we need more capital. We want to make sure art, actors, editing, and music.... well, all of it. We want it all to be the best it can possibly be.

Help us make it so.

Frida, an openly mega proud, lesbian, is stuck. In life, in love, and on the island of Gotland. Together with her best friend Gabriella, she runs the podcast Sweet Talk - A podcast about sex & relationships that she hopes will grow and kickstart her career. Gabriella isn’t quite as passionate but is okay with being dragged along to talk about Jonathan, her long-term boyfriend, as Frida goes on and on about her dates.

However, everything changes when Jonathan suddenly dumps Gabriella.

Old feelings between the two women resurface and a whirlwind romance between Frida and Gabriella begins on the heels of the break-up, throwing the whole dynamic of the podcast for a loop.

This will be the start of a passionate, complicated relationship where Gabriella quickly realizes that Frida is the one who she wants to be with. But Frida, who has secretly loved Gabriella since high school, quickly finds herself fumbling, having gone from pining in secret while dating every girl within a 20-mile radius to having the woman of her dreams.

It does not get any easier when Jonathan soon realizes that he has made the mistake of his life and wants Gabriella back. At the same time Billie, a nationally known radio celebrity,  discovers Frida and Sweet Talk and attempts to bring her to Stockholm, a city of possibilities.

In the end, it's all about choices. Will Frida opt-out of her new relationship with Gabriella for Billie and a brilliant podcast career? Will Gabriella dare to invest in Frida, or go back to the security of Jonathan? And are they both willing to compromise their own dreams to make each other happy?

The crew consists mostly of current or former students and we hire established directors, directors of photography, actors, production designers, composers, sound engineers, and so on. All these people need to be paid because no one should work for free in any industry.

Your money would go directly towards all parts of production but most importantly:

  • Art-department (costume, make-up, paint, props)
  • Food (craft services is KEY to a successful production!)
  • Post-production (software to work remotely, royalties, fees)
  • Travel and Covid safety.

We want to make sure the story is told, but most of all that it’s told well and safely. Sure, the vaccine is just within reach but we’re still doing our best to be as prepared as possible, with or without it. Travel is always tricky, but during these times we need to take extra precautions to get people from mainland Sweden to Gotland. Therefore, most of our budget is for travel, to keep our options open and to keep everyone as safe as possible.

Okay but if I contribute, what do I get?

Just some of the most awesome perks around! Everything from your name in the credits, signed posters, and stickers to an invitation to our premiere, a guided tour of the second biggest studio in Sweden, and a co-producer credit!

Sweet Talk takes place on Gotland, a beautiful island off the Swedish east coast. The show will highlight the gorgeous setting as well as make use of the incredible film talent that resides here, students and non-students alike.

And about us? We’re a group of people, of all ages, from all over the world, with a passion for telling inclusive stories. Gotlands Folkhögskola is quickly becoming one of the top Film Schools in the country and is placed just a stone's throw from Ingmar Bergman's Fårö. Our classroom is the second biggest studio in Sweden and our lecturers include icons such as Chris Vogler and Cecilia Iversen. 

As mentioned above, every year Film crew Academy and Story Academy make a web series, led by a fearless showrunner. The students are mentored by established professionals. The showrunner, in this case, Evelina Saulo, is experienced in running a team and a production.

We’ll be sure to introduce you to our entire crew at a later date. For now, here’s our cast:

We get it. Don’t worry. If you can’t contribute financially but still want to watch some sweet, queer content, please share this campaign!

Get your friends and family to donate and/or share! Make sure people hear about Sweet Talk. That's all we ask. 

 

Thank you for your time.

We love you.

Stay safe.

And stay Sweet :)

The students are mentored by established professionals. story:
Short Summary

In this pilot episode, four college student documentarians from 1985 get zapped to modern day via time traveling, shape shifting couch. What do a narcissistic director, apathetic rebel, timid outsider, raging party-goer, and aspiring bee-keeper/musician have in common? Not much. The show follows this motley crew on their journey to find a bridge back to their home decade, until things go awry when the gang has different ideas on how they want to handle the situation.

We drew inspiration from not only 1980s aesthetic for how the production will be edited, but we also wanted to incorporate some of the campy and exaggerated humor that comes from 1980s films and series. Combine these with both modern day and a couch that breaks all laws of physics, and you've got That's a Warp! 

What We Need & What You Get

TV production is expensive, folks. Here's what your glorious funds will go to:

  • Pre-production: This includes things such as buying costumes and props. Thrift shopping exists, but it all adds up. We can't have kids from the 80's dressed in Yeezy's or the like. We have to keep things within their realm. Remember IZOD shirts? Excessive Denim? Leather jackets with safety pins? Those sorts of things. As for props, let's just say we need Play-Doh. Maybe a police baton. We won't include spoilers, so just trust us.
  • Equipment Rental: Here's where the bulk of your money is going to go. This show is made by lower-division students at UT Austin, which means we can't rent equipment from the school for free yet, so we have to go to outside rental companies. Expensive equipment rental rate x each day x several weekends of filming = pricey. 
  • Craft Services and Travel: Our crew is comprised of students working on their own time. We are not able to pay them (although we'd love to, because they ROCK) so the least we can do is feed them. Also, gas prices may be better than they were in 2012, but we are a bunch of broke college students who could use your help.

No donation is too small. Just like the prices of our needs, your donations all add up. And the great and exciting part is that there's stuff in it for you, too! Check out the Perks section of the page!

The Impact

As lower-division college students looking to gain experience, the opportunity itself is incredibly rewarding for all of us. To even create this TV show, our three executives (wannabe screenwriters) had to apply to a writing class along with 60+ other people. 20 of those applicants were accepted into the class, then we had to pitch 2 ideas each. Out of those pitches, ours was selected, and That's a Warp! was born. We wrote a script, assembled a crew, and the rest is thanks to you.

Creating the show is a beast within itself, since none of us are professionals or advanced students. However, we're a talented and hardworking bunch that wants to create the best production we can. We enjoy coming up with cheap and creative solutions, but in some areas, we could really use an extra boost. Not only would you be supporting student television, but you'd be giving us opportunity leading to experience, which only helps us in the long run! Remember, this is a TV pilot, meaning it's the first episode of a series. You can say YOU were with us from the beginning, and helped gave the show its start.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, you can still help spread the word!

  • Check out our social media and share our pages! Don't be afraid to be loud and proud.
  • You can share this campaign by copy/pasting the link or pressing the "share" button to help us advertise.
  • Take a moment to look through our image gallery and read about our amazing cast and crew!

story:
Who Are We?

We are a group of student comedians, filmmakers, actors, artists, and collaborators who are producing a short anthology romantic comedy web-series that showcases diverse, modern young love. 

What Is I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For?

In the first season, we will have three episodes: Cool, Van Gogh, and Constellation. Each episode has a different writer and director. Our goal with this project is to encourage a collaborative and diverse environment. A lot of projects are generally run by a team of one or two, but we have five executive producers and many other talented people heading critical roles.

Episode 1: Cool: Kaela, a high school girl finally gets with her crush Tom, but shortly after Kaela is crushed when Tom's true intentions come out.

Episode 2: Van Gogh: After high schooler Nora is  dumped by her boyfriend, she angrily destroys one of his paintings. Except it wasn't his painting...

Episode 3: Constellation: While enduring homophobic bullying at a school dance, Nick has an unexpected interaction with one of schools most popular boys.

 

How Can YOU Support?

By donating to this project, YOU would be helping us bring fresh perspectives to fruition. This project is very important to every single member of this team for various reasons, which is why your support means so much. The money raised through this campaign will go towards providing the proper resources needed to give our the stories the justice they deserve.

THE TEAM

Trey Glickman: Producer/Writer/Director

Trey is a filmmaker, writer, and illustrator. A cliche New York Jew, he loves rom-coms and the Mets.

Grace Goodell: Producer

Grace is looking to transfer her extensive background in theater into a film setting, and is excited to start this new chapter.

Kali Van Dusen: Producer

Kali has worked as a producer and a member of CamTeam® many times before and is the biggest rom-com fan around these parts.

Mackenzie Thomas: Writer/Director

Mackenzie is a comedian and writer. An experienced social media personality, Mackenzie has gone viral multiple times!

Finn Wagstaff: Writer/Director

Finn is a comedian, playwright, and improv extraordinaire! He looks to bring his unique touch to this production.

Kaitlin Griffin: Director of Photography

Kaitlin is excited to DP this incredibly funny series with some of the most creative folks around! She loves a good comedy, and this is sure to knock your socks off.

Julia Newman: Director

Julia is a seasoned veteran who has worked many different positions on film sets. She looks to bring her vast knowledge and fun energy to set!

Hannah Berkowitz: Assistant Director

Hannah is a filmmaker and comedian. She can’t wait to assistant direct for I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For!

Jalyn Cox: Marketing Director

Jalyn is a entrepreneur and Marketing Legend and we are so blessed to have her heading all of our social media content! 

THE CAST

Keely Ventress - Kaela

Ryan Watts - Tom

Anna Miller - Nora

Claire Layden - Mo

Travis Cilik - TJ

Zach Honer - Nick

Ademir Monteiro - Eric

Isa Moon - Tasha

Harvey Kelley - Dillon

 

Incentives
story_txt:
Who Are We?We are a group of student comedians, filmmakers, actors, artists, and collaborators who are producing a short anthology romantic comedy web-series that showcases diverse, modern young love. What Is I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For?In the first season, we will have three episodes: Cool, Van Gogh, and Constellation. Each episode has a different writer and director. Our goal with this project is to encourage a collaborative and diverse environment. A lot of projects are generally run by a team of one or two, but we have five executive producers and many other talented people heading critical roles.Episode 1: Cool: Kaela, a high school girl finally gets with her crush Tom, but shortly after Kaela is crushed when Tom's true intentions come out.Episode 2: Van Gogh: After high schooler Nora is  dumped by her boyfriend, she angrily destroys one of his paintings. Except it wasn't his painting...Episode 3: Constellation: While enduring homophobic bullying at a school dance, Nick has an unexpected interaction with one of schools most popular boys. How Can YOU Support?By donating to this project, YOU would be helping us bring fresh perspectives to fruition. This project is very important to every single member of this team for various reasons, which is why your support means so much. The money raised through this campaign will go towards providing the proper resources needed to give our the stories the justice they deserve.THE TEAMTrey Glickman: Producer/Writer/DirectorTrey is a filmmaker, writer, and illustrator. story:
THE STORY
With over 11 Million views, Last Life uses a unique perspective of reincarnation and witchcraft to tell a story of two soul mates, Sloane and Taylor. Destined for darkness and destruction, Sloane and Taylor are actively being kept apart by light-witch coven, The Alina. On the other side, The Blood Born have a plan for Taylor to fulfill a dark prophecy and are using Sloane to get to her.

SEASON 3
Season 1 focused on the reuniting of these two soul mates; Season 2 focused on who Taylor truly is and the lengths Sloane would go to keep her safe. However, by the end of Season 2, they have been ripped apart once again!

Season 3 will focus on the three days of darkness and the prophecy coming to pass. Will The Adversary take over Taylor, release the lost Blood Born souls, and overrun the world? Will Sloane and Taylor ever get to be together again?




Where does the money go?

Pre-production
• Locations
• Film permits
• Extra camera, sound, and lighting equipment
• Props
• Set design

Production
• Extra hands on deck - when two is just not enough. (i.e. sound operator, make-up artist, etc.)
• Feeding the cast and crew
• Travel expenses

Post-production

  • Music
  • Sound Mixing
  • Visual Effects



BUT I DONT HAVE ANY MONEY:

Neither do we! Lol So we totally get that! Money is NOT the only way to support Last Life. Just subscribing to the channel and spreading the word goes a VERY long way. So, subscribe and share our series! :)

story:
Meet Michelle Murad:

(That's me, with the sunflower top, directing family and friends).

In the third grade, during the end of the year swim team banquet,  I was awarded "Best Gossip." While all my other classmates were given trophies, I was gifted a Cosmopolitan Magazine. Little did I know then that storytelling was my calling.  Twenty years later, I packed my bags, picked up my SAG-AFTRA card, and moved in with an 87-year-old woman in North Hollywood. No, I do not still live with her anymore, but I have stories.  I have over ten years of professional experience in the entertainment industry. I have experience working in production as a production assistant, as a producer, writer, and actress. 

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3443003/

http://www.michellemurad.com

I am an alum from the UCLA Professional Program in Acting for the Camera(2016), Producing (2020), and TV Writing in Comedy(2018), where my musical tv series received "Honorable Mention" for best original comedy, which was later featured in Deadline. I am currently in the Women in Film Mentorship program, where I work alongside some of the top women in Hollywood.

SOME PREVIOUS WORK:

"Jewish By Association" (2018) Honorable Mention for Best Original Series in the UCLA TV Writing Contest! 

BLACKLIST REVIEW of "Jewish By Association" - 

This pilot is solid and works successfully on multiple levels. The narrative is helmed by the offbeat
Misha, a Millennial, defined (and arguably enslaved) by a childhood steeped in swirling Disney
romanticism. Between the female protagonist and the script's likelihood to spiral into
Disney-inspired, musically-inclined fantasy sequences, there are many memorable moments within the pilot:  Overall, the script is charming and entertaining and peopled with likable characters capable of sustaining a series and holding the audience attention. 

#BECOMINGWOKE (2019) Comedy Series receives Recommendation from WESCREENPLAY! Only 3% of scripts receive a "Recommend."

 

"The concept is pretty strong. There have been a lot of Go Back in Time sitcoms over the years. But this feels like it could be a fresh update on the subgenre."

 

SENIOR HOUR (2020)  Romantic Comedy/ Short Film

"This is a cute and quaint and pointed short film that nails the current moment but does not lean into it as a gimmick. It is still more about the characters and how they, particularly Alex, somewhat change their perspectives over the course of this Senior Hour at the grocery store." 

 

ABOUT "THE CHARLOTTE CHRONICLES":

COVID-19 has been a b*tch. Being quarantined from the rest of the world has been INCREDIBLY isolating and depressing, so I ADOPTED  a dog from Dogs without Borders, "Charlotte." Her original name was "Muffin," but I get weirded out by naming animals after food (more about that in the show).

(The day I adopted Charlotte 8/9/2020)

 She weighs in at a whopping 3.7 pounds! She has ears that probably weigh more than her entire body, and she's just the best thing that has ever happened to me (aside from sh*tting in the house).  Now the stories that have happened and the "characters" we have met since her adoption have just been one long Curb Your Enthusiasm episode. I've never seen LA from this angle before, and let me tell you, and it's funny, frightening, and fabulous all at once! I decided there were too many bizarre, OUTRAGEOUS, and lovely moments that have happened since her adoption, so I wrote it into a series. 

 

MEET SOME OF THE CAST:

Drea Renee as "Emily"

Born and raised in the great state of Texas, her Mom told her she came out of the womb “looking for the stage!” She excelled in school and joined every club possible. She was not only the Homecoming Queen but Captain of the drumline and Ms. Congeniality in the San Antonio pageant. After graduating from UT Austin with honors and a Radio Television Film degree, she worked hard, saved up all that she could, and moved to LA. When she parked her U-haul in the City of Angels, she had six dollars to her name and a dream. It wasn’t easy, but she stuck with it and eventually found her way in acting and hosting. She has most recently worked on short films, “This is 35” with director Tara Imperatore and “Baby” with director Cole Swanson. She can also be seen in commercials for Bandolier and Sprint. Drea has also worked in the poker industry, hosting various shows including “Poker After Dark” and “Deep Issues.” She’s a known face in the industry after 10 years and has interviewed all of the top poker pros in the game. She is vibrant, funny, and loves to make people laugh. You can catch her singing karaoke or making people laugh at an open mic night. More will be revealed for her as she continues to pursue her dreams on screen. She’s one to watch!

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm11688240/?ref_=instant_nm_1&q=drea%20renee

 

Selina Ringel as "Sabrina"

Selina Ringel received her MFA from AFI Conservatory and was selected as an emerging Latino creator for the Tomorrow's Filmmakers Today program. She wrote and produced THE BEST PEOPLE, which won the Special Jury Award for Best Comedy Feature at WorldFest Houston. Selina moved in front of the camera, writing, producing, and starring in TUNING IN. She has also starred in a digital series for the Duplass Brothers and a few other shorts. She was in the groundlings and performed stand up regularly at The Comedy Store, Improv, and The Ice House​!

https://pro.imdb.com/name/nm3950326/?ref_=instant_nm_1&q=selina%20ringe

 

Lecia Papadopoulos as Michelle's "Mom"

Lecia Papadopoulos was born in 1961 in Denver, Colorado, USA, where her mother worked as an elementary school teacher. The family later moved to Casper, Wyoming, USA, where her father worked as a physician. She left high school early to study dance, later moving to New York, where she performed with Senta Driver, Calck Hook, and Glenn-Lund Dance. As an actor, Lecia has appeared in film, commercial, short-form improvisation, dance, and theater. She has served as a local spokesperson for various charities, including the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, Early/Head Start, and the United Way.

imdb.me/LeciaPapadopoulos​

 

Venk Potula as "Dennis"

Venk Potula is an award-winning Indian American filmmaker and actor based out of Los Angeles, CA, via Atlanta, GA. He is a graduate of UCLA’s School of Theater, Film, and Television, where he studied Theater and English. While in school, Venk studied filmmaking and acting with professors James Franco, Peter Weller, and Charles Haid. After graduating, Venk started a production company where he edits and directs digital branded content for various brands, including Bai, Vice Golf, Fnatic, Warner Sisters, Rise-Nation, and ARRI. His branded projects have aired on NBC’s Golf Channel and achieved 500K+ views on various digital platforms.​

http://imdb.me/venkpotula

 

Scot Hartman as "Patrick"

Scot Hartman is an American Actor born in Buffalo, NY. He began his career in NY, performing various stage/film roles, and then transitioned his career to CA. Scot has starred in “The Right Girl,” “Sophie” and was also cast in numerous projects at the Tamarind Theatre in Hollywood, CA. He has trained with some of the world’s most renowned acting coaches (Mel Shapiro, Uta Hagen, Steven McKinley Henderson, Felix Ivanov & Yuri Belov). Scot is thrilled to take on the role of Patrick in “The Charlotte Chronicles!"

 

Charlotte as "Charlotte"​

 

'Kesha Mathews as "Jessica"

Kesha Mathews is a Uta Hagen trained actress based out of Los Angeles. Her diverse schooling includes training by Shannon Sturges, Indrani DeSouza, and Killian McHugh. Kesha can be seen in various commercials and made her theatrical debut in “Hot Pink.” Other projects include lead roles in “Ralph” and “A Short Farewell.”

 

MEET SOME OF THE CREW:

Dan Levy Dagerman - Director. 

Dan got an MFA from AFI Conservatory. His feature directorial debut THE BEST PEOPLE premiered at Cinequest and won an award for Best Comedy at WorldFest Houston. He directed several shorts that screened at festivals worldwide, including Palm Springs Shortfest, Gothenburg, and Mill Valley. Dan runs Two Hands Productions with his wife Selina Ringel.

https://vimeo.com/339373699

 

WHAT'S NEEDED:

 

 

We will be filming 5 episodes (4-5) minutes each! The goal is to raise 20k. That will allow us up to 5k an episode and to be able to pay our crew and talent! We want this to be a fun working environment and to ultimately get people excited about adopting dogs, because you just never know how your life can open up for the better.  Every bit helps and we could not be more grateful that you have decided to help make this story come to life!

 

WHY FUND THE SERIES? :

Why wait when you can create?! I'm inspired by so many people. I'm taking advice from some of my favorites, Reese Witherspoon, Issa Rae, Tyler Perry, Oprah, and a few more. 

When you donate, YOU LITERALLY ARE HELPING CREATE JOBS!

Covid has been brutal to many, especially the Entertainment industry. With your help, we can pay our well-deserving, crew, team, and all those that will work on it!
