story:
PILGRIMAGE TO GETTYSBURG

Journey through the fields of Gettysburg where you'll discover how American Civil War leaders inspired their troops to stay, fight and win - even when the odds were stacked against them.

From the bloodiest battle field in American history our guide, Jay Lorenzen, takes us on an experiential pilgrimage throughout which he tells stories, and back stories, about powerful American Civil War leaders and their choices that ostensibly marked a turning point in the war. 

Jay Lorenzen has been hosting leadership events in the fields in Gettysburg for decades. These events have attracted influencers from across America who, having participated, endorse the Gettysburg pilgrimage as an exceptional. It's time to make this content available to a broad audience.

 

UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY

In the context of COVID, all 2020 Gettysburg Leadership Events have been cancelled.  What's more, America's need for well equipped leaders, rooted in Biblical values and prepared for literal and figurative battle, is greater than ever. 

The Gettysburg community has given special permission to Lorenzo, in partnership with America Studios, to film this series on location in Gettysburg in October 2020. 

The pandemic coupled with civil unrest leave us wondering, "Will we ever again have this kind of access to the largest Battlefield on American soil?"   The time to capture this series is now. 

 

THE SERIES

The stories and leadership principles presented in this series are timeless. Rooted in the Biblical text, the principles serve 21st Century leaders as they did America's Civil War leaders. 

The series includes the following topics:

 - Finding your true identity as a leader

 - Leading emotionally networked teams

 - Discovering the heart and soul of leadership

 - Flying the flag - the importance of "Colors"

 - Learning to see the future

 - Understanding why people stay and fight

 - Observing how best leaders communicate

 

ENDORSEMENTS

Lorenzen has been leading Gettysburg pilgrimages for two decades. These events sell out quickly and the endorsements keep coming.  Here are a few:

Fantastic! A True Three Dimensional Conference. The Gettysburg Leadership Conference is the singular best experiential learning experience I have ever been a part of–and having directed many such experiences with Leadership Network for the past ten years…that says a lot. Bring your leadership team and you will love it and benefit from it tremendously! 

-- Eric Swanson, Missional Specialist, Leadership Network

 

Over more than 40 years of ministry, I’ve had opportunity to attend many professional leadership conferences. NONE was as valuable as your “High Ground at Gettysburg” conference. You have crafted a truly great experience. Never quit. 

-- Stu Weber, Pastor & Author

 

In over 25 years of Christian ministry, there has not been a conference that has leadership lessons, hands on interaction, and applicable principles that I have learned from and enjoyed as much as this one! 

-- Tyrone P. Jones, Pastor

 

The High Ground at Gettysburg conference  is the best personal and leadership development experience I have been a part of. Jay and Laurie create a learning environment that is second to none... I have been to the conference 5 times. I love to bring colleagues and friends and each time they thank me for doing so.

-- Andy Wineman, Pastor

 

PRODUCTION VALUES

Award winning filmmaker, John Grooters, will direct this series.  John's commitment to telling great American stories, coupled with his reliably top-notch cinematic productions, make this a passion project for him. John's IMDB page. 

John's reliable and exceptional production team from Grooters will crew this project.  Collectively, they are most recently known for having filmed 80+ episodes of That the World May Know featuring Ray Vander Laan and the feature film, Tortured for Christ. As of the launch of this campaign, the team is overseas finishing up filming of the feature, Sabina: Tortured for Christ - the Nazi Years.

 

JAY LORENZEN

 

 

Together with his wife Laurie, Jay has been leading development events on the hallowed fields of America’s largest battlefield, Gettysburg, for two decades.  A 20 year Air Force veteren, Lorenzen's interest in Gettysburg and the Civil War was ignited when he was a professor at that Air Force Academy, fueled by the Turner Movie, Gettysburg, and enlightened by his studies in biblical leadership. 

After decades of walking the fields with developing leaders, Jay describes Gettysburg is one of those “thin-places” where the temporal and the eternal are uniquely connected.  

 

“In sacred places, something gets done to you that you’ve been unable to do for yourself.”  -- Thomas Merton

Thomas Merton was a strong believer in pilgrimages and the spirituality of place.  He was drawn to sacred sites, not because he knew the places but because he believed the places knew him.

Gettysburg is one of these sacred places.  The “storied geography” of Gettysburg speaks to the heart.  It’s a place not only to study leadership, but also to experience “where great things were done for us (Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain).”  

 

DISTRIBUTION

America Studios is working behind the scenes to establish and maintain relationships with broadcasters, networks and streaming platforms whose audiences value the principles upon which our country was founded.  The Gettysburg Leadership Series will appear on these channels as well as on America Studios' subscription based streaming platform.

 

FUNDING NEEDS

America Studios needs $50,000 to film this content in October, 2020.  These funds will be used to for production personnel, equipent and logistics including the costs of compliance with Pennsylvania guidelines for ensuring health safety for the everyone involved during the COVID pandemic. 

Planning for production is well underway.  Some funding may be provided via other channels, so contributions collected by other means are not reflected here. The Series' post production will follow filming.  Funds raised in excess of $50,000 will be used toward post production on this project.

Every contributor of $250 or more will get free early digital access to the series via America Studios streaming platform.

Every contributor of $2,000 or more will get early AND perpetual access to the series via America Studios streaming platform.

Learn more about America Studios here: https://www.americastudios.com/

Contact us with questions here:  info@americastudios.com
story_txt:
PILGRIMAGE TO GETTYSBURG
Journey through the fields of Gettysburg where you'll discover how American Civil War leaders inspired their troops to stay, fight and win - even when the odds were stacked against them.
From the bloodiest battle field in American history our guide, Jay Lorenzen, takes us on an experiential pilgrimage throughout which he tells stories, and back stories, about powerful American Civil War leaders and their choices that ostensibly marked a turning point in the war. 
Jay Lorenzen has been hosting leadership events in the fields in Gettysburg for decades. These events have attracted influencers from across America who, having participated, endorse the Gettysburg pilgrimage as an exceptional. It's time to make this content available to a broad audience.
 
UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY
In the context of COVID, all 2020 Gettysburg Leadership Events have been cancelled.  What's more, America's need for well equipped leaders, rooted in Biblical values and prepared for literal and figurative battle, is greater than ever. 
The Gettysburg community has given special permission to Lorenzo, in partnership with America Studios, to film this series on location in Gettysburg in October 2020. 
The pandemic coupled with civil unrest leave us wondering, "Will we ever again have this kind of access to the largest Battlefield on American soil?"   The time to capture this series is now. 
 
THE SERIES
The stories and leadership principles presented in this series are timeless. Rooted in the Biblical text, the principles serve 21st Century leaders as they did America's Civil War leaders. 
The series includes the following topics:
 - Finding your true identity as a leader
 - Leading emotionally networked teams
 - Discovering the heart and soul of leadership
 - Flying the flag - the importance of "Colors"
 - Learning to see the future
 - Understanding why people stay and fight
 - Observing how best leaders communicate
 
ENDORSEMENTS
Lorenzen has been leading Gettysburg pilgrimages for two decades. These events sell out quickly and the endorsements keep coming.  Here are a few:
Fantastic! A True Three Dimensional Conference. The Gettysburg Leadership Conference is the singular best experiential learning experience I have ever been a part of–and having directed many such experiences with Leadership Network for the past ten years…that says a lot. Bring your leadership team and you will love it and benefit from it tremendously!  
-- Eric Swanson, Missional Specialist, Leadership Network
 
Over more than 40 years of ministry, I’ve had opportunity to attend many professional leadership conferences. NONE was as valuable as your “High Ground at Gettysburg” conference. You have crafted a truly great experience. Never quit.  
-- Stu Weber, Pastor & Author
 
In over 25 years of Christian ministry, there has not been a conference that has leadership lessons, hands on interaction, and applicable principles that I have learned from and enjoyed as much as this one!  
-- Tyrone P. Jones, Pastor
 
The High Ground at Gettysburg conference  is the best personal and leadership development experience I have been a part of. Jay and Laurie create a learning environment that is second to none... I have been to the conference 5 times. I love to bring colleagues and friends and each time they thank me for doing so. 
-- Andy Wineman, Pastor
 
PRODUCTION VALUES
Award winning filmmaker, John Grooters, will direct this series.  John's commitment to telling great American stories, coupled with his reliably top-notch cinematic productions, make this a passion project for him. John's IMDB page. 
John's reliable and exceptional production team from Grooters will crew this project.  Collectively, they are most recently known for having filmed 80+ episodes of That the World May Know featuring Ray Vander Laan and the feature film, Tortured for Christ. As of the launch of this campaign, the team is overseas finishing up filming of the feature, Sabina: Tortured for Christ - the Nazi Years.
 
JAY LORENZEN

 

 
Together with his wife Laurie, Jay has been leading development events on the hallowed fields of America’s largest battlefield, Gettysburg, for two decades.  A 20 year Air Force veteren, Lorenzen's interest in Gettysburg and the Civil War was ignited when he was a professor at that Air Force Academy, fueled by the Turner Movie, Gettysburg, and enlightened by his studies in biblical leadership. 
After decades of walking the fields with developing leaders, Jay describes Gettysburg is one of those “thin-places” where the temporal and the eternal are uniquely connected.  
 

“In sacred places, something gets done to you that you’ve been unable to do for yourself.”  -- Thomas Merton
Thomas Merton was a strong believer in pilgrimages and the spirituality of place.  He was drawn to sacred sites, not because he knew the places but because he believed the places knew him.
Gettysburg is one of these sacred places.  The “storied geography” of Gettysburg speaks to the heart.  It’s a place not only to study leadership, but also to experience “where great things were done for us (Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain).”  
 
DISTRIBUTION
America Studios is working behind the scenes to establish and maintain relationships with broadcasters, networks and streaming platforms whose audiences value the principles upon which our country was founded.  The Gettysburg Leadership Series will appear on these channels as well as on America Studios' subscription based streaming platform.
 
FUNDING NEEDS
America Studios needs $50,000 to film this content in October, 2020.  These funds will be used to for production personnel, equipent and logistics including the costs of compliance with Pennsylvania guidelines for ensuring health safety for the everyone involved during the COVID pandemic. 
Planning for production is well underway.  Some funding may be provided via other channels, so contributions collected by other means are not reflected here. The Series' post production will follow filming.  Funds raised in excess of $50,000 will be used toward post production on this project.
Every contributor of $250 or more will get free early digital access to the series via America Studios streaming platform.
Every contributor of $2,000 or more will get early AND perpetual access to the series via America Studios streaming platform.
Learn more about America Studios here: https://www.americastudios.com/
Contact us with questions here:  info@americastudios.com

story:
Who am I?

That’s quite the question. My name is Gina Etlinger, and I am the creator, writer, and soon-to-be director of “Real Adult.” The original pilot for “Real Adult” was my full length, senior thesis at The University of the Arts two years ago, where I received my BFA in Writing for Film and Television. I was awarded the Philadelphia Women in Film and Television Writing Award for my work on the pilot of "Real Adult".  Who could pass up on that kind of validation? I know this script and this world like the back of my hand. In a huge way, it is my life. And I want it to be a part of your lives as well.  

What's the Story?

“Real Adult” is a dramedy that follows six friends in Philadelphia who have just graduated college: Chloe, Rachel, Gab, Matt, Nick, and Robby. They’ve managed to fool themselves into thinking that they know what adulthood is until they realize how not prepared for “adult life” they really are. The group of friends experiences different struggles: their fifth consecutive existential crisis, paying rent with no money, or losing someone they thought they’d always have. Throughout our five episodes, the friends will unravel themselves and the world around them as they struggle to make sense of life now that it’s time to figure it out. Each character is diverse in race and sexuality, and I’m hoping to achieve a broad spectrum of representation while telling stories that are relatable to any person in their early twenties, especially the LGBTQIA community. “Real Adult” presents an important reality: adults with adult responsibilities who don’t feel like adults at all.

What makes “Real Adult” unique?

The series is deeply connected to the LGBTQIA community in Philadelphia. I'm very passionate about my community and connecting to people through my writing. My main goal was to include and show off what I love about Philadelphia and the people in their early-mid 20s that thrive and struggle here. The creative community of Philadelphia is booming, and this is how I intend to tap into that. I don’t believe there is a series that presents an accurate representation of having the rug pulled out from under you when you graduate college. Especially, when others are making it work and you can barely get out of bed.

The Format

Since September, I've turned the pilot into smaller webisodes. This Indiegogo campaign is how we hope to raise funds for the first 5 episodes of season 1.  We’ve been calling it “Season 1.1” with the episodes around 15 minutes each. We plan on shooting the series this May. The show will be released TBA on either YouTube or Vimeo.

Being that we are an independent production, we don’t have the ever-growing budgets of Hollywood film and television. The web-series offers a major contrast, and now more than ever, it’s the time of web content. I believe that the web series format is a strong vehicle for new talent and innovative screenwriting and that our web series offers a fresh, authentic take that our audiences, particularly the LGBTQIA community, will appreciate. These characters represent us, as so-called millennials, written by the person having these experiences. It puts an emphasis on real life while meeting the necessary dramatic and comedic elements.

Why Indiegogo?

Filmmaking is a costly process and it’s easy to get discouraged, quitting before you even start. But artists have to find creative ways to make the funds in order to put out their work. We believe that tapping into our community with something relatable is how we can make that happen. This isn’t just our project; it’s yours too. Indiegogo is the perfect place to make our dream a reality and have you along for the ride.

Where does my donation go?

Donations received on Indiegogo will be used for:

  • Rental/purchase of filmmaking equipment.
  • Making it look and sound amazing: Director of Photography, Sound, Editing, etc.
  • Location and permit fees.
  • Travel/transportation for cast and crew.
  • Promotional and printed goods.
  • Catering for a week of shooting. Food is love. We’re always hungry.

“Real Adult” is being filmed on a relatively small budget and costs add up. But we are confident that reaching our goal will give us the freedom of less stress, therefore creating the best version of our show that we can.

Others Ways You Can Help

We are aware that not everyone is the position to donate. We ask regardless if you donate or not, to please help spread the word on the project! Post our link on social media and share your interest in "Real Adult!"  

Cast & Crew

We are excited to announce that we cast our series two weeks ago! With a few smaller roles to go, our cast has come together perfectly. Almost too perfectly. They are talented, lovely, and already care so deeply for what I am trying to do.  

My team and I are currently in the middle of locking down essential crew, and any day now the team will be complete.

Risks and Challenges

The biggest challenge is the fact that actually producing my writing is a brand new endeavor for me. I will be faced with managing an entire cast and crew of individuals to successfully complete my passionate, singular vision for the project. It's daunting, but it's so exciting. And what if no one laughs at my jokes?! 

Final Thoughts

As an out and proud lesbian, it means the world to me that I was able to represent my generation through my writing. But now more than ever, I want to be able to bring it to life. I hope to give voices to the misunderstood, the diverse, and the proud, through my series. I love writing, and I love filmmaking. It's all I think about. It would be an absolute dream to be able to finally produce "Real Adult," and I truly believe it will become just as important for other people as it is to me.

story:
Writer/producer Nigel Barto had this idea that he would take a bold step in television. He would bring to the screen a story of Caribbean sisters. Inspired by so many women who touched his life, it would be a chance of a lifetime to give voice to different strong Caribbean women. After creating the story, he went on a search to find women who could play beautifully flawed, loving, ambitious, well-to-do sisters. He struck magic in the actresses who bring to life Silvia, Sheila, Sabina, Sonia, and Susi in the half hour TV drama, Beaumont Belles.

Now, not all ideas need funding. But this one does because this story is yours. We want to bring you the best of the Belles later this year, and we need your help. If you would be so kind, we ask that you give what you can because Beaumont Belles is every woman and every person's story.

All donations are used on the show production, and we've got special perks for you under each suggested offer. Thank you!

story:
About "The Conspiracy Theorists"

My name is Stephen Bittrich, the writer/creator of THE CONSPIRACY THEORISTS, and on behalf of myself and my co-executive producer, David Marantz, we'd like to thank you for coming to our Indiegogo campaign!

I am a playwright/screenwriter, and I had been writing a web series for some time when Covid-19 began to appear.  At first I was like, "Well, maybe I can adapt slightly... oh... no... I'm done... and I have to stay home!"

I started writing this new series, inspired by the feeling of uncertainty that seemed to overwhelm everyone as we all were forced into isolation by the pandemic.  Soon there was lots of content being shared that was created on videoconference apps - playreadings and performances and such. Artists connecting on video while staying home. The idea for this series was to create something where the videoconference aspect was part of the conceit... instead of, "We're doing a reading of Hamlet... really suspend your disbelief, okay?" -- this series is “Here’s a show about people who only meet online in a videoconference app."

Why Contribute?

I lived in New York City for 26 years.  (I'm in Austin now.). When Covid-19 hit New York hard, I called my artist buddies in New York, and they were really struggling.  Their work was mostly gone unless they were lucky enough to have some voice over work.  Traditional survival jobs like catering, gone.

I called Dave, who had helped to produce and starred in another webseries I wrote called Off Off.  He was game and ready, and so we were off to the races.

Many of us met through our theater home, The Drilling Company, Hamilton Clancy Artistic Director (and cast member of this show).  I wanted to create something to give us that sense of community that we have in the theater, now lost as we all are sequestered in our homes; a way to gather our talented buddies, create story, entertain people, give them a few laughs, bond with each other in creation, and and lift all our spirits. If we can also collect some donations to help the artists meet basic needs now and in the near future, that would be great, too.

The show is free for anyone who wants to watch it.  We're going to make it no matter what we raise.  But, if you are in a position at this time to help the artists and contribute what we're calling a "tip" for our hard work, we really appreciate it.  We have 13 main cast members (a big cast) and other surprise actors to be added later.

We're doing what is called an In-Demand campaign.  We keep any money raised.  We've set an achievable goal, and if we reach it, we can continue to raise money beyond the end date of the campaign.  We would like to raise MORE than $1500, but we wanted to set a safe goal.

The Artists

We've assembled an amazing cast and crew.  Let's single out a couple of them for now... one of our cast members, Meghan McGeary, performs musically under the name, Amity Rose, and she wrote us an amazing theme song.  I was so happy with the theme song, I asked her if she could write another SURPRISE song for another episode.  What she came up with is my new favorite song.  You are going to be so amazed when it comes out!  I can't say more....

Another of our accomplished actors, Brian Dykstra, has written plays produced around the US, performs Slam Poetry, performed on Broadway with the great Brian Cox, but he may go down in history for his part in one of the Dave Chappelle Show's most famous skits.  Look up "Clayton Bigsby, the World’s Only Black White Supremacist - Chappelle’s Show" on YouTube.  That's Brian at about the 4 minute mark.

Hamilton Clancy does not yet make his entrance in Episode 01, but look for him in Episode 02.  He has done guest starring roles in Orange Is the New Black, Mindhunter, One Dollar, Blue Bloods, among others.

Episode Frequency

We are going to attempt to release and episode each week.  It's a lot of work!!  We will try our best to follow this schedule.  This will a be limited series.  So far just planning 1 season

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there are other ways to help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise on social media about this campaign and this show.
  • Or use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Organize a watch party!

Thank you so much for taking the time to stop by.

Thank you so much for taking the time to stop by.

story:
Hugging America from six feet away.

We're going on tour! We'll be taping our podcast in some of our friends and listeners' driveways all over the country, and on the way, shooting all the footage for our new LIVE FROM [BLANK] web series (this is super exciting!!!).

We (Alison Burns and Lulu Picart) started our podcast in January of 2018, and since then have built a beautiful community. Since we can't tour in theaters this year, we're gonna take our show directly to our listeners. Like, right in their own driveway. With masks on  if they want. And probably lots of sanitizer. 

To make this crazy weird tour happen, we need a little help with the following: 

  • Renting a vehicle (because we want that maintenance package)
  • Renting equipment (we gotta make it look good!)
  • Paying a production manager and tour manager (that's just fair, right?)
  • Hiring a post-production team (if we raise enough money)
  • Food / gas / lodging for the trip (don't worry, we're keeping it cheap)

 

Over the course of three weeks, we're going to record tons of footage highlighting the uniqueness of towns and people across America, we'll visit our listeners and fans, and create a web series that aims to bring all of us together during this intense time. It's a love letter to our supporters and the people and places they love. 

The only challenge we face is surviving three weeks in a vehicle together. But that's on us. 

Can you help? 

Contributing here would mean so much to us and would help us create art and community and connection. But if you can't contribute, please spread the word! Or check out our podcast 10K Dollar Day (or our YouTube channel!) and share it with a friend.

story:
1st & Goal is a new and exciting docu-series highlighting the Georgia Thoroughbreds and their attempt to repeat a state championship. What makes this series so unique isn’t the arguments among parents, coaches or fans but the powerful voices of these youth stars. You will see how these young athletes balance home and school life all while understanding the importance of dedication, dreaming big and striving to obtain those dreams. The series features a host of intriguing characters, but the standout is a young, humble 7-year-old running back and track sprinter named Dashaun Morris II known to his teammates as FLASH and his highly obsessive father Dashaun Morris. Their relationship is sure to have you on the edge of your seat.

This gorilla style production will capture some very intimate moments that will illustrate that children are not too young to dedicate themselves to a sport with benefits of building life skills, camaraderie, discipline, and potentially receiving a free education. Unlike other youth sports series, we will not be highlighting the destruction of youth bodies. Instead, this series will focus on the discipline, techniques and passion for teamwork that are vital for sustainable success.  As a bonus we will be featuring two time NFL Super Bowl champion Brandon Jacobs and his youth football team the North Atlanta Giants. We will capture the journey of the North Atlanta Giants' youth program.  Brandon Jacobs with all his experience as a professional NFL player is using his expertise, time and money to invest in the development and growth of a new generation of athletes. 

 While controversy is what sells today, you will be captivated by the vigorous work ethic and compelling voices of these young athletes instead of being drowned out by loud mouth coaches. While there are some parents featured in this series, this platform belongs to the youth! There's plenty of action coming right at you, like in practice battles over depth chart changes, or in game rivalries between two programs with bad blood, to the famous "Call out game" for bragging rights. There's nothing healthy about watching kids train to deliberately hurt an opposing player, yet there's beauty in witnessing youth play the game with passion, understanding and heart. Georgia is known for its competitive youth football, and this series will highlight two programs and its goal of a state title. With the debate still traveling throughout the country on banning youth football. There's a major joust with those in favor vs those opposing it. There's a demand and responsibility placed on these kids from parents to coaches that some feel is premature. The flip side is the kids received many benefits.  

As with any reality series, remember that a season's worth of practice, games, and personal-time footage is cut down to mere hours of actual screen time designed to accentuate drama as much as possible, so it's safe to believe that not every minute of these kids' lives are x's and o's with constant pressure to win as the show might suggest. 

1st & Goal captures the blood, sweat and tears of young athletes pushing themselves to their limits. Hard work and determination are on full display and it is evident that age is no barrier to success. You will experience firsthand what it takes to truly chase your dreams. You will see the dedication of these young athletes and watch them do what others WON'T so that they can achieve what others CAN'T.

Reality TV today is nothing more than idiocy and grown-ups acting like children. Rarely do we see reality TV that leaves families with productive healthy conversation long after the show has ended. This in your face project will introduce you to characters with substance such as community activist and former athlete Dashaun Jiwe Morris and his young athletic hard-working son Dashaun Jiwe Morris II. You will see how Dashaun has dedicated his life to training his son, while using his life's testimony as a blue print to steer his son down the right path.

The making of a Docu-Series can be expensive, there are many costs involved with doing a project legit such as:

  • Production equipment
  • Post-production personnel
  • Travel
  • Legal paper work
  • Insurance
  • Lawyer fees
  • Distribution

We need $62,000 dollars to make the 1st & Goal Docu-Series. The funds will guarantee a quality product. We appreciate all contributions because we know from experience that every dollar counts. 

We appreciate all contributions because we know from experience that every dollar counts. We have some very unique rewards when you make a financial pledge.  

  • You could get to be the proud owner of the helmet worn by a star player.  
  • How about winning the raffle to have yourself and your child featured in the FIRST AND GOAL series? Your child gets to train and play alongside the THOROUGHBREDS. And one lucky child will get to be Captain and toss the coin. 
  • We also have an amazing pledge for entrepreneurs to have their brand featured throughout the entire series, now that’s a lot of exposure. 

 

So go ahead, make your financial pledge, FIRST AND GOAL needs you.

PLEASE LIKE & SHARE

 

BRANDON JACOBS ▪  Producer

Brandon Christopher Jacobs is a former American football running back, who spent the majority of his career with the New York Giants of the National Football League (NFL). He was drafted by the Giants in the fourth round of the 2005 NFL Draft. He won two Super Bowl rings with the Giants, both against the New England Patriots. He also played one season for the San Francisco 49ers before returning to New York for his final season. He played college football at Coffeyville, Auburn, and Southern Illinois.

Jacobs was larger and heavier than most NFL running backs, standing 6'4" tall and weighing over 264 pounds. He also runs the 100 meters in 10.82 seconds and the 200 meters in 21.59 seconds. He won two Super Bowls in seven seasons with the New York Giants, and holds the franchise record for most career rushing touchdowns.

 

DIEMIRUAYE DENIRAN ▪ Screenwriter/Director/Producer

Diemiruaye was born and raised in South London, England of Nigerian parentage.  He now resides in New York City, where he has lived since 1996.  He is an experienced entertainer, writer and film Director/producer. He is self-taught in nearly all aspects of his craft as an entertainer and filmmaker.  In addition to countless musical projects as a solo artist and featured in collaborative groups, he has written and produced several independent film projects, such as the web series Sexamacation, the movie Kuwsh, the short film, The Transaction, the sci-fi thriller Soul Remover, Reserve Notes and the award winning feature The Diary of a Badman.

Actors and crew that have worked with him on the set have purported him as being "demanding, yet extremely effective".  Like any great director, those that have had the pleasure of working with him express his uncanny abilities to bring out the best in his talent as well as depict a masterful interpretation of what he captures on his cameras. His integrity and work ethic are only outmatched by his creativity, which has been evident since his earliest works when he was just beginning in the entertainment and film industries.  One of his ultimate goals as a film producer is to provide a profitable business model for independent professionals to take advantage of without the risk of being exploited or undervalued.

 

DASHAUN JIWE MORRIS ▪ Actor/Writer/Activist/Producer

Dashaun Jiwe Morris is a Newark New Jersey native. Growing up heavily involved in football he was awarded a scholarship to play division 1AA football at Delaware State University. While there he accumulated national honors becoming 1st team black college all American 1st team associated press all American & 1st team sports network all American while leading the entire nation in kick off returns for touchdowns. 

Dashaun became a fan of filming short films in 2007, where he developed a love for film. Using this new platform, Dashaun published his first memoir, War Of The Bloods In My Veins by Simon & Schuster, followed by the sequel Don't Let My Tears Fool You: The War Is On. Furthering his film career, he has been featured in numerous documentaries including the Sundance Emmy nominated 2 season series titled Brick City, TvOne Save My Son, PBS Out Of The Shadows, Own Network From Fatherless To Fatherhood and most recently Spike TV docu series called Time: The Kalief Browder story. 

Dashaun has used all his experiences of growing up in Newark as a platform to inspire youth around the world to fight for their lives regardless of the environment many of them are forced to live in. While traveling country to country, state to state, juvenile facility to facility, prison to prison, Dashaun's raw uncut in your face message about change and the difficulty that comes with it is nothing short of breathtaking as he highlights his life from a brutal violent 1st person account. It is there that he captures the youth. Having been through what most would consider "Hell", he has found a way to transition from the life he once led to today being an active hands on father, mentor and trainer. 

Moving to Atlanta was his first step to giving his children a new start. One that wouldn't be preceded within neighborhood stories their father once orchestrated. He has very athletic children and is in pursuit of getting them to division 1 universities with full scholarships.

story:
"Cady Did" is an original series starring triple threat Tony Award winner, Cady Huffman. 

Her undeniable talent earned her a Tony Award for Broadway's smash hit The Producers.

Cady as Ulla in The Producers

The new comedy series features Cady playing a fictionalized version of herself...much as she did on a little show called "Curb Your Enthusiasm".

Cady with Larry David on "Curb Your Enthusiasm"

With no options left in the big city, Tony Award winner Cady Huffman is forced to slink back to her small hometown after an embarrassing audition video goes viral.  Humiliated and broke, she finds herself running a local access TV station. As her past and present collide hilariously, Cady is forced to either grow up or give up. Much to her dismay, she’s never been a quitter.

"Cady Did" is created/written by Jason Cicci, who created "He's With Me", the award-winning series which earned Cady an Indie Series Award for Best Comedic Guest Actress.

Cady with her ISA

Featuring a guest cast of hilarious and notable talents from stage and screen, "Cady Did" is about meeting the challenges of aging in show business and the struggle to finally grow up and move on.

Your contributions will make shooting the show possible.  From salaries to locations to equipment, every penny will be used to make sure "Cady Did" is top notch.

Thank you for being part of our journey.  We look forward to sharing "Cady Did" with you!

story:
A Brief History of The Pogo Adventure

Pogoers have always connected through the internet. What began as a tiny collective of enthusiastic 'pogo kids' around the U.S. has expanded into a global extreme sport who's participants are largely limited to online interaction. Anyone who has experienced sports culture can understand that its followers are at their best when in the presence of one another - thus we have the Pogo Adventure. 

The Pogo Adventure was born in 2009 when two top tier pogoers (Nick & Fred) set off on an improvised road trip across America - their one goal; visit as many pogoers as possible and create a video series to share with the world.

Since that initial trip, The Pogo Adventure series has had five seasons all available online for free. Pogoing has also grown a great deal since that first trip, people are bouncing higher and doing crazier tricks than we could have ever imagined possible. So we're hitting the road again to capture the finest pogo action to ever go down, and share it all with you. 

The 2018 Route

This time around we're taking on the East Coast. The whole thing, Maine to Florida.

We'll start our journey with a bang on May 25th in Philadelphia at the East Coast Pogo Meet, an invite-only street pogo competition that's sure to lead to some incredible pogoing. From there we'll be stopping in more major cities than ever on this route - that means bigger and better spots for street pogoing, jumping ledges, stair sets, and re-imagining the urban land scape. Between stops in the cities we'll be camping every night, taking in the fresh air and getting creative with whatever we can find to pogo on. Finally we'll make it to Key West, to pogo at the southernmost point in the United States.  

The Team

We've put together a team of a some of the most talented people to ever step foot on a pogo stick. This crew is not only at the cutting edge of the sport, but also well versed in video production with dozens of successful pogo video projects shot everywhere from Paris, to Hong Kong, Brazil, to Barcelona. 

Nick McClintock - Film maker and pogo veteran, the guy behind the previous Pogo Adventure edits

Dalton Smith - Reigning three time world champ and wizard with a camera.

Nic Patino - Killing it with the biggest street riding today and the man behind ECPM

Tone Staubs - Pogo Adventure veteran, king of grinds and cheesecakes 

Michael Mena - The world's highest front flipper and the O'est of the G's 

Henry Cabelus - A ball of energy ready to be unleashed any where + any time

Harry White - Canadian homie who will try anything for the hype

Tyler Phillips - Raw talent. Always flying high in the sky

Michael Brookhart - Xpogo intern with a cinematic eye. All around groovy pogo guy. 

Mystery Guests - We plan to meet up with as many pogoers as we can along the way!

Why We Need Your Help!

We need your help funding the travel costs of this adventure.

We'll be keeping costs as low as possible by camping every night we can and relying on a support network of fellow pogoers, but to get our crew the whole way down the coast we'll need to pay for some basic costs of being on the road.

  • Getting a large van back on the road and ready for the trip. 
  • We need to fuel three vehicles 
  • Pay for oil changes & emergency maintenance
  • Two or three nights in a hotel (for much needed warm showers)

We truly appreciate your support! Please take a second to check out the awesome perks you can claim when you donate (Including early access to all finished episodes for every donor!) Every little bit helps. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, wherever you can! Keep the pogo hype alive!

story:
NETFL!X AND KILL is getting ready for a new season… You probably didn’t think it was possible to make a fun show about a psychopath and his victim watching television. Well, we did it —and because so many of you watched it, we thought we’d give you more! Season Two will follow the same premise: one psychopath, one victim, and a murder that is only waiting to happen! The only thing standing in the way… is you helping us get there. (And Netflix suing us, which hasn’t happened yet!)

Writer-director Kate Shenton (Screen International Rising Star Nominee) is not just bringing back to Season Two her love of very British comedy, but also the same creative team: producer Baptiste Charles, and stars Nic Lamont and Adam Rhys-Davies. They have to come back, otherwise she will kill them… literally.

Haven’t seen Season One yet? Have a watch of our hit here, courtesy of Hex Media.

 

We know what you’re thinking: how the hell we’re going to make Season Two after that climax?! Simple: Nic Lamont will play the psychopath and Adam Rhys-Davies will play the victim. Season Two will take place in the same world, with different but equally nutty characters, straight from Kate Shenton’s really twisted mind.


Starring Nic Lamont and Adam Rhys-Davies (The Twins Macabre) and written and directed by Kate Shenton. The team also includes: producer Baptiste Charles, Director of Photography Sashi Kissoon, editor Xanna Ward Dixon, sound designer James Hyde, composer Harvey Robinson.

The main challenge will be to deliver an even better Season Two of NETFL!X AND KILL. Reception for Season One has been incredible, and we want you to keep enjoying the ride through this nutty world of psychopaths binge watching television through seasons three, four etc…

Also there is a slight risk that this shoot may turn us into actual psychopaths. If you hear anything fishy on the news, it wasn’t us. Promise.

Have a look at some of the perks you will get by supporting our campaign!

Support us!

The reception to Season One was so extraordinary that we can't wait to bring you more from the universe of NETFL!X AND KILL. We want to give you an even better Season Two and the entire team is incredibly grateful for your support of our project!

story:
Marissa Herrera is a Latina Creative Visionary dedicated to sharing the American Latino Story for TV/Film and Stage and is the Creator and Executive Producer for "Two Feet In." Named by Ford Motors as a 2016 "Latina on The Move," Marissa is a force to be reckon with. She is a member of the National Hispanic Media Action Committee and The National Association of Latino Independent Producers and as also the Co-Founder and Artistic Director of 4C LAB, an Arts non-profit organization in Los Angeles. 

 
 

 

We need your help!

We have 2 1/2 days of shooting to complete and post-production and we can't do it without you! Your contributions will go directly to covering equipment costs, production for both days, paying actors and finishing post production for a high quality incredible pilot episode of "Two Feet In."

 

As a leader in the Creative Latino community, I have committed to paving the path to open doors, knock down walls and shatter ceilings to increase diverse representation in front of and behind the camera, but I can't do it alone. It will take all of us to create real change. 

 

We are SO close!!! Your contribution will manifest an idea into reality and support an artist and project who isn't just talking the talk but is walking the walk and is creating the solution. 

 

Thank you for your support! You make a difference! 

Adelante!!!

We need your help!
We have 2 1/2 days of shooting to complete and post-production and we can't do it without you! Your contributions will go directly to covering equipment costs, production for both days, paying actors and finishing post production for a high quality incredible pilot episode of "Two Feet In."
 

As a leader in the Creative Latino community, I have committed to paving the path to open doors, knock down walls and shatter ceilings to increase diverse representation in front of and behind the camera, but I can't do it alone. It will take all of us to create real change. 
 
We are SO close!!! Your contribution will manifest an idea into reality and support an artist and project who isn't just talking the talk but is walking the walk and is creating the solution. 
 
Thank you for your support! You make a difference! 
Adelante!!!

story:
Let's have a chin-wag (a chat)... 

Like a strong cup of tea, this project has been brewing for a while.

After moving from London to Los Angeles in 2010, I realized just how British I was. It's only until you leave your home do you realize who and what your comedy influences are. Basil Fawlty, French & Saunders, Rik Mayell, Ricky Gervais, and Blackadder have all in their own way contributed to my sense of humo(u)r. Over the last few years, I went back to these roots and started to create a lot of characters from the UK, either with the Groundlings Sunday Company, or with close friends on sketch projects. It was during this weird and wonderful period of exploration that I created a blunt northern lass from England (Trudy Perkins). What better way to get her mingling with her neighbors than to throw her into the real estate market! It seemed like a beautiful combination; this bizarre, idiot, busy-body, trying to sell homes to her newly acquired community in Los Angeles. I am a huge fan of good ol' fashioned English farce, and I love a healthy dose of wit. I aim to squish both of these sensibilities together like a well-baked Jammy Dodger (cookie). 

I plan to pitch this project to networks, and submit it to festivals as a Comedy Short. AND if I can make something that creates more jobs and opportunities for all of the talented people involved, then... it would be, quite simply, marvellous!  

I am so lucky to have a community of highly skilled friends and colleagues who are willing to give their time for free to make this project happen, and it would be wonderful to be able to pay them. 

It is my hope that this campaign will...

  • Go towards paying the wonderful cast and crew!
  • Provide fabulous equipment that the fabulous crew can operate!
  • Supply food and water for basic survival during shoot days. 
  • Pay for Insurance, so we're all safe and wot-not.
  • Post-production and festival submission costs! 

Thank you for taking the time to read this! If you are unable to give a monetary donation, I completely understand. Please consider forwarding it to someone you know who is excited to see more female-driven, character-centered, farcical TV shows on our screens!

THANK YOU!

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT
Clarence X. Wilburson was once a young air-guitarist with a booming career in an “air-rock-n’-roll” band who dreamed of fame and fortune. But when fame and fortune found him, he found fast-food and quickly became hooked! His serious addiction plummeted him into a dark spiral and lost him his entire career. Now, years later, Clarence wants to give the music industry another shot with the help of his wanna-be rapper cousin, Dante Wess.

Written, Directed and Created by Justin Feinman, this mocu-series gives a fresh spin on the harsh realities of the music industry. With a Side of Fries encapsulates the balance of comedic humor in everyday life. We have written a 6 episode Season 1 with a pilot ready to air at a moment's notice. Each episode ranges from 10 - 15 minutes in length.

We hope to continue creating With A Side Of Fries for many seasons to come. In order to do so, we need your help!

 

HOW MUCH ARE WE RAISING?
We’re seeking $2,500  for this hilarious, harsh and heartwarming mocu-series! 
We want to get this story out there, and in order to do so that means festival fees, post-production costs, and of course marketing. All of which burns holes in our shallow pockets

We want to share With A Side Of Fries with the world and we will do everything in our power to do so but we can’t do it without you! Anything you can donate is greatly appreciated!

story:
The Telethon Show: A Summary

Hello there, we're Cool Kid Comedy. And for the past seven years we've been performing around New York City, releasing sketch videos, and one of us even had a baby. But now we're doing something a little different.

We're producing a full length pilot and need your help to fund it. The show is called The Telethon Show, and is about a telethon that exists solely to raise money for the following week's episode of that very same show. It's a weird and hopefully humorous look at the classic Jerry Lewis style telethon, and it contains a mix of new and old Cool Kid Comedy sketches throughout.

We've been working on this project for over a year but there's still tons to be done, and that's where we could use your help. From production costs to festival entry fees, this whole project has been a slight drain on our personal bank accounts, which is why we hope that you can find it in your hearts to donate whatever amount you're able. Your donations will go towards offsetting everything from equipment rentals to craft services to jars of food for the aforementioned baby.

We sincerely thank you in advance for donating anything you can, and promise you that we're working hard to turn this show into something bigger. Whether that means making it a recurring web series, airing it on television, or a mystery third option that even we don't know yet, we hope that we can produce many more episodes of The Telethon Show down the line to entertain you.

 

What We Need And Where It's Going

Our goal in this campaign is to raise $4,000. Your donations will help us to recoup our costs for renting equipment, paying crew, purchasing craft services, hiring editors, hiring talent, set decoration, purchasing props, and everything production-related under the sun.

In addition, our plan is to submit this project to countless festivals throughout the country, and your generous contributions will go towards our entry fees for those.

 

Perks

We don't just want your money, but we want to give you things too as an additional thank you! By donating to this campaign, you can receive the following:

  • $5 - An obligatory generic thank you
  • $10 - A personal heartfelt thank you
  • $20 - A digital copy of the pilot
  • $50 - A random headshot signed by Cool Kid Comedy
  • $100 - A special thank you in the show's credits
  • $500 - An executive producer credit plus one additional activity, chosen from one of the following:
    • A home-cooked meal from Chris Blakeman
    • 2 Yankees tickets from Ben Kleinman
    • A private Irish step dance lesson from Cian Smith
  • $1000 - Go bowling with Cool Kid Comedy
  • $4000 - Cool Kid Comedy will throw you a birthday party

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate we totally understand, but please consider spreading the word to those you know who may enjoy our work and be able to contribute. Whether you're a member of our family, one of our friends, or a Cool Kid Comedy stalker, we thank you for your support over the years and hope this project makes you laugh.

Thank you for everything,

Cool Kid Comedy

story:
Inspiration

I’m proud to be Haitian-American. Ever since I moved to LA from Florida I appreciate my family more and the things I took for granted.

In the entertainment industry appearance is everything. You have to know the right people and know how to package yourself.  You’ve got to look like somebody so that somebody might give you a chance. When you're not careful you can get lost in it. I find myself reflecting on my time at home because there’s comfort in remembering where I come from. When I remember what my grandparents and parents have overcome it serves as a reminder that I can make it on my own terms.

When I meet other Haitians in LA it’s a celebration in my heart. Four years ago, at the LA Film Festival, I met two Haitian-American artists and in that moment I got the idea for the web series. At the time I didn’t know exactly what it would be but I knew that I wanted to capture the resiliency and strength of our people.

Like the characters in the show I’m going to tap into what I have to make a mark.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is the breakdown of our post-production needs:

  • Editing & Sound Design - 43%
  • Motion Graphics - 18%
  • Artwork - 11%
  • Music - 18%
  • Platform Fees - 10%

There are awesome perks to choose from if you decide to donate.

Challenges

Production, especially on a super low-budget, presents many challenges. There's never enough time or money. However, I work with a strong team and they've helped to make Haitians in LA a reality. Ultimately, I want to rise with the people I work with because we need each other to make it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Beds: A web series

What if a web series only took place in the bedroom? And what if we got to see a unique variety of relationships in it? Sure, romantic ones, but also familial dynamics and individual experiences?

Beds is here to deliver just that. From swanky studios to Airbnbs to childhood rooms revisited, Beds focuses on stripping away the outside world to reveal an honest, endearing and often funny look at what happens inside our most vulnerable spaces.

Each episode of Beds exists as an independent vignette intent on exploring the stories and characters we aren't likely to catch on primetime TV.

My name is Kirsten Shu-ying Chen and I'm the writer and creator of this series. And with the help of a fantastic team of creators - and hopefully you, dear contributor - I'm hoping to make something beautiful. Will you help us?

What We're Asking For & Why

Our fundraising goal is $12,500. Here's where the money will go:

  • Paying cast & crew 
  • Renting and securing locations
  • Renting gear & equipment
  • Making the show look and sound beautiful (think tech, music, props, costume etc.)
  • A VIEWING PARTY! And hopefully you'll be there.
  • Also, if we pull in at our target or higher, we may be able to film more than the four episodes we currently have planned.

The Impact

Ultimately the purpose of Beds is to serve up great entertainment by exploring the unique people, relationships and stories we aren't accustomed to seeing on TV.

By contributing to our fundraiser,  you will be:

  • A patron of the arts!
  • Directly  supporting female-written, female-created and female-directed content
  • Backing diverse representation on screen
  • Contributing to meaningful storytelling

Our Team

Kirsten Shu-ying Chen: Writer, Creator, Executive Producer

Ellpetha Tsivicos: Director

Jon Edwards: Director of Photography

Camilo Quiroz-Vazquez: Editor

Kay Sorin: Line Producer

 

Produced by Tangent Pursuit & One Whale's Tale

story:
Short Summary

Christian Frazier is a military veteran turned actor,comedian, producer that has been in the entertainment industry for 2 decades. He has worked on NBC, CBS, FOX, Netflix, USA, HBO, Amazon Prime, MTV and over numerous films and television commercials. He has been on the cover of the NY Post and various magazines and newspapers.  He has a built in audience and 30K loyal followers across all his social media platforms and grown. 

www.christianfrazier.com 

  • Television and film is changing because of the pandemic and I wanted to create content that did not require alot of characters but could give you an entertaining story. 
  • Create more content and stories that haven't been told is what I am passionate about. 
  • Raising these funds will help with expenses for additional camera, equipment needed, post production editing software, editor, stunt coordinator, wardrobe, make up and marketing budget. 
  • I am also investing in building a Roku Channel to give this and future content additional distribution to give viewers to watch content on their smart TV's 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Total Goal is $2000 
  • $250 or more will get an executive producer credit in the project and included on IMDB/Copy on DVD / Autographed Movie Poster / Business Ad Placement in Credits
  • $100 - $249 Donation will receive an Autographed Movie Poster / DVD 
  • $50 - $99 Donation will receive a DVD 
  • $5 - $49 Acknowledgement on Social Media/Indiegogo

 

Thank you in advance for supporting this series from the depths of my heart !!!

story:
We are Coleman Films, the two brothers and amazing film crew that brought
you "Halloween Inferno" and "Inferno Part II".  Our love for film making
started at a very young age watching the original John Carpenter’s Halloween.
In a way, that movie started our careers because the first couple of movies
we made at the ages of 11 and 12 were our own versions of Halloween. We
filmed them in the backyard, the basement, wherever we could, but they
definitely were not very good.

As the years went on, we began making our own original horror films. Fast
forwarding to today, we have worked on and produced multiple movies including
distributed works such as “We are Still Here” and “Book of Evil”. We now
own a production company that has been very successful in Rochester, New
York.

  

 

The reason we decided to start crowdfunding for part 3 is because of how
well "Halloween Inferno" was received by the fans. We wanted to make a Part
2 that was even better than the first one to bring the fans of Halloween
(much like ourselves) what they want. Parts 1 and 2 were financed out of
our own pockets and as much as we would love to make a Part 3, production
costs are very expensive and to do it right we need *your help*.

Our goal is to raise enough to cover the basic costs of making a film the
fans want to see. It has always been our dream to work on a Halloween film set
and we want to make something so good that Hollywood will have no choice but
to get us involved in the next one.

See "Halloween Inferno" (part 1) here:

See "Halloween Inferno" (part 2) here:

 

Why Raise Funding?

We are looking to raise $20,000 to fund this 15-20 minute project. The team
came up with this number after adding up the expenses from the first two
installments that were done out of pocket.

The films were both filmed on industry standard cinema cameras, lenses and
lighting equipment all rented from local production companies. For us to
maintain the quality of the inferno series rentals are a must have.

This money will also go to paying and feeding our extensive cast and
crew for their hard work and dedication. Locations will be a big part of
the budget as we needed to rent multiple locations for several days
for each film. Your contributions will go a long way in pushing production
forward.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The positive feedback from the fans of our first installment of Halloween
Inferno is what inspired us to keep going with the story. We are all fans
working on this project and it is such an amazing feeling to see the
reaction to what we created. We want to keep going, so if you like what we
have made, feel free to share it with your friends and people you know.
Spreading the word is an amazing way to help us out on this project and
future ones as well.

 

Big Productions

Enjoy some Behind the Scenes pictures below that will show you the amount of work that goes into productions like Halloween Inferno Parts I & II....

story:
The Brothers – A Quick Overview 

 

When the father of the largest drug empire in Orlando, Florida is murdered, his sons take over the family business.  Feeling unprepared by the harsh responsibilities and realities of running a drug empire and working with family, The Brothers struggle with the millions of details necessary to stay in business and away from the cops while running their newly founded empire.

 

Meet the Team: 

 

Director, Writer, and Executive Producer:  Brandon J. Rivers

 

Brandon is a graduate of FIRST – Florida Institute of Recording, Sound and Technology and owner of RiverFlow Productions.  He also plays Roberto King in The Brothers TV Series. Brandon is excited to have the opportunity to produce and share his storytelling skills in Orlando, his home town.  Whenever you see Brandon, he either has a camera in-hand or he is writing!  Writing is like therapy for Brandon.  Once he starts, he is immersed in story and can write an entire scene in minutes.  

Assistant Director & Music Coordinator:  Juan Vega 

 

The talented Juan Vega is our Assistant Director and also plays the character of Arturo De Jesus in The Brothers TV Series. Juan graduated from the Florida Institute of Recording, Sound, and Technology and joined RiverFlow Productions last year.

 

Director of Photography:  Maverick Montgomery

 

Maverick brings his photographic creativity and professionalism like no one else!  Laughing or crying, he brings out the best in the character.  Maverick graduated from the FIRST institute as well. 

 

Directors of Editing, Sound, & Lighting:  Brandon J. Rivers, Juan Vega, & Maverick Montgomery 

 

They work tirelessly to keep you coming back for more of The Brothers!  They love every minute of it.  

 

Experience the Characters

 

Chrystopher Avant plays D’Angelo King

 

D’Angelo King:  The youngest King brother.  D’Angelo finds himself in charge of the family business after his father is murdered during his biggest score.  While trying to understand the underground world, he has to face tough decisions that he is not ready to make.  With his life on the line, the young business man must find a balance between power and reality.  

 

D’Vante Rayne plays Nikko King

Nikko King: The middle brother of the King brothers. After leaving the game, to become a family man and a respected accountant, he is faced with the reality that his father has been murdered. When his little brother is left in charge of the family business he hesitantly steps in to help. While fighting between raising his family and helping his brother not make mistakes that can get him killed he begins to understand why, he left this life behind.

 

DeVon Rodgers plays Carter King

Carter King:  The oldest King brother.  While serving as the families’ eyes and ears as a undercover cop to avoid law enforcement groups, he grapples with living the street life.  Coming from a dark past, Carter makes irrational decisions.  After his father is killed, he is left to watch his little brother D’Angelo to take over the business and envies him.

 

Brandon J. Rivers plays Roberto King

Roberto King:  Father of the King brothers & Leader of the Cocaine world in Central Florida.  While trying to be a successful and clean business man to the public eye, he wants to leave his underground life.  Leaving secrets and his business at the brink of collapse, he is mourned by his family that must get his affairs in order.  Because he has three sons that can take over the business, he wants to score big ONE.LAST.TIME.  Tragedy strikes.  Roberto King dies.  

 

Chevelle Hallback plays Deana Santos

Deana Santos:  Member of a rival gang.  Deana finds herself involved with the King brothers.  While trying to understand her past, Deana is left with unanswered questions after realizing her mother is hiding the truth.  

 

Carlos Valentino plays Eddie Diaz

Eddie Dias:  Roberto’s right-hand man & D’Angelo’s Godfather.  He’s been in the business since day one with Roberto.  With Roberto’s sudden death, he must teach the young D’Angelo how to run his fathers’ empire.  With a firm hand, he takes D’Angelo under his wing.  He shows him how to maintain power while outsmarting the rival gangs who may want the throne. 

 

Travis Chase Plays Flake

Flake: Flake is the right hand man to D'Angelo. he makes sure that all business is handled so D'Angelo doesn't have to get his hands dirty. If a problem arises he handles the situation immediately. 

 

Dennis Mallen plays Detective Harris

Detective Harris: Detective Harris is a short tempered and serious law enforcer that doesn’t play well with others. After his CI is killed he is quick to go to the streets to figure out what happened but in a series of events finds himself involved with the King brother’s case. The smart detective starts to unravel some of the mysteries surrounding the King case while investigating his CI’s death and dealing with his personal life.

Meet the Cast:  

 

Chrystopher Avant - Actor known for Survivor (2018)

 

D’Vante Rayne – Actor known for Triggered (2019), Runt (2017), and Dream Weaver Chronicles (2016)

 

DeVon Rodgers – Actor known for Blade of the Day Walker (2018)

 

Brandon J. Rivers – Director and writer known for Survivor (2018)

 

Chevelle Hallback – Actress making her debut in The Brothers (2019)

 

Carlos Valentino – Carlos Valentino is an American actor and professional recording artist of Puerto Rican decent.  He bilingual and is well-regarded for his menacing, bad ass and charismatic on-screen presence.  Carlos is known for films ranging from independent projects to major Hollywood productions.  He performed in theater productions and TV commercials as well.  

 

How you can help!

 

We are requesting $50,000 to cover production and marketing costs.  Initially, all the funds will go to production for equipment, props, food and fees.  After production of 10 episodes, we hope we are thrifty enough to have at least 6% leftover for our marketing budget.  Of course we would like to be all over Netflix, Amazon Prime, and Vimeo!  Hello Mr. Bezos…pick The Brothers!  

 

We have some fun rewards that will help us with production and give you some perks!  Wait until you see some of the perks – early birds, sneak peeks, director credit, and the list goes on! Pick your favorite – we hope you pick one where we get to meet you!  

 

Cannot donate at this time?  No worries.  Please share this with everyone.  Share this with everyone on every social channel. 

The Brothers thank you.
story_txt: The Brothers – A Quick Overview  When the father of the largest drug empire in Orlando, Florida is murdered, his sons take over the family business.  Feeling unprepared by the harsh responsibilities and realities of running a drug empire and working with family, The Brothers struggle with the millions of details necessary to stay in business and away from the cops while running their newly founded empire. Meet the Team:  Director, Writer, and Executive Producer:  Brandon J. Rivers Brandon is a graduate of FIRST – Florida Institute of Recording, Sound and Technology and owner of RiverFlow Productions.  He also plays Roberto King in The Brothers TV Series. Brandon is excited to have the opportunity to produce and share his storytelling skills in Orlando, his home town.  Whenever you see Brandon, he either has a camera in-hand or he is writing!  Writing is like therapy for Brandon.  Once he starts, he is immersed in story and can write an entire scene in minutes.  Assistant Director & Music Coordinator:  Juan Vega  The talented Juan Vega is our Assistant Director and also plays the character of Arturo De Jesus in The Brothers TV Series. Juan graduated from the Florida Institute of Recording, Sound, and Technology and joined RiverFlow Productions last year. Director of Photography:  Maverick Montgomery Maverick brings his photographic creativity and professionalism like no one else!  Laughing or crying, he brings out the best in the character.  Maverick graduated from the FIRST institute as well.  Directors of Editing, Sound, & Lighting:  Brandon J. story:
Echo 

Created, and produced by Zenith & Julieth, both of us are fresh to Los Angeles. We both bring an incredible amount of expertise from our respective homelands & cultures. In case you don't know us, Zenith Ander is an Australian actor & writer, and Julieth Restrepo is a Colombian actor.

The beginning of our story introduces you to two women from different backgrounds (and with different accents), who find themselves with more in common than is comfortable. Sound like a crazy idea?! It isn't. We are however breaking moulds long held by Hollywood by taking women from diverse backgrounds and placing them in the same situation. As foreigners in a new land, we want to tell our unique perspectives through a common eye. We've all been in love, and we've all been hurt. Echo is a story that showcases two compelling, genuine and capable female characters experiencing life through each others' eyes. Expect laughs & tears and an overwhelming amount of love.

We want you to be a part of their journey. By contributing to this campaign, you are helping set a precedent for future filmmakers from all over the world. Together we can encourage bravery and boldness in storytellers everywhere!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $12,500. Every penny goes to paying our entire cast and crew fairly, keeping them safe, feeding and transporting them. Location costs, insurance costs, equipment costs - Filmmaking is EXPENSIVE. Rest assured that every cent contributed to Echo goes toward creating a safe, fair and fun environment for all involved, with the result of a cool show for you to binge watch at the end! (This largely comes down to our editor. Help us hire one!)

Don't forget to check out the perks you will receive for your contribution! Each amount gets you something cool and different. We are so excited to have you be a part of our campaign that we want you to have a memento - Receive a signed script, signed photo or even a one-on-one Spanish or English class!

While we really REALLY hope to hit our target before the end of this campaign, we will make Echo regardless. Our crew may be fed only tomatoes and basil that grows on Zenith's deck for the entire weeks shoot. Some may have to hitch a ride to DTLA in the back of a UPS truck hauling lighting gear. Many will dehydrate in Los Angeles' perpetual desert heat... The truth is that we desperately don't want to subject our precious people to anything less than a safe and fair set! You & your contribution really does mean the world to us and to everyone involved!

Our Team

ZENITH ANDER (Writer, actress & Producer)

Zenith Ander attended the Melbourne Rudolf Steiner School in Melbourne's outer eastern suburbs and William Bates Academy of Performing Arts. Here she studied acting, voice and oddly, fencing. Before graduation, she quickly landed roles in theatre and television, starting in Cartoon Creations' (Fat Cat & Humphrey B. Bear) on-going children's theatre series for many years, guest roles in 'Blue Heelers', 'Neighbours' and 'Blonde'. She relocated to Sydney in 2011 and began working behind the camera on both television & international films. Zenith ran a team of up to 50 on films such as 'Mad Max, Fury Road', 'The Water Diviner' and TV shows such as 'Modern Family' and 'Love Child'. She then moved to Los Angeles in 2016 after this work, hereby expanding her professional network in the USA and arrived to focus solely on acting. She quickly landed roles on cable television, and has created her own online content. She is a BAFTA Los Angeles member and attends the Beverly Hills Playhouse. She is also a member of Australians in Film. Zenith is an international member of Scottish Screenwriters. 

 

JULIETH RESTREPO (Actress & Producer)

Colombian actress and producer. She’s been working in the industry for more than 14 years. Throughout her career as an actress she has received 3 awards by the Academy of cinematography in Colombia and 4 awards by her work in the Television Shows. After her successful career in Colombia, she moved to LA in 2015. She has worked in films as Al Final del Espectro, Broken Kingdom, La Semilla del Silencio, Estrella del sur, Malcriados, Mamá, Moria, Doble (coming out in October of 2018 in Colombia), Do Not Lose, and  Loving Pablo with Javier Bardem, Penelope Cruz and Peter Sarsgaard, (currently in theaters in Europe and coming out in the United States in October of  2018.) She has produced two short films that’ve been participating in festivals around the world, and she is currently writing and producing the film Pedazos de mi with Felipe Martinez Amador and producing and co-writing with Celina Martinez the TV show La Muñe.

 

SARA MILLAN (Production Designer)

Colombian Production Designer currently based in Los Angeles with over ten years of experience who has worked in some of the most influential films in Colombian cinema. During her career, Sara has worked with renowned filmmakers such as Neil Marshall, Brad Furman, Bret Easton Ellis, Lea Thompson, Alejandro Brugués among others.

She won a Macondo award for best Art Direction for the film Greetings to the Devil and A Colombian National Award for best Art Direction for the film At the End of the Spectra.

 

SEBASTIAN ZULETA  (Composer & Producer)

Emmy Award Nominee. Sebastian was born and raised in Colombia. He's been living in Los Angeles for the last 10 years and has collaborated with several composers including Hans Zimmer, Heitor Pereira  and Toby Chu. He has worked as a music editor on TV shows and films such as Fifty Shades Freed, Despicable Me and Next Gen. Also, has written the music for films like Cora, Letter, Project Fydika, and many others. Recently, he was nominated for an EMMY for his work on the HBO documentary Cries from Syria.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean that you can't help -

Please help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign:

  • Follow us on Instagram! @seriestba
  • Follow us on Facebook! 
  • Share our campaign on your social media!
  • Visit our website! www.echotheseries.com 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We are so excited to have you on this journey with us. Stay up to date and like, follow and share our updates.

 

ECHO LA SERIE

Un cálido y masivo agradecimiento a todos los que contribuyeron a esta campaña! Julieth Restrepo se retiró del proyecto una semana y media antes de filmar, dejando de lado al co-creador Zenith Ander y a todo el equipo de la serie en modo de preproducción. El propósito original a través de este proyecto era derribar barreras y percepciones limitadas en la realización de películas diversas y dirigidas por mujeres. Esta intención aún está por realizarse, y actualmente se está volviendo a jigging y en el proceso de unirse.

Lots of love and gratitude from all of us at Echo the Series!

story:
What is 'CHARACTERISTICALLY'? 

Characteristically is a non-narrative web series (written by Dominique Salerno) that showcases the hilarious and  humiliating  realities of life as a character actor. What is a "character actor" you may ask?  In the broadest terms: we are the misfits of the entertainment industry. We are the Sassy Best Friends, the Jovial Shopkeepers, and the Bridge Troll #4s. We are the unsung heroes buried deep within the lead's narrative. In classic tragedies, we usually die early. But now, in this web-series, it's our time to shine!!  Each episode features a character actor struggling to survive.  Characteristically's ridiculous vignettes are packed with humor and humanity, and these short scenes flesh out the often overlooked world of the quirky supporting actors. 

Why should I support 'CHARACTERISTICALLY'?

If you care about empowering artists to make their own work, then Characteristically is a fantastic opportunity for you to be a driving force in artistic creation.  Your support will directly help us (the struggling artists) actualize a creative vision. As a quirky character actor myself, I (Dominique) don't have the luxury of sitting around waiting for the phone to ring in order to make my art. Much like the characters in my series, I have to hustle to make it happen. 

For those of you who don't know me, I recently wrote and produced "The Box Show," a one-woman show where I performed 30 characters inside of a small cupboard. (Yes, I know how ridiculous that sounds... and yes I parody the sh*t out of myself in this Characteristically series!) Through my dedication and hard work, "The Box Show" received critical acclaim, won many awards, and toured for two years at different theatres across the country. (For more information visit: www.theboxshow.org). Equipped with that experience, I am transitioning to the web series format to create comedy, and I would be incredibly grateful for your support. 

How will 'CHARACTERISTICALLY' use these donations? 

Filming is expensive, and any contributions we receive will help us immensely.  We are raising money to help pay for: 

  • A cinematographer: $2,000
  • Sound Equipment and Fees: $2,000
  • An Editor; $1,000
  • Locations: $800
  • TOTAL: $5,800

Your contributions will go toward offsetting some of these costs! 

Other Ways To Help

If you can't contribute financially, there are many other ways you can help!

  • You can share this campaign to raise awareness and generate buzz for the project! 
  • You can volunteer your time as a PA on set if that is of interest to you! (leave a comment and I will reach out!) 
  • You can help us find locations! We are still looking for a neutral  'Audition room' space, a coffee shop set up, and a studio apartment. If you can help us with finding any of those locations, please let us know! :) 
  • You can send us good energy as we attempt to complete this project! :) 

Thank you for your support of Characteristically!  It means the world!
