story:
On Keith (Season 2 Docuseries)

Season 1 of the On Keith docuseries was hugely successful with the release of 8 inspiring interviews.  Season 2 is just waiting to be launched but needs funds to complete the editing. 

  • Theresa Robbins Dudeck, PhD, and Alicia Robbins, are the co-creators and producers behind the docuseries.  Theresa has taught improvisation and applied improvisation all over the world. She is a Fulbright Scholar and considered one of the foremost teachers of Keith Johnstone's Impro System. Theresa wrote the critically acclaimed Keith Johnstone: A Critical Biography (Bloomsbury 2013), serves as Johnstone’s Literary Executor, and is co-editor of two books on applied improvisation: Applied Improvisation: Leading, Collaborating, and Creating Beyond the Theatre (2018) and The Applied Improvisation Mindset (forthcoming 2021).  Her sister, Alicia Robbins, holds the record for being the first female cinematographer to shoot a Shondaland series.  Robbins was the lead DP on Grey’s Anatomy season 17, after also having shot season 16.  Her next venture will be one of the alternating DPs for a new Netflix series (still undisclosed).  She has been working as a cinematographer in Los Angeles for the past 17 years and filmed most of the content for the On Keith docuseries.  Theresa and Alicia also partnered with Dan O'Connor as a Co-Producer.  Dan was the Artistic Director and Co-Founder of the critically acclaimed LA based Impro Theatre. He is also a co-founder of BATS Improv in San Francisco. He directed the critically acclaimed hybrid sit-coms Sons and Daughters for ABC, and Campus Ladies for the Oxygen Network. He was a writer and the improv director for The Wayne Brady Show on ABC and co-created the improv comedy television show World Cup Comedy for NBC/PAX.  
  • There are many more interviews that are just waiting to be released!  The editing process can take time and money and funds are needed to release a Season 2.  
  • Some of the interviews and clips you can look forward to in Season 2 are interviews by Joel McHale, Jack Shepherd, Randy Dixon, Dan O'Connor, Derek Flores, Mariana Muniz and the Theatre Machine reunion with many of its original members at the Royal Court Theatre!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what we need:

  • $5000 will help us get the 8 interviews we have already shot edited (Approximately 200 hours of work).  Also, we may be able to shoot one more interview for the season!  The funds will help us pay for minimal crew and equipment for the interview. 
  • Anyone who donates $500 or more will get a co-producer credit! $100 to $499 will be part of the Special Thanks in the credits. 
  • If we don't raiser our entire $5000, we will still launch as many interviews we can that are within the means of the funds that were raised.  

Keith Johnstone Legacy

  • Keith Johnstone's legacy is important to many artists and improvisers around the world. Hearing the stories of those impacted by his work is a way to carry on his legacy.

Risks & Challenges

  • Since we have already filmed 8 more interviews, there isn't much risk involved!  We just got to get them into the editing suite for completion!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please watch the episodes of Season One at www.onkeith.com

story:
What is Into You?

Into You is a dramedy (Drama-Comedy) that follows our main character, Maya Russell, after a reality-shattering breakup. In order to defer her grief and jumpstart her dreams of becoming an idealized version of herself Maya resolves to complete a list of rather humorous tasks.

Meet Our Team!

Our Purpose

The media often tells the story of the alone,  broken-hearted girl. But, there is a lack of content that explores the often sloppy but growth inducing journey of establishing a new normal and being single. The purpose of Into You is to highlight the opportunity that lies within shifting one’s energy back into into themselves.

Key Budget Breakdown

Locations: While a daunting task, we are planning to use a multitude of locations (both on & off campus) over the course of two shoot weekends. These funds will help us pay for location fees and city film permits.

Production Design: In a matter of days, we will transform multi-purpose rooms into nightclubs, closets into jail cells and classrooms into therapists offices. Your support will provide us with the resources to authentically dress these spaces and bring our vision to life!

Transportation: For our off-campus shoots we will be transporting 20+ crew members (and all of our equipment) all over the city! These funds will also allow our crew the ability to travel to and from our prop warehouse. 

Original Soundtrack: We have developed a partnership with LA-based musician Gingerr Rust! Gingerr is an incredibly versatile artist who pairs jazz and R&B influences with a unique beachy undertone. Gingerr and our creative producer have developed an original soundtrack for Into You!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for supporting our project! If you can't donate, please share this campaign, like us on Facebook or sign up for our Newsletter!

story:
Hello World,

My name is Suzie Hicks. I'm a senior at Emerson College looking to make science fun and accessible for students of a school that doesn't offer it as a major. I grew up watching Bill Nye, and rapidly developed a love for the mind-blowing truth of science. Over the last year, as the climate has (wait for it) CHANGED and our administration has moved towards less scientific education for the public, I began to think of ways to make the important facts fun and relatable so that younger demographics can feel empowered to make a change. And thus emerged Suzie Hicks the Science Chick! SHSC is a feminist TV show laughing at the livelihood of college students (parties, dating, family, and careers) while giving helpful alternatives to potentially unsustainable practices.

What We Need

To make SHSC happen, we will be traveling to places like the New England Aquarium, the Museum of Science and multiple farms across Massachusetts to get footage, and will be doing segments about parties and social life on campus. 

We are looking for funding to cover the cost of:

  • Props
  • Costumes
  • Transportation
  • Publicity

All proceeds left over from production will be donated to Mass Audobon, a local environmental non-profit encouraging the love of nature in young people.

If you are unable to donate, don't worry! All we ask is that you share our message, share this campaign or just watch the final product when it comes out. Your support in any capacity means a whole lot.
